    1591              : // TODO(EDev): Adding C++20's [[likely]] and [[unlikely]] attributes might be useful
    1592              : #if defined(__GNUG__) || defined(__clang__)
    1593              : #define CROW_LIKELY(X) __builtin_expect(!!(X), 1)
    1594              : #define CROW_UNLIKELY(X) __builtin_expect(!!(X), 0)
    1595              : #else
    1596              : #define CROW_LIKELY(X) (X)
    1597              : #define CROW_UNLIKELY(X) (X)
    1598              : #endif
    1599              : 
    1600              : namespace crow
    1601              : {
    1602              :     /// @cond SKIP
    1603              :     namespace black_magic
    1604              :     {
    1605              : #ifndef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
    1606              :         /// Out of Range Exception for const_str
    1607              :         struct OutOfRange
    1608              :         {
    1609              :             OutOfRange(unsigned /*pos*/, unsigned /*length*/) {}
    1610              :         };
    1611              :         /// Helper function to throw an exception if i is larger than len
    1612              :         constexpr unsigned requires_in_range(unsigned i, unsigned len)
    1613              :         {
    1614              :             return i >= len ? throw OutOfRange(i, len) : i;
    1615              :         }
    1616              : 
    1617              :         /// A constant string implementation.
    1618              :         class const_str
    1619              :         {
    1620              :             const char* const begin_;
    1621              :             unsigned size_;
    1622              : 
    1623              :         public:
    1624              :             template<unsigned N>
    1625              :             constexpr const_str(const char (&arr)[N]):
    1626              :               begin_(arr), size_(N - 1)
    1627              :             {
    1628              :                 static_assert(N >= 1, "not a string literal");
    1629              :             }
    1630              :             constexpr char operator[](unsigned i) const
    1631              :             {
    1632              :                 return requires_in_range(i, size_), begin_[i];
    1633              :             }
    1634              : 
    1635              :             constexpr operator const char*() const
    1636              :             {
    1637              :                 return begin_;
    1638              :             }
    1639              : 
    1640              :             constexpr const char* begin() const { return begin_; }
    1641              :             constexpr const char* end() const { return begin_ + size_; }
    1642              : 
    1643              :             constexpr unsigned size() const
    1644              :             {
    1645              :                 return size_;
    1646              :             }
    1647              :         };
    1648              : 
    1649              :         constexpr unsigned find_closing_tag(const_str s, unsigned p)
    1650              :         {
    1651              :             return s[p] == '>' ? p : find_closing_tag(s, p + 1);
    1652              :         }
    1653              : 
    1654              :         /// Check that the CROW_ROUTE string is valid
    1655              :         constexpr bool is_valid(const_str s, unsigned i = 0, int f = 0)
    1656              :         {
    1657              :             return i == s.size()   ? f == 0 :
    1658              :                    f < 0 || f >= 2 ? false :
    1659              :                    s[i] == '<'     ? is_valid(s, i + 1, f + 1) :
    1660              :                    s[i] == '>'     ? is_valid(s, i + 1, f - 1) :
    1661              :                                      is_valid(s, i + 1, f);
    1662              :         }
    1663              : 
    1664              :         constexpr bool is_equ_p(const char* a, const char* b, unsigned n)
    1665              :         {
    1666              :             return *a == 0 && *b == 0 && n == 0 ? true :
    1667              :                    (*a == 0 || *b == 0)         ? false :
    1668              :                    n == 0                       ? true :
    1669              :                    *a != *b                     ? false :
    1670              :                                                   is_equ_p(a + 1, b + 1, n - 1);
    1671              :         }
    1672              : 
    1673              :         constexpr bool is_equ_n(const_str a, unsigned ai, const_str b, unsigned bi, unsigned n)
    1674              :         {
    1675              :             return ai + n > a.size() || bi + n > b.size() ? false :
    1676              :                    n == 0                                 ? true :
    1677              :                    a[ai] != b[bi]                         ? false :
    1678              :                                                             is_equ_n(a, ai + 1, b, bi + 1, n - 1);
    1679              :         }
    1680              : 
    1681              :         constexpr bool is_int(const_str s, unsigned i)
    1682              :         {
    1683              :             return is_equ_n(s, i, "<int>", 0, 5);
    1684              :         }
    1685              : 
    1686              :         constexpr bool is_uint(const_str s, unsigned i)
    1687              :         {
    1688              :             return is_equ_n(s, i, "<uint>", 0, 6);
    1689              :         }
    1690              : 
    1691              :         constexpr bool is_float(const_str s, unsigned i)
    1692              :         {
    1693              :             return is_equ_n(s, i, "<float>", 0, 7) ||
    1694              :                    is_equ_n(s, i, "<double>", 0, 8);
    1695              :         }
    1696              : 
    1697              :         constexpr bool is_str(const_str s, unsigned i)
    1698              :         {
    1699              :             return is_equ_n(s, i, "<str>", 0, 5) ||
    1700              :                    is_equ_n(s, i, "<string>", 0, 8);
    1701              :         }
    1702              : 
    1703              :         constexpr bool is_path(const_str s, unsigned i)
    1704              :         {
    1705              :             return is_equ_n(s, i, "<path>", 0, 6);
    1706              :         }
    1707              : #endif
    1708              :         template<typename T>
    1709              :         struct parameter_tag
    1710              :         {
    1711              :             static const int value = 0;
    1712              :         };
    1713              : #define CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(t, i) \
    1714              :     template<>                            \
    1715              :     struct parameter_tag<t>               \
    1716              :     {                                     \
    1717              :         static const int value = i;       \
    1718              :     }
    1719              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(int, 1);
    1720              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(char, 1);
    1721              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(short, 1);
    1722              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(long, 1);
    1723              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(long long, 1);
    1724              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned int, 2);
    1725              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned char, 2);
    1726              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned short, 2);
    1727              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned long, 2);
    1728              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned long long, 2);
    1729              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(double, 3);
    1730              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(std::string, 4);
    1731              : #undef CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG
    1732              :         template<typename... Args>
    1733              :         struct compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list;
    1734              : 
    1735              :         template<>
    1736              :         struct compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<>
    1737              :         {
    1738              :             static const int value = 0;
    1739              :         };
    1740              : 
    1741              :         template<typename Arg, typename... Args>
    1742              :         struct compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<Arg, Args...>
    1743              :         {
    1744              :             static const int sub_value =
    1745              :               compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<Args...>::value;
    1746              :             static const int value =
    1747              :               parameter_tag<typename std::decay<Arg>::type>::value ? sub_value * 6 + parameter_tag<typename std::decay<Arg>::type>::value : sub_value;
    1748              :         };
    1749              : 
    1750              :         static inline bool is_parameter_tag_compatible(uint64_t a, uint64_t b)
    1751              :         {
    1752              :             if (a == 0)
    1753              :                 return b == 0;
    1754              :             if (b == 0)
    1755              :                 return a == 0;
    1756              :             int sa = a % 6;
    1757              :             int sb = a % 6;
    1758              :             if (sa == 5) sa = 4;
    1759              :             if (sb == 5) sb = 4;
    1760              :             if (sa != sb)
    1761              :                 return false;
    1762              :             return is_parameter_tag_compatible(a / 6, b / 6);
    1763              :         }
    1764              : 
    1765              :         static inline unsigned find_closing_tag_runtime(const char* s, unsigned p)
    1766              :         {
    1767              :             return s[p] == 0   ? throw std::runtime_error("unmatched tag <") :
    1768              :                    s[p] == '>' ? p :
    1769              :                                  find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p + 1);
    1770              :         }
    1771              : 
    1772              :         static inline uint64_t get_parameter_tag_runtime(const char* s, unsigned p = 0)
    1773              :         {
    1774              :             return s[p] == 0   ? 0 :
    1775              :                    s[p] == '<' ? (
    1776              :                                    std::strncmp(s + p, "<int>", 5) == 0  ? get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 1 :
    1777              :                                    std::strncmp(s + p, "<uint>", 6) == 0 ? get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 2 :
    1778              :                                    (std::strncmp(s + p, "<float>", 7) == 0 ||
    1779              :                                     std::strncmp(s + p, "<double>", 8) == 0) ?
    1780              :                                                                            get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 3 :
    1781              :                                    (std::strncmp(s + p, "<str>", 5) == 0 ||
    1782              :                                     std::strncmp(s + p, "<string>", 8) == 0) ?
    1783              :                                                                            get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 4 :
    1784              :                                    std::strncmp(s + p, "<path>", 6) == 0 ? get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 5 :
    1785              :                                                                            throw std::runtime_error("invalid parameter type")) :
    1786              :                                  get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, p + 1);
    1787              :         }
    1788              : #ifndef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
    1789              :         constexpr uint64_t get_parameter_tag(const_str s, unsigned p = 0)
    1790              :         {
    1791              :             return p == s.size() ? 0 :
    1792              :                    s[p] == '<'   ? (
    1793              :                                    is_int(s, p)   ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 1 :
    1794              :                                      is_uint(s, p)  ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 2 :
    1795              :                                      is_float(s, p) ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 3 :
    1796              :                                      is_str(s, p)   ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 4 :
    1797              :                                      is_path(s, p)  ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 5 :
    1798              :                                                       throw std::runtime_error("invalid parameter type")) :
    1799              :                                  get_parameter_tag(s, p + 1);
    1800              :         }
    1801              : #endif
    1802              : 
    1803              :         template<typename... T>
    1804              :         struct S
    1805              :         {
    1806              :             template<typename U>
    1807              :             using push = S<U, T...>;
    1808              :             template<typename U>
    1809              :             using push_back = S<T..., U>;
    1810              :             template<template<typename... Args> class U>
    1811              :             using rebind = U<T...>;
    1812              :         };
    1813              : 
    1814              :         // Check whether the template function can be called with specific arguments
    1815              :         template<typename F, typename Set>
    1816              :         struct CallHelper;
    1817              :         template<typename F, typename... Args>
    1818              :         struct CallHelper<F, S<Args...>>
    1819              :         {
    1820              :             template<typename F1, typename... Args1, typename = decltype(std::declval<F1>()(std::declval<Args1>()...))>
    1821              :             static char __test(int);
    1822              : 
    1823              :             template<typename...>
    1824              :             static int __test(...);
    1825              : 
    1826              :             static constexpr bool value = sizeof(__test<F, Args...>(0)) == sizeof(char);
    1827              :         };
    1828              : 
    1829              :         // Check Tuple contains type T
    1830              :         template<typename T, typename Tuple>
    1831              :         struct has_type;
    1832              : 
    1833              :         template<typename T>
    1834              :         struct has_type<T, std::tuple<>> : std::false_type
    1835              :         {};
    1836              : 
    1837              :         template<typename T, typename U, typename... Ts>
    1838              :         struct has_type<T, std::tuple<U, Ts...>> : has_type<T, std::tuple<Ts...>>
    1839              :         {};
    1840              : 
    1841              :         template<typename T, typename... Ts>
    1842              :         struct has_type<T, std::tuple<T, Ts...>> : std::true_type
    1843              :         {};
    1844              : 
    1845              :         // Find index of type in tuple
    1846              :         template<class T, class Tuple>
    1847              :         struct tuple_index;
    1848              : 
    1849              :         template<class T, class... Types>
    1850              :         struct tuple_index<T, std::tuple<T, Types...>>
    1851              :         {
    1852              :             static const int value = 0;
    1853              :         };
    1854              : 
    1855              :         template<class T, class U, class... Types>
    1856              :         struct tuple_index<T, std::tuple<U, Types...>>
    1857              :         {
    1858              :             static const int value = 1 + tuple_index<T, std::tuple<Types...>>::value;
    1859              :         };
    1860              : 
    1861              :         // Extract element from forward tuple or get default
    1862              :         template<typename T, typename Tup>
    1863              :         typename std::enable_if<has_type<T&, Tup>::value, typename std::decay<T>::type&&>::type
    1864              :           tuple_extract(Tup& tup)
    1865              :         {
    1866              :             return std::move(std::get<T&>(tup));
    1867              :         }
    1868              : 
    1869              :         template<typename T, typename Tup>
    1870              :         typename std::enable_if<!has_type<T&, Tup>::value, T>::type
    1871              :           tuple_extract(Tup&)
    1872              :         {
    1873              :             return T{};
    1874              :         }
    1875              : 
    1876              :         // Kind of fold expressions in C++11
    1877              :         template<bool...>
    1878              :         struct bool_pack;
    1879              :         template<bool... bs>
    1880              :         using all_true = std::is_same<bool_pack<bs..., true>, bool_pack<true, bs...>>;
    1881              : 
    1882              :         template<int N>
    1883              :         struct single_tag_to_type
    1884              :         {};
    1885              : 
    1886              :         template<>
    1887              :         struct single_tag_to_type<1>
    1888              :         {
    1889              :             using type = int64_t;
    1890              :         };
    1891              : 
    1892              :         template<>
    1893              :         struct single_tag_to_type<2>
    1894              :         {
    1895              :             using type = uint64_t;
    1896              :         };
    1897              : 
    1898              :         template<>
    1899              :         struct single_tag_to_type<3>
    1900              :         {
    1901              :             using type = double;
    1902              :         };
    1903              : 
    1904              :         template<>
    1905              :         struct single_tag_to_type<4>
    1906              :         {
    1907              :             using type = std::string;
    1908              :         };
    1909              : 
    1910              :         template<>
    1911              :         struct single_tag_to_type<5>
    1912              :         {
    1913              :             using type = std::string;
    1914              :         };
    1915              : 
    1916              : 
    1917              :         template<uint64_t Tag>
    1918              :         struct arguments
    1919              :         {
    1920              :             using subarguments = typename arguments<Tag / 6>::type;
    1921              :             using type =
    1922              :               typename subarguments::template push<typename single_tag_to_type<Tag % 6>::type>;
    1923              :         };
    1924              : 
    1925              :         template<>
    1926              :         struct arguments<0>
    1927              :         {
    1928              :             using type = S<>;
    1929              :         };
    1930              : 
    1931              :         template<typename... T>
    1932              :         struct last_element_type
    1933              :         {
    1934              :             using type = typename std::tuple_element<sizeof...(T) - 1, std::tuple<T...>>::type;
    1935              :         };
    1936              : 
    1937              : 
    1938              :         template<>
    1939              :         struct last_element_type<>
    1940              :         {};
    1941              : 
    1942              : 
    1943              :         // from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13072359/c11-compile-time-array-with-logarithmic-evaluation-depth
    1944              :         template<class T>
    1945              :         using Invoke = typename T::type;
    1946              : 
    1947              :         template<unsigned...>
    1948              :         struct seq
    1949              :         {
    1950              :             using type = seq;
    1951              :         };
    1952              : 
    1953              :         template<class S1, class S2>
    1954              :         struct concat;
    1955              : 
    1956              :         template<unsigned... I1, unsigned... I2>
    1957              :         struct concat<seq<I1...>, seq<I2...>> : seq<I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)...>
    1958              :         {};
    1959              : 
    1960              :         template<class S1, class S2>
    1961              :         using Concat = Invoke<concat<S1, S2>>;
    1962              : 
    1963              :         template<unsigned N>
    1964              :         struct gen_seq;
    1965              :         template<unsigned N>
    1966              :         using GenSeq = Invoke<gen_seq<N>>;
    1967              : 
    1968              :         template<unsigned N>
    1969              :         struct gen_seq : Concat<GenSeq<N / 2>, GenSeq<N - N / 2>>
    1970              :         {};
    1971              : 
    1972              :         template<>
    1973              :         struct gen_seq<0> : seq<>
    1974              :         {};
    1975              :         template<>
    1976              :         struct gen_seq<1> : seq<0>
    1977              :         {};
    1978              : 
    1979              :         template<typename Seq, typename Tuple>
    1980              :         struct pop_back_helper;
    1981              : 
    1982              :         template<unsigned... N, typename Tuple>
    1983              :         struct pop_back_helper<seq<N...>, Tuple>
    1984              :         {
    1985              :             template<template<typename... Args> class U>
    1986              :             using rebind = U<typename std::tuple_element<N, Tuple>::type...>;
    1987              :         };
    1988              : 
    1989              :         template<typename... T>
    1990              :         struct pop_back //: public pop_back_helper<typename gen_seq<sizeof...(T)-1>::type, std::tuple<T...>>
    1991              :         {
    1992              :             template<template<typename... Args> class U>
    1993              :             using rebind = typename pop_back_helper<typename gen_seq<sizeof...(T) - 1>::type, std::tuple<T...>>::template rebind<U>;
    1994              :         };
    1995              : 
    1996              :         template<>
    1997              :         struct pop_back<>
    1998              :         {
    1999              :             template<template<typename... Args> class U>
    2000              :             using rebind = U<>;
    2001              :         };
    2002              : 
    2003              :         // from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2118541/check-if-c0x-parameter-pack-contains-a-type
    2004              :         template<typename Tp, typename... List>
    2005              :         struct contains : std::true_type
    2006              :         {};
    2007              : 
    2008              :         template<typename Tp, typename Head, typename... Rest>
    2009              :         struct contains<Tp, Head, Rest...> : std::conditional<std::is_same<Tp, Head>::value, std::true_type, contains<Tp, Rest...>>::type
    2010              :         {};
    2011              : 
    2012              :         template<typename Tp>
    2013              :         struct contains<Tp> : std::false_type
    2014              :         {};
    2015              : 
    2016              :         template<typename T>
    2017              :         struct empty_context
    2018              :         {};
    2019              : 
    2020              :         template<typename T>
    2021              :         struct promote
    2022              :         {
    2023              :             using type = T;
    2024              :         };
    2025              : 
    2026              : #define CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(t1, t2) \
    2027              :     template<>                             \
    2028              :     struct promote<t1>                     \
    2029              :     {                                      \
    2030              :         using type = t2;                   \
    2031              :     }
    2032              : 
    2033              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(char, int64_t);
    2034              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(short, int64_t);
    2035              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(int, int64_t);
    2036              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(long, int64_t);
    2037              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(long long, int64_t);
    2038              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned char, uint64_t);
    2039              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned short, uint64_t);
    2040              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned int, uint64_t);
    2041              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned long, uint64_t);
    2042              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned long long, uint64_t);
    2043              :         CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(float, double);
    2044              : #undef CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE
    2045              : 
    2046              :         template<typename T>
    2047              :         using promote_t = typename promote<T>::type;
    2048              : 
    2049              :     } // namespace black_magic
    2050              : 
    2051              :     namespace detail
    2052              :     {
    2053              : 
    2054              :         template<class T, std::size_t N, class... Args>
    2055              :         struct get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl
    2056              :         {
    2057              :             static constexpr auto value = N;
    2058              :         };
    2059              : 
    2060              :         template<class T, std::size_t N, class... Args>
    2061              :         struct get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, N, T, Args...>
    2062              :         {
    2063              :             static constexpr auto value = N;
    2064              :         };
    2065              : 
    2066              :         template<class T, std::size_t N, class U, class... Args>
    2067              :         struct get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, N, U, Args...>
    2068              :         {
    2069              :             static constexpr auto value = get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, N + 1, Args...>::value;
    2070              :         };
    2071              :     } // namespace detail
    2072              : 
    2073              :     namespace utility
    2074              :     {
    2075              :         template<class T, class... Args>
    2076              :         T& get_element_by_type(std::tuple<Args...>& t)
    2077              :         {
    2078              :             return std::get<detail::get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, 0, Args...>::value>(t);
    2079              :         }
    2080              : 
    2081              :         template<typename T>
    2082              :         struct function_traits;
    2083              : 
    2084              : #ifndef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
    2085              :         template<typename T>
    2086              :         struct function_traits : public function_traits<decltype(&T::operator())>
    2087              :         {
    2088              :             using parent_t = function_traits<decltype(&T::operator())>;
    2089              :             static const size_t arity = parent_t::arity;
    2090              :             using result_type = typename parent_t::result_type;
    2091              :             template<size_t i>
    2092              :             using arg = typename parent_t::template arg<i>;
    2093              :         };
    2094              : #endif
    2095              : 
    2096              :         template<typename ClassType, typename R, typename... Args>
    2097              :         struct function_traits<R (ClassType::*)(Args...) const>
    2098              :         {
    2099              :             static const size_t arity = sizeof...(Args);
    2100              : 
    2101              :             typedef R result_type;
    2102              : 
    2103              :             template<size_t i>
    2104              :             using arg = typename std::tuple_element<i, std::tuple<Args...>>::type;
    2105              :         };
    2106              : 
    2107              :         template<typename ClassType, typename R, typename... Args>
    2108              :         struct function_traits<R (ClassType::*)(Args...)>
    2109              :         {
    2110              :             static const size_t arity = sizeof...(Args);
    2111              : 
    2112              :             typedef R result_type;
    2113              : 
    2114              :             template<size_t i>
    2115              :             using arg = typename std::tuple_element<i, std::tuple<Args...>>::type;
    2116              :         };
    2117              : 
    2118              :         template<typename R, typename... Args>
    2119              :         struct function_traits<std::function<R(Args...)>>
    2120              :         {
    2121              :             static const size_t arity = sizeof...(Args);
    2122              : 
    2123              :             typedef R result_type;
    2124              : 
    2125              :             template<size_t i>
    2126              :             using arg = typename std::tuple_element<i, std::tuple<Args...>>::type;
    2127              :         };
    2128              :         /// @endcond
    2129              : 
    2130              :         inline static std::string base64encode(const unsigned char* data, size_t size, const char* key = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/")
    2131              :         {
    2132              :             std::string ret;
    2133              :             ret.resize((size + 2) / 3 * 4);
    2134              :             auto it = ret.begin();
    2135              :             while (size >= 3)
    2136              :             {
    2137              :                 *it++ = key[(static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xFC) >> 2];
    2138              :                 unsigned char h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x03) << 4;
    2139              :                 *it++ = key[h | ((static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xF0) >> 4)];
    2140              :                 h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x0F) << 2;
    2141              :                 *it++ = key[h | ((static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xC0) >> 6)];
    2142              :                 *it++ = key[static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x3F];
    2143              : 
    2144              :                 size -= 3;
    2145              :             }
    2146              :             if (size == 1)
    2147              :             {
    2148              :                 *it++ = key[(static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xFC) >> 2];
    2149              :                 unsigned char h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x03) << 4;
    2150              :                 *it++ = key[h];
    2151              :                 *it++ = '=';
    2152              :                 *it++ = '=';
    2153              :             }
    2154              :             else if (size == 2)
    2155              :             {
    2156              :                 *it++ = key[(static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xFC) >> 2];
    2157              :                 unsigned char h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x03) << 4;
    2158              :                 *it++ = key[h | ((static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xF0) >> 4)];
    2159              :                 h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x0F) << 2;
    2160              :                 *it++ = key[h];
    2161              :                 *it++ = '=';
    2162              :             }
    2163              :             return ret;
    2164              :         }
    2165              : 
    2166              :         inline static std::string base64encode(std::string data, size_t size, const char* key = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/")
    2167              :         {
    2168              :             return base64encode((const unsigned char*)data.c_str(), size, key);
    2169              :         }
    2170              : 
    2171              :         inline static std::string base64encode_urlsafe(const unsigned char* data, size_t size)
    2172              :         {
    2173              :             return base64encode(data, size, "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789-_");
    2174              :         }
    2175              : 
    2176              :         inline static std::string base64encode_urlsafe(std::string data, size_t size)
    2177              :         {
    2178              :             return base64encode((const unsigned char*)data.c_str(), size, "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789-_");
    2179              :         }
    2180              : 
    2181              :         inline static std::string base64decode(const char* data, size_t size)
    2182              :         {
    2183              :             // We accept both regular and url encoding here, as there does not seem to be any downside to that.
    2184              :             // If we want to distinguish that we should use +/ for non-url and -_ for url.
    2185              : 
    2186              :             // Mapping logic from characters to [0-63]
    2187              :             auto key = [](char c) -> unsigned char {
    2188              :                 if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) return c - 'A';
    2189              :                 if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) return c - 'a' + 26;
    2190              :                 if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) return c - '0' + 52;
    2191              :                 if ((c == '+') || (c == '-')) return 62;
    2192              :                 if ((c == '/') || (c == '_')) return 63;
    2193              :                 return 0;
    2194              :             };
    2195              : 
    2196              :             // Not padded
    2197              :             if (size % 4 == 2)             // missing last 2 characters
    2198              :                 size = (size / 4 * 3) + 1; // Not subtracting extra characters because they're truncated in int division
    2199              :             else if (size % 4 == 3)        // missing last character
    2200              :                 size = (size / 4 * 3) + 2; // Not subtracting extra characters because they're truncated in int division
    2201              : 
    2202              :             // Padded
    2203              :             else if (size >= 2 && data[size - 2] == '=') // padded with '=='
    2204              :                 size = (size / 4 * 3) - 2;               // == padding means the last block only has 1 character instead of 3, hence the '-2'
    2205              :             else if (size >= 1 && data[size - 1] == '=') // padded with '='
    2206              :                 size = (size / 4 * 3) - 1;               // = padding means the last block only has 2 character instead of 3, hence the '-1'
    2207              : 
    2208              :             // Padding not needed
    2209              :             else
    2210              :                 size = size / 4 * 3;
    2211              : 
    2212              :             std::string ret;
    2213              :             ret.resize(size);
    2214              :             auto it = ret.begin();
    2215              : 
    2216              :             // These will be used to decode 1 character at a time
    2217              :             unsigned char odd;  // char1 and char3
    2218              :             unsigned char even; // char2 and char4
    2219              : 
    2220              :             // Take 4 character blocks to turn into 3
    2221              :             while (size >= 3)
    2222              :             {
    2223              :                 // dec_char1 = (char1 shifted 2 bits to the left) OR ((char2 AND 00110000) shifted 4 bits to the right))
    2224              :                 odd = key(*data++);
    2225              :                 even = key(*data++);
    2226              :                 *it++ = (odd << 2) | ((even & 0x30) >> 4);
    2227              :                 // dec_char2 = ((char2 AND 00001111) shifted 4 bits left) OR ((char3 AND 00111100) shifted 2 bits right))
    2228              :                 odd = key(*data++);
    2229              :                 *it++ = ((even & 0x0F) << 4) | ((odd & 0x3C) >> 2);
    2230              :                 // dec_char3 = ((char3 AND 00000011) shifted 6 bits left) OR (char4)
    2231              :                 even = key(*data++);
    2232              :                 *it++ = ((odd & 0x03) << 6) | (even);
    2233              : 
    2234              :                 size -= 3;
    2235              :             }
    2236              :             if (size == 2)
    2237              :             {
    2238              :                 // d_char1 = (char1 shifted 2 bits to the left) OR ((char2 AND 00110000) shifted 4 bits to the right))
    2239              :                 odd = key(*data++);
    2240              :                 even = key(*data++);
    2241              :                 *it++ = (odd << 2) | ((even & 0x30) >> 4);
    2242              :                 // d_char2 = ((char2 AND 00001111) shifted 4 bits left) OR ((char3 AND 00111100) shifted 2 bits right))
    2243              :                 odd = key(*data++);
    2244              :                 *it++ = ((even & 0x0F) << 4) | ((odd & 0x3C) >> 2);
    2245              :             }
    2246              :             else if (size == 1)
    2247              :             {
    2248              :                 // d_char1 = (char1 shifted 2 bits to the left) OR ((char2 AND 00110000) shifted 4 bits to the right))
    2249              :                 odd = key(*data++);
    2250              :                 even = key(*data++);
    2251              :                 *it++ = (odd << 2) | ((even & 0x30) >> 4);
    2252              :             }
    2253              :             return ret;
    2254              :         }
    2255              : 
    2256              :         inline static std::string base64decode(const std::string& data, size_t size)
    2257              :         {
    2258              :             return base64decode(data.data(), size);
    2259              :         }
    2260              : 
    2261              :         inline static std::string base64decode(const std::string& data)
    2262              :         {
    2263              :             return base64decode(data.data(), data.length());
    2264              :         }
    2265              : 
    2266              :         inline static std::string normalize_path(const std::string& directoryPath)
    2267              :         {
    2268              :             std::string normalizedPath = directoryPath;
    2269              :             std::replace(normalizedPath.begin(), normalizedPath.end(), '\\', '/');
    2270              :             if (!normalizedPath.empty() && normalizedPath.back() != '/')
    2271              :                 normalizedPath += '/';
    2272              :             return normalizedPath;
    2273              :         }
    2274              : 
    2275              :         inline static void sanitize_filename(std::string& data, char replacement = '_')
    2276              :         {
    2277              :             if (data.length() > 255)
    2278              :                 data.resize(255);
    2279              : 
    2280              :             static const auto toUpper = [](char c) {
    2281              :                 return ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) ? (c - ('a' - 'A')) : c;
    2282              :             };
    2283              :             // Check for special device names. The Windows behavior is really odd here, it will consider both AUX and AUX.txt
    2284              :             // a special device. Thus we search for the string (case-insensitive), and then check if the string ends or if
    2285              :             // is has a dangerous follow up character (.:\/)
    2286              :             auto sanitizeSpecialFile = [](std::string& source, unsigned ofs, const char* pattern, bool includeNumber, char replacement_) {
    2287              :                 unsigned i = ofs;
    2288              :                 size_t len = source.length();
    2289              :                 const char* p = pattern;
    2290              :                 while (*p)
    2291              :                 {
    2292              :                     if (i >= len) return;
    2293              :                     if (toUpper(source[i]) != *p) return;
    2294              :                     ++i;
    2295              :                     ++p;
    2296              :                 }
    2297              :                 if (includeNumber)
    2298              :                 {
    2299              :                     if ((i >= len) || (source[i] < '1') || (source[i] > '9')) return;
    2300              :                     ++i;
    2301              :                 }
    2302              :                 if ((i >= len) || (source[i] == '.') || (source[i] == ':') || (source[i] == '/') || (source[i] == '\\'))
    2303              :                 {
    2304              :                     source.erase(ofs + 1, (i - ofs) - 1);
    2305              :                     source[ofs] = replacement_;
    2306              :                 }
    2307              :             };
    2308              :             bool checkForSpecialEntries = true;
    2309              :             for (unsigned i = 0; i < data.length(); ++i)
    2310              :             {
    2311              :                 // Recognize directory traversals and the special devices CON/PRN/AUX/NULL/COM[1-]/LPT[1-9]
    2312              :                 if (checkForSpecialEntries)
    2313              :                 {
    2314              :                     checkForSpecialEntries = false;
    2315              :                     switch (toUpper(data[i]))
    2316              :                     {
    2317              :                         case 'A':
    2318              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "AUX", false, replacement);
    2319              :                             break;
    2320              :                         case 'C':
    2321              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "CON", false, replacement);
    2322              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "COM", true, replacement);
    2323              :                             break;
    2324              :                         case 'L':
    2325              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "LPT", true, replacement);
    2326              :                             break;
    2327              :                         case 'N':
    2328              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "NUL", false, replacement);
    2329              :                             break;
    2330              :                         case 'P':
    2331              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "PRN", false, replacement);
    2332              :                             break;
    2333              :                         case '.':
    2334              :                             sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "..", false, replacement);
    2335              :                             break;
    2336              :                     }
    2337              :                 }
    2338              : 
    2339              :                 // Sanitize individual characters
    2340              :                 unsigned char c = data[i];
    2341              :                 if ((c < ' ') || ((c >= 0x80) && (c <= 0x9F)) || (c == '?') || (c == '<') || (c == '>') || (c == ':') || (c == '*') || (c == '|') || (c == '\"'))
    2342              :                 {
    2343              :                     data[i] = replacement;
    2344              :                 }
    2345              :                 else if ((c == '/') || (c == '\\'))
    2346              :                 {
    2347              :                     if (CROW_UNLIKELY(i == 0)) //Prevent Unix Absolute Paths (Windows Absolute Paths are prevented with `(c == ':')`)
    2348              :                     {
    2349              :                         data[i] = replacement;
    2350              :                     }
    2351              :                     else
    2352              :                     {
    2353              :                         checkForSpecialEntries = true;
    2354              :                     }
    2355              :                 }
    2356              :             }
    2357              :         }
    2358              : 
    2359              :         inline static std::string random_alphanum(std::size_t size)
    2360              :         {
    2361              :             static const char alphabet[] = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
    2362              :             std::random_device dev;
    2363              :             std::mt19937 rng(dev());
    2364              :             std::uniform_int_distribution<std::mt19937::result_type> dist(0, sizeof(alphabet) - 2);
    2365              :             std::string out;
    2366              :             out.reserve(size);
    2367              :             for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size; i++)
    2368              :                 out.push_back(alphabet[dist(rng)]);
    2369              :             return out;
    2370              :         }
    2371              : 
    2372              :         inline static std::string join_path(std::string path, const std::string& fname)
    2373              :         {
    2374              :             return (std::filesystem::path(path) / fname).string();
    2375              :         }
    2376              : 
    2377              :         /**
    2378              :          * @brief Checks two string for equality.
    2379              :          * Always returns false if strings differ in size.
    2380              :          * Defaults to case-insensitive comparison.
    2381              :          */
    2382              :         inline static bool string_equals(const std::string_view l, const std::string_view r, bool case_sensitive = false)
    2383              :         {
    2384              :             if (l.length() != r.length())
    2385              :                 return false;
    2386              : 
    2387              :             for (size_t i = 0; i < l.length(); i++)
    2388              :             {
    2389              :                 if (case_sensitive)
    2390              :                 {
    2391              :                     if (l[i] != r[i])
    2392              :                         return false;
    2393              :                 }
    2394              :                 else
    2395              :                 {
    2396              :                     if (std::toupper(l[i]) != std::toupper(r[i]))
    2397              :                         return false;
    2398              :                 }
    2399              :             }
    2400              : 
    2401              :             return true;
    2402              :         }
    2403              : 
    2404              :         template<typename T, typename U>
    2405              :         inline static T lexical_cast(const U& v)
    2406              :         {
    2407              :             std::stringstream stream;
    2408              :             T res;
    2409              : 
    2410              :             stream << v;
    2411              :             stream >> res;
    2412              : 
    2413              :             return res;
    2414              :         }
    2415              : 
    2416              :         template<typename T>
    2417              :         inline static T lexical_cast(const char* v, size_t count)
    2418              :         {
    2419              :             std::stringstream stream;
    2420              :             T res;
    2421              : 
    2422              :             stream.write(v, count);
    2423              :             stream >> res;
    2424              : 
    2425              :             return res;
    2426              :         }
    2427              : 
    2428              : 
    2429              :         /// Return a copy of the given string with its
    2430              :         /// leading and trailing whitespaces removed.
    2431              :         inline static std::string trim(const std::string& v)
    2432              :         {
    2433              :             if (v.empty())
    2434              :                 return "";
    2435              : 
    2436              :             size_t begin = 0, end = v.length();
    2437              : 
    2438              :             size_t i;
    2439              :             for (i = 0; i < v.length(); i++)
    2440              :             {
    2441              :                 if (!std::isspace(v[i]))
    2442              :                 {
    2443              :                     begin = i;
    2444              :                     break;
    2445              :                 }
    2446              :             }
    2447              : 
    2448              :             if (i == v.length())
    2449              :                 return "";
    2450              : 
    2451              :             for (i = v.length(); i > 0; i--)
    2452              :             {
    2453              :                 if (!std::isspace(v[i - 1]))
    2454              :                 {
    2455              :                     end = i;
    2456              :                     break;
    2457              :                 }
    2458              :             }
    2459              : 
    2460              :             return v.substr(begin, end - begin);
    2461              :         }
    2462              : 
    2463              :         /**
    2464              :          * @brief splits a string based on a separator
    2465              :          */
    2466              :         inline static std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& v, const std::string& separator)
    2467              :         {
    2468              :             std::vector<std::string> result;
    2469              :             size_t startPos = 0;
    2470              : 
    2471              :             for (size_t foundPos = v.find(separator); foundPos != std::string::npos; foundPos = v.find(separator, startPos))
    2472              :             {
    2473              :                 result.push_back(v.substr(startPos, foundPos - startPos));
    2474              :                 startPos = foundPos + separator.size();
    2475              :             }
    2476              : 
    2477              :             result.push_back(v.substr(startPos));
    2478              :             return result;
    2479              :         }
    2480              : 
    2481              :         /**
    2482              :          * @brief Returns the first occurence that matches between two ranges of iterators
    2483              :          * @param first1 begin() iterator of the first range
    2484              :          * @param last1 end() iterator of the first range
    2485              :          * @param first2 begin() iterator of the second range
    2486              :          * @param last2 end() iterator of the second range
    2487              :          * @return first occurence that matches between two ranges of iterators 
    2488              :         */
    2489              :         template<typename Iter1, typename Iter2>
    2490              :         inline static Iter1 find_first_of(Iter1 first1, Iter1 last1, Iter2 first2, Iter2 last2)
    2491              :         {
    2492              :             for (; first1 != last1; ++first1)
    2493              :             {
    2494              :                 if (std::find(first2, last2, *first1) != last2)
    2495              :                 {
    2496              :                     return first1;
    2497              :                 }
    2498              :             }
    2499              :             return last1;
    2500              :         }

    2502              : } // namespace crow
