    5738              : 
    5739              :       case s_dead:
    5740              :         /* this state is used after a 'Connection: close' message
    5741              :          * the parser will error out if it reads another message
    5742              :          */
    5743              :         if (CROW_LIKELY(ch == cr || ch == lf))
    5744              :           break;
    5745              : 
    5746              :         CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_CLOSED_CONNECTION);
    5747              :         goto error;
    5748              : 
    5749              :       case s_start_req:
    5750              :       {
    5751              :         if (ch == cr || ch == lf)
    5752              :           break;
    5753              :         parser->flags = 0;
    5754              :         parser->uses_transfer_encoding = 0;
    5755              :         parser->content_length = CROW_ULLONG_MAX;
    5756              : 
    5757              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_ALPHA(ch))) {
    5758              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
    5759              :           goto error;
    5760              :         }
    5761              : 
    5762              :         parser->method = 0;
    5763              :         parser->index = 1;
    5764              :         switch (ch) {
    5765              :           case 'A': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Acl;                                                              break;
    5766              :           case 'B': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Bind;                                                             break;
    5767              :           case 'C': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Connect;   /* or COPY, CHECKOUT */                                break;
    5768              :           case 'D': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Delete;                                                           break;
    5769              :           case 'G': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Get;                                                              break;
    5770              :           case 'H': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Head;                                                             break;
    5771              :           case 'L': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Lock;      /* or LINK */                                          break;
    5772              :           case 'M': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::MkCol;     /* or MOVE, MKACTIVITY, MERGE, M-SEARCH, MKCALENDAR */ break;
    5773              :           case 'N': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Notify;                                                           break;
    5774              :           case 'O': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Options;                                                          break;
    5775              :           case 'P': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Post;      /* or PROPFIND|PROPPATCH|PUT|PATCH|PURGE */            break;
    5776              :           case 'R': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Report;    /* or REBIND */                                        break;
    5777              :           case 'S': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Subscribe; /* or SEARCH, SOURCE */                                break;
    5778              :           case 'T': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Trace;                                                            break;
    5779              :           case 'U': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Unlock;    /* or UNSUBSCRIBE, UNBIND, UNLINK */                   break;
    5780              :           default:
    5781              :             CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
    5782              :             goto error;
    5783              :         }
    5784              :         parser->state = s_req_method;
    5785              : 
    5786              :         CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_begin);
    5787              : 
    5788              :         break;
    5789              :       }
    5790              : 
    5791              :       case s_req_method:
    5792              :       {
    5793              :         const char *matcher;
    5794              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch == '\0')) {
    5795              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
    5796              :           goto error;
    5797              :         }
    5798              : 
    5799              :         matcher = method_strings[parser->method];
    5800              :         if (ch == ' ' && matcher[parser->index] == '\0') {
    5801              :           parser->state = s_req_spaces_before_url;
    5802              :         } else if (ch == matcher[parser->index]) {
    5803              :           ; /* nada */
    5804              :         } else if ((ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') || ch == '-') {
    5805              : 
    5806              :           switch (parser->method << 16 | parser->index << 8 | ch) {
    5807              : #define CROW_XX(meth, pos, ch, new_meth) \
    5808              :             case ((unsigned)HTTPMethod::meth << 16 | pos << 8 | ch): \
    5809              :               parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::new_meth; break;
    5810              : 
    5811              :             CROW_XX(Post,      1, 'U', Put)
    5812              :             CROW_XX(Post,      1, 'A', Patch)
    5813              :             CROW_XX(Post,      1, 'R', Propfind)
    5814              :             CROW_XX(Put,       2, 'R', Purge)
    5815              :             CROW_XX(Connect,   1, 'H', Checkout)
    5816              :             CROW_XX(Connect,   2, 'P', Copy)
    5817              :             CROW_XX(MkCol,     1, 'O', Move)
    5818              :             CROW_XX(MkCol,     1, 'E', Merge)
    5819              :             CROW_XX(MkCol,     1, '-', MSearch)
    5820              :             CROW_XX(MkCol,     2, 'A', MkActivity)
    5821              :             CROW_XX(MkCol,     3, 'A', MkCalendar)
    5822              :             CROW_XX(Subscribe, 1, 'E', Search)
    5823              :             CROW_XX(Subscribe, 1, 'O', Source)
    5824              :             CROW_XX(Report,    2, 'B', Rebind)
    5825              :             CROW_XX(Propfind,  4, 'P', Proppatch)
    5826              :             CROW_XX(Lock,      1, 'I', Link)
    5827              :             CROW_XX(Unlock,    2, 'S', Unsubscribe)
    5828              :             CROW_XX(Unlock,    2, 'B', Unbind)
    5829              :             CROW_XX(Unlock,    3, 'I', Unlink)
    5830              : #undef CROW_XX
    5831              :             default:
    5832              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
    5833              :               goto error;
    5834              :           }
    5835              :         } else {
    5836              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
    5837              :           goto error;
    5838              :         }
    5839              : 
    5840              :         CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE(method);
    5841              : 
    5842              :         ++parser->index;
    5843              :         break;
    5844              :       }
    5845              : 
    5846              :       case s_req_spaces_before_url:
    5847              :       {
    5848              :         if (ch == ' ') break;
    5849              : 
    5850              :         CROW_MARK(url);
    5851              :         CROW_MARK(url_start);
    5852              :         if (parser->method == (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Connect) {
    5853              :           parser->state = s_req_server_start;
    5854              :         }
    5855              : 
    5856              :         parser->state = parse_url_char(static_cast<state>(parser->state), ch, parser, url_start_mark, p);
    5857              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->state == s_dead)) {
    5858              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
    5859              :           goto error;
    5860              :         }
    5861              : 
    5862              :         break;
    5863              :       }
    5864              : 
    5865              :       case s_req_schema:
    5866              :       case s_req_schema_slash:
    5867              :       case s_req_schema_slash_slash:
    5868              :       case s_req_server_start:
    5869              :       {
    5870              :         switch (ch) {
    5871              :           /* No whitespace allowed here */
    5872              :           case ' ':
    5873              :           case cr:
    5874              :           case lf:
    5875              :             CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
    5876              :             goto error;
    5877              :           default:
    5878              :             parser->state = parse_url_char(static_cast<state>(parser->state), ch, parser, url_start_mark, p);
    5879              :             if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->state == s_dead)) {
    5880              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
    5881              :               goto error;
    5882              :             }
    5883              :         }
    5884              : 
    5885              :         break;
    5886              :       }
    5887              : 
    5888              :       case s_req_server:
    5889              :       case s_req_server_with_at:
    5890              :       case s_req_path:
    5891              :       case s_req_query_string_start:
    5892              :       case s_req_query_string:
    5893              :       {
    5894              :         switch (ch) {
    5895              :           case ' ':
    5896              :             parser->state = s_req_http_start;
    5897              :             CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(url);
    5898              :             break;
    5899              :           case cr: // No space after URL means no HTTP version. Which means the request is using HTTP/0.9
    5900              :           case lf:
    5901              :             if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->method != (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Get)) // HTTP/0.9 doesn't define any method other than GET
    5902              :             {
    5903              :               parser->state = s_dead;
    5904              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
    5905              :               goto error;
    5906              :             }
    5907              :             parser->http_major = 0;
    5908              :             parser->http_minor = 9;
    5909              :             parser->state = (ch == cr) ?
    5910              :               s_req_line_almost_done :
    5911              :               s_header_field_start;
    5912              :             CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(url);
    5913              :             break;
    5914              :           default:
    5915              :             parser->state = parse_url_char(static_cast<state>(parser->state), ch, parser, url_start_mark, p);
    5916              :             if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->state == s_dead)) {
    5917              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
    5918              :               goto error;
    5919              :             }
    5920              :         }
    5921              :         break;
    5922              :       }
    5923              : 
    5924              :       case s_req_http_start:
    5925              :         switch (ch) {
    5926              :           case ' ':
    5927              :             break;
    5928              :           case 'H':
    5929              :             parser->state = s_req_http_H;
    5930              :             break;
    5931              :           case 'I':
    5932              :             if (parser->method == (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Source) {
    5933              :               parser->state = s_req_http_I;
    5934              :               break;
    5935              :             }
    5936              :             /* fall through */
    5937              :           default:
    5938              :             CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONSTANT);
    5939              :             goto error;
    5940              :         }
    5941              :         break;
    5942              : 
    5943              :       case s_req_http_H:
    5944              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'T');
    5945              :         parser->state = s_req_http_HT;
    5946              :         break;
    5947              : 
    5948              :       case s_req_http_HT:
    5949              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'T');
    5950              :         parser->state = s_req_http_HTT;
    5951              :         break;
    5952              : 
    5953              :       case s_req_http_HTT:
    5954              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'P');
    5955              :         parser->state = s_req_http_HTTP;
    5956              :         break;
    5957              : 
    5958              :       case s_req_http_I:
    5959              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'C');
    5960              :         parser->state = s_req_http_IC;
    5961              :         break;
    5962              : 
    5963              :       case s_req_http_IC:
    5964              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'E');
    5965              :         parser->state = s_req_http_HTTP;  /* Treat "ICE" as "HTTP". */
    5966              :         break;
    5967              : 
    5968              :       case s_req_http_HTTP:
    5969              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != '/');
    5970              :         parser->state = s_req_http_major;
    5971              :         break;
    5972              : 
    5973              :       /* dot */
    5974              :       case s_req_http_major:
    5975              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
    5976              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
    5977              :           goto error;
    5978              :         }
    5979              : 
    5980              :         parser->http_major = ch - '0';
    5981              :         parser->state = s_req_http_dot;
    5982              :         break;
    5983              : 
    5984              :       case s_req_http_dot:
    5985              :       {
    5986              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch != '.')) {
    5987              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
    5988              :           goto error;
    5989              :         }
    5990              : 
    5991              :         parser->state = s_req_http_minor;
    5992              :         break;
    5993              :       }
    5994              : 
    5995              :       /* minor HTTP version */
    5996              :       case s_req_http_minor:
    5997              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
    5998              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
    5999              :           goto error;
    6000              :         }
    6001              : 
    6002              :         parser->http_minor = ch - '0';
    6003              :         parser->state = s_req_http_end;
    6004              :         break;
    6005              : 
    6006              :       /* end of request line */
    6007              :       case s_req_http_end:
    6008              :       {
    6009              :         if (ch == cr) {
    6010              :           parser->state = s_req_line_almost_done;
    6011              :           break;
    6012              :         }
    6013              : 
    6014              :         if (ch == lf) {
    6015              :           parser->state = s_header_field_start;
    6016              :           break;
    6017              :         }
    6018              : 
    6019              :         CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
    6020              :         goto error;
    6021              :         break;
    6022              :       }
    6023              : 
    6024              :       /* end of request line */
    6025              :       case s_req_line_almost_done:
    6026              :       {
    6027              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch != lf)) {
    6028              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_LF_EXPECTED);
    6029              :           goto error;
    6030              :         }
    6031              : 
    6032              :         parser->state = s_header_field_start;
    6033              :         break;
    6034              :       }
    6035              : 
    6036              :       case s_header_field_start:
    6037              :       {
    6038              :         if (ch == cr) {
    6039              :           parser->state = s_headers_almost_done;
    6040              :           break;
    6041              :         }
    6042              : 
    6043              :         if (ch == lf) {
    6044              :           /* they might be just sending \n instead of \r\n so this would be
    6045              :            * the second \n to denote the end of headers*/
    6046              :           parser->state = s_headers_almost_done;
    6047              :           CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6048              :         }
    6049              : 
    6050              :         c = CROW_TOKEN(ch);
    6051              : 
    6052              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!c)) {
    6053              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
    6054              :           goto error;
    6055              :         }
    6056              : 
    6057              :         CROW_MARK(header_field);
    6058              : 
    6059              :         parser->index = 0;
    6060              :         parser->state = s_header_field;
    6061              : 
    6062              :         switch (c) {
    6063              :           case 'c':
    6064              :             parser->header_state = h_C;
    6065              :             break;
    6066              : 
    6067              :           case 'p':
    6068              :             parser->header_state = h_matching_proxy_connection;
    6069              :             break;
    6070              : 
    6071              :           case 't':
    6072              :             parser->header_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding;
    6073              :             break;
    6074              : 
    6075              :           case 'u':
    6076              :             parser->header_state = h_matching_upgrade;
    6077              :             break;
    6078              : 
    6079              :           default:
    6080              :             parser->header_state = h_general;
    6081              :             break;
    6082              :         }
    6083              :         break;
    6084              :       }
    6085              : 
    6086              :       case s_header_field:
    6087              :       {
    6088              :         const char* start = p;
    6089              :         for (; p != data + len; p++) {
    6090              :           ch = *p;
    6091              :           c = CROW_TOKEN(ch);
    6092              : 
    6093              :           if (!c)
    6094              :             break;
    6095              : 
    6096              :           switch (parser->header_state) {
    6097              :             case h_general: {
    6098              :               size_t left = data + len - p;
    6099              :               const char* pe = p + CROW_MIN(left, max_header_size);
    6100              :               while (p+1 < pe && CROW_TOKEN(p[1])) {
    6101              :                 p++;
    6102              :               }
    6103              :               break;
    6104              :             }
    6105              : 
    6106              :             case h_C:
    6107              :               parser->index++;
    6108              :               parser->header_state = (c == 'o' ? h_CO : h_general);
    6109              :               break;
    6110              : 
    6111              :             case h_CO:
    6112              :               parser->index++;
    6113              :               parser->header_state = (c == 'n' ? h_CON : h_general);
    6114              :               break;
    6115              : 
    6116              :             case h_CON:
    6117              :               parser->index++;
    6118              :               switch (c) {
    6119              :                 case 'n':
    6120              :                   parser->header_state = h_matching_connection;
    6121              :                   break;
    6122              :                 case 't':
    6123              :                   parser->header_state = h_matching_content_length;
    6124              :                   break;
    6125              :                 default:
    6126              :                   parser->header_state = h_general;
    6127              :                   break;
    6128              :               }
    6129              :               break;
    6130              : 
    6131              :             /* connection */
    6132              : 
    6133              :             case h_matching_connection:
    6134              :               parser->index++;
    6135              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CONNECTION)-1 || c != CROW_CONNECTION[parser->index]) {
    6136              :                 parser->header_state = h_general;
    6137              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CONNECTION)-2) {
    6138              :                 parser->header_state = h_connection;
    6139              :               }
    6140              :               break;
    6141              : 
    6142              :             /* proxy-connection */
    6143              : 
    6144              :             case h_matching_proxy_connection:
    6145              :               parser->index++;
    6146              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION)-1 || c != CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION[parser->index]) {
    6147              :                 parser->header_state = h_general;
    6148              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION)-2) {
    6149              :                 parser->header_state = h_connection;
    6150              :               }
    6151              :               break;
    6152              : 
    6153              :             /* content-length */
    6154              : 
    6155              :             case h_matching_content_length:
    6156              :               parser->index++;
    6157              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH)-1 || c != CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH[parser->index]) {
    6158              :                 parser->header_state = h_general;
    6159              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH)-2) {
    6160              :                 parser->header_state = h_content_length;
    6161              :               }
    6162              :               break;
    6163              : 
    6164              :             /* transfer-encoding */
    6165              : 
    6166              :             case h_matching_transfer_encoding:
    6167              :               parser->index++;
    6168              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING)-1 || c != CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING[parser->index]) {
    6169              :                 parser->header_state = h_general;
    6170              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING)-2) {
    6171              :                 parser->header_state = h_transfer_encoding;
    6172              :                 parser->uses_transfer_encoding = 1;
    6173              :               }
    6174              :               break;
    6175              : 
    6176              :             /* upgrade */
    6177              : 
    6178              :             case h_matching_upgrade:
    6179              :               parser->index++;
    6180              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_UPGRADE)-1 || c != CROW_UPGRADE[parser->index]) {
    6181              :                 parser->header_state = h_general;
    6182              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_UPGRADE)-2) {
    6183              :                 parser->header_state = h_upgrade;
    6184              :               }
    6185              :               break;
    6186              : 
    6187              :             case h_connection:
    6188              :             case h_content_length:
    6189              :             case h_transfer_encoding:
    6190              :             case h_upgrade:
    6191              :               if (ch != ' ') parser->header_state = h_general;
    6192              :               break;
    6193              : 
    6194              :             default:
    6195              :               assert(0 && "Unknown header_state");
    6196              :               break;
    6197              :           }
    6198              :         }
    6199              : 
    6200              :         if (p == data + len) {
    6201              :           --p;
    6202              :           CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
    6203              :           break;
    6204              :         }
    6205              : 
    6206              :         CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
    6207              : 
    6208              :         if (ch == ':') {
    6209              :           parser->state = s_header_value_discard_ws;
    6210              :           CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_field);
    6211              :           break;
    6212              :         }
    6213              : /* RFC-7230 Sec 3.2.4 expressly forbids line-folding in header field-names.
    6214              :         if (ch == cr) {
    6215              :           parser->state = s_header_almost_done;
    6216              :           CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_field);
    6217              :           break;
    6218              :         }
    6219              : 
    6220              :         if (ch == lf) {
    6221              :           parser->state = s_header_field_start;
    6222              :           CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_field);
    6223              :           break;
    6224              :         }
    6225              : */
    6226              :         CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
    6227              :         goto error;
    6228              :       }
    6229              : 
    6230              :       case s_header_value_discard_ws:
    6231              :         if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') break;
    6232              : 
    6233              :         if (ch == cr) {
    6234              :           parser->state = s_header_value_discard_ws_almost_done;
    6235              :           break;
    6236              :         }
    6237              : 
    6238              :         if (ch == lf) {
    6239              :           parser->state = s_header_value_discard_lws;
    6240              :           break;
    6241              :         }
    6242              : 
    6243              :         /* fall through */
    6244              : 
    6245              :       case s_header_value_start:
    6246              :       {
    6247              :         CROW_MARK(header_value);
    6248              : 
    6249              :         parser->state = s_header_value;
    6250              :         parser->index = 0;
    6251              : 
    6252              :         c = CROW_LOWER(ch);
    6253              : 
    6254              :         switch (parser->header_state) {
    6255              :           case h_upgrade:
    6256              :             // Crow does not support HTTP/2 at the moment.
    6257              :             // According to the RFC https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7540#section-3.2
    6258              :             // "A server that does not support HTTP/2 can respond to the request as though the Upgrade header field were absent"
    6259              :             // => `F_UPGRADE` is not set if the header starts by "h2".
    6260              :             // This prevents the parser from skipping the request body.
    6261              :             if (ch != 'h' || p+1 == (data + len) || *(p+1) != '2') {
    6262              :               parser->flags |= F_UPGRADE;
    6263              :             }
    6264              :             parser->header_state = h_general;
    6265              :             break;
    6266              : 
    6267              :           case h_transfer_encoding:
    6268              :             /* looking for 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' */
    6269              :             if ('c' == c) {
    6270              :               parser->header_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_chunked;
    6271              :             } else {
    6272              :               parser->header_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
    6273              :             }
    6274              :             break;
    6275              : 
    6276              :           /* Multi-value `Transfer-Encoding` header */
    6277              :           case h_matching_transfer_encoding_token_start:
    6278              :             break;
    6279              : 
    6280              :           case h_content_length:
    6281              :             if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
    6282              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6283              :               goto error;
    6284              :             }
    6285              : 
    6286              :             if (parser->flags & F_CONTENTLENGTH) {
    6287              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6288              :               goto error;
    6289              :             }
    6290              :             parser->flags |= F_CONTENTLENGTH;
    6291              :             parser->content_length = ch - '0';
    6292              :             parser->header_state = h_content_length_num;
    6293              :             break;
    6294              : 
    6295              :           /* when obsolete line folding is encountered for content length
    6296              :            * continue to the s_header_value state */
    6297              :           case h_content_length_ws:
    6298              :             break;
    6299              : 
    6300              :           case h_connection:
    6301              :             /* looking for 'Connection: keep-alive' */
    6302              :             if (c == 'k') {
    6303              :               parser->header_state = h_matching_connection_keep_alive;
    6304              :             /* looking for 'Connection: close' */
    6305              :             } else if (c == 'c') {
    6306              :               parser->header_state = h_matching_connection_close;
    6307              :             } else if (c == ' ' || c == '\t') {
    6308              :               /* Skip lws */
    6309              :             } else {
    6310              :               parser->header_state = h_general;
    6311              :             }
    6312              :             break;
    6313              : 
    6314              :           default:
    6315              :             parser->header_state = h_general;
    6316              :             break;
    6317              :         }
    6318              :         break;
    6319              :       }
    6320              : 
    6321              :       case s_header_value:
    6322              :       {
    6323              :         const char* start = p;
    6324              :         enum header_states h_state = static_cast<header_states>(parser->header_state);
    6325              :         for (; p != data + len; p++) {
    6326              :           ch = *p;
    6327              : 
    6328              :           if (ch == cr) {
    6329              :             parser->state = s_header_almost_done;
    6330              :             parser->header_state = h_state;
    6331              :             CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_value);
    6332              :             break;
    6333              :           }
    6334              : 
    6335              :           if (ch == lf) {
    6336              :             parser->state = s_header_almost_done;
    6337              :             CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
    6338              :             parser->header_state = h_state;
    6339              :             CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_value);
    6340              :             CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6341              :           }
    6342              : 
    6343              :           if (!lenient && !CROW_IS_HEADER_CHAR(ch)) {
    6344              :             CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
    6345              :             goto error;
    6346              :           }
    6347              : 
    6348              :           c = CROW_LOWER(ch);
    6349              : 
    6350              :           switch (h_state) {
    6351              :             case h_general:
    6352              :               {
    6353              :                 size_t left = data + len - p;
    6354              :                 const char* pe = p + CROW_MIN(left, max_header_size);
    6355              : 
    6356              :                 for (; p != pe; p++) {
    6357              :                   ch = *p;
    6358              :                   if (ch == cr || ch == lf) {
    6359              :                     --p;
    6360              :                     break;
    6361              :                   }
    6362              :                   if (!lenient && !CROW_IS_HEADER_CHAR(ch)) {
    6363              :                     CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
    6364              :                     goto error;
    6365              :                   }
    6366              :                 }
    6367              :                 if (p == data + len)
    6368              :                   --p;
    6369              :                 break;
    6370              :               }
    6371              : 
    6372              :             case h_connection:
    6373              :             case h_transfer_encoding:
    6374              :               assert(0 && "Shouldn't get here.");
    6375              :               break;
    6376              : 
    6377              :             case h_content_length:
    6378              :               if (ch == ' ') break;
    6379              :               h_state = h_content_length_num;
    6380              :               /* fall through */
    6381              : 
    6382              :             case h_content_length_num:
    6383              :             {
    6384              :               uint64_t t;
    6385              : 
    6386              :               if (ch == ' ') {
    6387              :                 h_state = h_content_length_ws;
    6388              :                 break;
    6389              :               }
    6390              : 
    6391              :               if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
    6392              :                 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6393              :                 parser->header_state = h_state;
    6394              :                 goto error;
    6395              :               }
    6396              : 
    6397              :               t = parser->content_length;
    6398              :               t *= 10;
    6399              :               t += ch - '0';
    6400              : 
    6401              :               /* Overflow? Test against a conservative limit for simplicity. */
    6402              :               if (CROW_UNLIKELY((CROW_ULLONG_MAX - 10) / 10 < parser->content_length)) {
    6403              :                 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6404              :                 parser->header_state = h_state;
    6405              :                 goto error;
    6406              :               }
    6407              : 
    6408              :               parser->content_length = t;
    6409              :               break;
    6410              :             }
    6411              : 
    6412              :             case h_content_length_ws:
    6413              :               if (ch == ' ') break;
    6414              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6415              :               parser->header_state = h_state;
    6416              :               goto error;
    6417              : 
    6418              :             /* Transfer-Encoding: chunked */
    6419              :             case h_matching_transfer_encoding_token_start:
    6420              :               /* looking for 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' */
    6421              :               if ('c' == c) {
    6422              :                 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_chunked;
    6423              :               } else if (CROW_TOKEN(c)) {
    6424              :                 /* TODO(indutny): similar code below does this, but why?
    6425              :                  * At the very least it seems to be inconsistent given that
    6426              :                  * h_matching_transfer_encoding_token does not check for
    6427              :                  * `STRICT_TOKEN`
    6428              :                  */
    6429              :                 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
    6430              :               } else if (c == ' ' || c == '\t') {
    6431              :                 /* Skip lws */
    6432              :               } else {
    6433              :                 h_state = h_general;
    6434              :               }
    6435              :               break;
    6436              : 
    6437              :             case h_matching_transfer_encoding_chunked:
    6438              :               parser->index++;
    6439              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CHUNKED)-1 || c != CROW_CHUNKED[parser->index]) {
    6440              :                 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
    6441              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CHUNKED)-2) {
    6442              :                 h_state = h_transfer_encoding_chunked;
    6443              :               }
    6444              :               break;
    6445              : 
    6446              :             case h_matching_transfer_encoding_token:
    6447              :               if (ch == ',') {
    6448              :                 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token_start;
    6449              :                 parser->index = 0;
    6450              :               }
    6451              :               break;
    6452              : 
    6453              :             /* looking for 'Connection: keep-alive' */
    6454              :             case h_matching_connection_keep_alive:
    6455              :               parser->index++;
    6456              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_KEEP_ALIVE)-1 || c != CROW_KEEP_ALIVE[parser->index]) {
    6457              :                 h_state = h_general;
    6458              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_KEEP_ALIVE)-2) {
    6459              :                 h_state = h_connection_keep_alive;
    6460              :               }
    6461              :               break;
    6462              : 
    6463              :             /* looking for 'Connection: close' */
    6464              :             case h_matching_connection_close:
    6465              :               parser->index++;
    6466              :               if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CLOSE)-1 || c != CROW_CLOSE[parser->index]) {
    6467              :                 h_state = h_general;
    6468              :               } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CLOSE)-2) {
    6469              :                 h_state = h_connection_close;
    6470              :               }
    6471              :               break;
    6472              : 
    6473              :               // Edited from original (because of commits that werent included)
    6474              :             case h_transfer_encoding_chunked:
    6475              :               if (ch != ' ') h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
    6476              :               break;
    6477              :             case h_connection_keep_alive:
    6478              :             case h_connection_close:
    6479              :               if (ch != ' ') h_state = h_general;
    6480              :               break;
    6481              : 
    6482              :             default:
    6483              :               parser->state = s_header_value;
    6484              :               h_state = h_general;
    6485              :               break;
    6486              :           }
    6487              :         }
    6488              :         parser->header_state = h_state;
    6489              : 
    6490              : 
    6491              :         if (p == data + len)
    6492              :           --p;
    6493              : 
    6494              :         CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
    6495              :         break;
    6496              :       }
    6497              : 
    6498              :       case s_header_almost_done:
    6499              :       {
    6500              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch != lf)) {
    6501              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_LF_EXPECTED);
    6502              :           goto error;
    6503              :         }
    6504              : 
    6505              :         parser->state = s_header_value_lws;
    6506              :         break;
    6507              :       }
    6508              : 
    6509              :       case s_header_value_lws:
    6510              :       {
    6511              :         if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') {
    6512              :           if (parser->header_state == h_content_length_num) {
    6513              :               /* treat obsolete line folding as space */
    6514              :               parser->header_state = h_content_length_ws;
    6515              :           }
    6516              :           parser->state = s_header_value_start;
    6517              :           CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6518              :         }
    6519              : 
    6520              :         /* finished the header */
    6521              :         switch (parser->header_state) {
    6522              :           case h_connection_keep_alive:
    6523              :             parser->flags |= F_CONNECTION_KEEP_ALIVE;
    6524              :             break;
    6525              :           case h_connection_close:
    6526              :             parser->flags |= F_CONNECTION_CLOSE;
    6527              :             break;
    6528              :           case h_transfer_encoding_chunked:
    6529              :             parser->flags |= F_CHUNKED;
    6530              :             break;
    6531              :           default:
    6532              :             break;
    6533              :         }
    6534              : 
    6535              :         parser->state = s_header_field_start;
    6536              :         CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6537              :       }
    6538              : 
    6539              :       case s_header_value_discard_ws_almost_done:
    6540              :       {
    6541              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
    6542              :         parser->state = s_header_value_discard_lws;
    6543              :         break;
    6544              :       }
    6545              : 
    6546              :       case s_header_value_discard_lws:
    6547              :       {
    6548              :         if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') {
    6549              :           parser->state = s_header_value_discard_ws;
    6550              :           break;
    6551              :         } else {
    6552              :           /* header value was empty */
    6553              :           CROW_MARK(header_value);
    6554              :           parser->state = s_header_field_start;
    6555              :           CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_value);
    6556              :           CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6557              :         }
    6558              :       }
    6559              : 
    6560              :       case s_headers_almost_done:
    6561              :       {
    6562              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
    6563              : 
    6564              :         if (parser->flags & F_TRAILING) {
    6565              :           /* End of a chunked request */
    6566              :           CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
    6567              :           break;
    6568              :         }
    6569              : 
    6570              :         /* Cannot use transfer-encoding and a content-length header together
    6571              :            per the HTTP specification. (RFC 7230 Section 3.3.3) */
    6572              :         if ((parser->uses_transfer_encoding == 1) &&
    6573              :             (parser->flags & F_CONTENTLENGTH)) {
    6574              :           /* Allow it for lenient parsing as long as `Transfer-Encoding` is
    6575              :            * not `chunked` or allow_length_with_encoding is set
    6576              :            */
    6577              :           if (parser->flags & F_CHUNKED) {
    6578              :             if (!allow_chunked_length) {
    6579              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6580              :               goto error;
    6581              :             }
    6582              :           } else if (!lenient) {
    6583              :             CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6584              :             goto error;
    6585              :           }
    6586              :         }
    6587              : 
    6588              :         parser->state = s_headers_done;
    6589              : 
    6590              :         /* Set this here so that on_headers_complete() callbacks can see it */
    6591              :         parser->upgrade =
    6592              :           (parser->flags & F_UPGRADE || parser->method == (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Connect);
    6593              : 
    6594              :         /* Here we call the headers_complete callback. This is somewhat
    6595              :          * different than other callbacks because if the user returns 1, we
    6596              :          * will interpret that as saying that this message has no body. This
    6597              :          * is needed for the annoying case of recieving a response to a HEAD
    6598              :          * request.
    6599              :          *
    6600              :          * We'd like to use CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE() here but we cannot, so
    6601              :          * we have to simulate it by handling a change in errno below.
    6602              :          */
    6603              :         if (settings->on_headers_complete) {
    6604              :           switch (settings->on_headers_complete(parser)) {
    6605              :             case 0:
    6606              :               break;
    6607              : 
    6608              :             case 2:
    6609              :               parser->upgrade = 1;
    6610              :               //break;
    6611              : 
    6612              :             /* fall through */
    6613              :             case 1:
    6614              :               parser->flags |= F_SKIPBODY;
    6615              :               break;
    6616              : 
    6617              :             default:
    6618              :               CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_CB_headers_complete);
    6619              :               parser->nread = nread;
    6620              :               return p - data; /* Error */
    6621              :           }
    6622              :         }
    6623              : 
    6624              :         if (CROW_HTTP_PARSER_ERRNO(parser) != CHPE_OK) {
    6625              :           parser->nread = nread;
    6626              :           return p - data;
    6627              :         }
    6628              : 
    6629              :         CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6630              :       }
    6631              : 
    6632              :       case s_headers_done:
    6633              :       {
    6634              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
    6635              : 
    6636              :         parser->nread = 0;
    6637              :         nread = 0;
    6638              : 
    6639              :         /* Exit, the rest of the connect is in a different protocol. */
    6640              :         if (parser->upgrade) {
    6641              :           CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
    6642              :           parser->nread = nread;
    6643              :           return (p - data) + 1;
    6644              :         }
    6645              : 
    6646              :         if (parser->flags & F_SKIPBODY) {
    6647              :           CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
    6648              :         } else if (parser->flags & F_CHUNKED) {
    6649              :           /* chunked encoding - ignore Content-Length header,
    6650              :            * prepare for a chunk */
    6651              :             parser->state = s_chunk_size_start;
    6652              :         }
    6653              :         else if (parser->uses_transfer_encoding == 1)
    6654              :         {
    6655              :             if (!lenient)
    6656              :             {
    6657              :                 /* RFC 7230 3.3.3 */
    6658              : 
    6659              :                 /* If a Transfer-Encoding header field
    6660              :              * is present in a request and the chunked transfer coding is not
    6661              :              * the final encoding, the message body length cannot be determined
    6662              :              * reliably; the server MUST respond with the 400 (Bad Request)
    6663              :              * status code and then close the connection.
    6664              :              */
    6665              :                 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_TRANSFER_ENCODING);
    6666              :                 parser->nread = nread;
    6667              :                 return (p - data); /* Error */
    6668              :             }
    6669              :             else
    6670              :             {
    6671              :                 /* RFC 7230 3.3.3 */
    6672              : 
    6673              :                 /* If a Transfer-Encoding header field is present in a response and
    6674              :              * the chunked transfer coding is not the final encoding, the
    6675              :              * message body length is determined by reading the connection until
    6676              :              * it is closed by the server.
    6677              :              */
    6678              :                 parser->state = s_body_identity_eof;
    6679              :             }
    6680              :         }
    6681              :         else
    6682              :         {
    6683              :             if (parser->content_length == 0)
    6684              :             {
    6685              :                 /* Content-Length header given but zero: Content-Length: 0\r\n */
    6686              :                 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
    6687              :             }
    6688              :             else if (parser->content_length != CROW_ULLONG_MAX)
    6689              :             {
    6690              :                 /* Content-Length header given and non-zero */
    6691              :                 parser->state = s_body_identity;
    6692              :             }
    6693              :             else
    6694              :             {
    6695              :                 /* Assume content-length 0 - read the next */
    6696              :                 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
    6697              :             }
    6698              :         }
    6699              : 
    6700              :         break;
    6701              :       }
    6702              : 
    6703              :       case s_body_identity:
    6704              :       {
    6705              :         uint64_t to_read = CROW_MIN(parser->content_length,
    6706              :                                (uint64_t) ((data + len) - p));
    6707              : 
    6708              :         assert(parser->content_length != 0
    6709              :             && parser->content_length != CROW_ULLONG_MAX);
    6710              : 
    6711              :         /* The difference between advancing content_length and p is because
    6712              :          * the latter will automaticaly advance on the next loop iteration.
    6713              :          * Further, if content_length ends up at 0, we want to see the last
    6714              :          * byte again for our message complete callback.
    6715              :          */
    6716              :         CROW_MARK(body);
    6717              :         parser->content_length -= to_read;
    6718              :         p += to_read - 1;
    6719              : 
    6720              :         if (parser->content_length == 0) {
    6721              :           parser->state = s_message_done;
    6722              : 
    6723              :           /* Mimic CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE() but with one extra byte.
    6724              :            *
    6725              :            * The alternative to doing this is to wait for the next byte to
    6726              :            * trigger the data callback, just as in every other case. The
    6727              :            * problem with this is that this makes it difficult for the test
    6728              :            * harness to distinguish between complete-on-EOF and
    6729              :            * complete-on-length. It's not clear that this distinction is
    6730              :            * important for applications, but let's keep it for now.
    6731              :            */
    6732              :           CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_(body, p - body_mark + 1, p - data);
    6733              :           CROW_REEXECUTE();
    6734              :         }
    6735              : 
    6736              :         break;
    6737              :       }
    6738              : 
    6739              :       /* read until EOF */
    6740              :       case s_body_identity_eof:
    6741              :         CROW_MARK(body);
    6742              :         p = data + len - 1;
    6743              : 
    6744              :         break;
    6745              : 
    6746              :       case s_message_done:
    6747              :         CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
    6748              :         break;
    6749              : 
    6750              :       case s_chunk_size_start:
    6751              :       {
    6752              :         assert(nread == 1);
    6753              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6754              : 
    6755              :         unhex_val = unhex[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
    6756              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY(unhex_val == -1)) {
    6757              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CHUNK_SIZE);
    6758              :           goto error;
    6759              :         }
    6760              : 
    6761              :         parser->content_length = unhex_val;
    6762              :         parser->state = s_chunk_size;
    6763              :         break;
    6764              :       }
    6765              : 
    6766              :       case s_chunk_size:
    6767              :       {
    6768              :         uint64_t t;
    6769              : 
    6770              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6771              : 
    6772              :         if (ch == cr) {
    6773              :           parser->state = s_chunk_size_almost_done;
    6774              :           break;
    6775              :         }
    6776              : 
    6777              :         unhex_val = unhex[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
    6778              : 
    6779              :         if (unhex_val == -1) {
    6780              :           if (ch == ';' || ch == ' ') {
    6781              :             parser->state = s_chunk_parameters;
    6782              :             break;
    6783              :           }
    6784              : 
    6785              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CHUNK_SIZE);
    6786              :           goto error;
    6787              :         }
    6788              : 
    6789              :         t = parser->content_length;
    6790              :         t *= 16;
    6791              :         t += unhex_val;
    6792              : 
    6793              :         /* Overflow? Test against a conservative limit for simplicity. */
    6794              :         if (CROW_UNLIKELY((CROW_ULLONG_MAX - 16) / 16 < parser->content_length)) {
    6795              :           CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
    6796              :           goto error;
    6797              :         }
    6798              : 
    6799              :         parser->content_length = t;
    6800              :         break;
    6801              :       }
    6802              : 
    6803              :       case s_chunk_parameters:
    6804              :       {
    6805              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6806              :         /* just ignore this shit. TODO check for overflow */
    6807              :         if (ch == cr) {
    6808              :           parser->state = s_chunk_size_almost_done;
    6809              :           break;
    6810              :         }
    6811              :         break;
    6812              :       }
    6813              : 
    6814              :       case s_chunk_size_almost_done:
    6815              :       {
    6816              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6817              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
    6818              : 
    6819              :         parser->nread = 0;
    6820              :         nread = 0;
    6821              : 
    6822              :         if (parser->content_length == 0) {
    6823              :           parser->flags |= F_TRAILING;
    6824              :           parser->state = s_header_field_start;
    6825              :         } else {
    6826              :           parser->state = s_chunk_data;
    6827              :         }
    6828              :         break;
    6829              :       }
    6830              : 
    6831              :       case s_chunk_data:
    6832              :       {
    6833              :         uint64_t to_read = CROW_MIN(parser->content_length,
    6834              :                                (uint64_t) ((data + len) - p));
    6835              : 
    6836              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6837              :         assert(parser->content_length != 0
    6838              :             && parser->content_length != CROW_ULLONG_MAX);
    6839              : 
    6840              :         /* See the explanation in s_body_identity for why the content
    6841              :          * length and data pointers are managed this way.
    6842              :          */
    6843              :         CROW_MARK(body);
    6844              :         parser->content_length -= to_read;
    6845              :         p += to_read - 1;
    6846              : 
    6847              :         if (parser->content_length == 0) {
    6848              :           parser->state = s_chunk_data_almost_done;
    6849              :         }
    6850              : 
    6851              :         break;
    6852              :       }
    6853              : 
    6854              :       case s_chunk_data_almost_done:
    6855              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6856              :         assert(parser->content_length == 0);
    6857              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != cr);
    6858              :         parser->state = s_chunk_data_done;
    6859              :         CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(body);
    6860              :         break;
    6861              : 
    6862              :       case s_chunk_data_done:
    6863              :         assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
    6864              :         CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
    6865              :         parser->nread = 0;
    6866              :         nread = 0;
    6867              :         parser->state = s_chunk_size_start;
    6868              :         break;
    6869              : 
    6870              :       default:
    6871              :         assert(0 && "unhandled state");
    6872              :         CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_INTERNAL_STATE);
    6873              :         goto error;
    6874              :     }
    6875              :   }
    6876              : 
    6877              :   /* Run callbacks for any marks that we have leftover after we ran out of
    6878              :    * bytes. There should be at most one of these set, so it's OK to invoke
    6879              :    * them in series (unset marks will not result in callbacks).
    6880              :    *
    6881              :    * We use the NOADVANCE() variety of callbacks here because 'p' has already
    6882              :    * overflowed 'data' and this allows us to correct for the off-by-one that
    6883              :    * we'd otherwise have (since CROW_CALLBACK_DATA() is meant to be run with a 'p'
    6884              :    * value that's in-bounds).
    6885              :    */
    6886              : 
    6887              :   assert(((header_field_mark ? 1 : 0) +
    6888              :           (header_value_mark ? 1 : 0) +
    6889              :           (url_mark ? 1 : 0)  +
    6890              :           (body_mark ? 1 : 0)) <= 1);
    6891              : 
    6892              :   CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_field);
    6893              :   CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_value);
    6894              :   CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(url);
    6895              :   CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(body);
    6896              : 
    6897              :   parser->nread = nread;
    6898              :   return len;
    6899              : 
    6900              : error:
    6901              :   if (CROW_HTTP_PARSER_ERRNO(parser) == CHPE_OK) {
    6902              :     CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNKNOWN);
    6903              :   }
    6904              : 
    6905              :   parser->nread = nread;
    6906              :   return (p - data);
    6907              : }
    6908              : 
    6909              : inline void
    6910              :   http_parser_init(http_parser* parser)
    6911              : {
    6912              :   void *data = parser->data; /* preserve application data */
    6913              :   memset(parser, 0, sizeof(*parser));
    6914              :   parser->data = data;
    6915              :   parser->state = s_start_req;
    6916              :   parser->http_errno = CHPE_OK;
    6917              : }
    6918              : 
    6919              : /* Return a string name of the given error */
    6920              : inline const char *
    6921              : http_errno_name(enum http_errno err) {
    6922              : /* Map errno values to strings for human-readable output */
    6923              : #define CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN(n, s) { "CHPE_" #n, s },
    6924              : static struct {
    6925              :   const char *name;
    6926              :   const char *description;
    6927              : } http_strerror_tab[] = {
    6928              :   CROW_HTTP_ERRNO_MAP(CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN)
    6929              : };
    6930              : #undef CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN
    6931              :   assert(((size_t) err) < CROW_ARRAY_SIZE(http_strerror_tab));
    6932              :   return http_strerror_tab[err].name;
    6933              : }
    6934              : 
    6935              : /* Return a string description of the given error */
    6936              : inline const char *
    6937              : http_errno_description(enum http_errno err) {
    6938              : /* Map errno values to strings for human-readable output */
    6939              : #define CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN(n, s) { "CHPE_" #n, s },
    6940              : static struct {
    6941              :   const char *name;
    6942              :   const char *description;
    6943              : } http_strerror_tab[] = {
    6944              :   CROW_HTTP_ERRNO_MAP(CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN)
    6945              : };
    6946              : #undef CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN
    6947              :   assert(((size_t) err) < CROW_ARRAY_SIZE(http_strerror_tab));
    6948              :   return http_strerror_tab[err].description;
    6949              : }
    6950              : 
    6951              : /* Checks if this is the final chunk of the body. */
    6952              : inline int
    6953              : http_body_is_final(const struct http_parser *parser) {
    6954              :     return parser->state == s_message_done;
    6955              : }
    6956              : 
    6957              : /* Change the maximum header size provided at compile time. */
    6958              : inline void
    6959              : http_parser_set_max_header_size(uint32_t size) {
    6960              :   max_header_size = size;
    6961              : }
    6962              : 
    6963              : #undef CROW_HTTP_ERRNO_MAP
    6964              : #undef CROW_SET_ERRNO
    6965              : #undef CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_
    6966              : #undef CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY
    6967              : #undef CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE
    6968              : #undef CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_
    6969              : #undef CROW_CALLBACK_DATA
    6970              : #undef CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE
    6971              : #undef CROW_MARK
    6972              : #undef CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION
    6973              : #undef CROW_CONNECTION
    6974              : #undef CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH
    6975              : #undef CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING
    6976              : #undef CROW_UPGRADE
    6977              : #undef CROW_CHUNKED
    6978              : #undef CROW_KEEP_ALIVE
    6979              : #undef CROW_CLOSE
    6980              : #undef CROW_PARSING_HEADER
    6981              : #undef CROW_LOWER
    6982              : #undef CROW_IS_ALPHA
    6983              : #undef CROW_IS_NUM
    6984              : #undef CROW_IS_ALPHANUM
    6985              : //#undef CROW_IS_HEX
    6986              : #undef CROW_IS_MARK

    6988              : #undef CROW_TOKEN

    6990              : //#undef CROW_IS_HOST_CHAR
    6991              : #undef CROW_STRICT_CHECK

    6994              : 
    6995              : // clang-format on
    6996              : 
    6997              : 
    6998              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
    6999              : #include <boost/asio.hpp>
    7000              : #include <boost/asio/basic_waitable_timer.hpp>
    7001              : #else
    7002              : #ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
    7003              : #define ASIO_STANDALONE
    7004              : #endif
    7005              : #include <asio.hpp>
    7006              : #include <asio/basic_waitable_timer.hpp>
    7007              : #endif
    7008              : 
    7009              : #include <chrono>
    7010              : #include <functional>
    7011              : #include <map>
    7012              : #include <vector>
    7013              : 
    7014              : 
    7015              : namespace crow
    7016              : {
    7017              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
    7018              :     namespace asio = boost::asio;
    7019              :     using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
    7020              : #else
    7021              :     using error_code = asio::error_code;
    7022              : #endif
    7023              :     namespace detail
    7024              :     {
    7025              : 
    7026              :         /// A class for scheduling functions to be called after a specific
    7027              :         /// amount of ticks. Ther tick length can  be handed over in constructor, 
    7028              :         /// the default tick length is equal to 1 second.
    7029              :         class task_timer
    7030              :         {
    7031              :         public:
    7032              :             using task_type = std::function<void()>;
    7033              :             using identifier_type = size_t;
    7034              : 
    7035              :         private:
    7036              :             using clock_type = std::chrono::steady_clock;
    7037              :             using time_type = clock_type::time_point;
    7038              :         public:
    7039              :             task_timer(asio::io_context& io_context,
    7040              :                        const std::chrono::milliseconds tick_length =
    7041              :                             std::chrono::seconds(1)) :
    7042              :               io_context_(io_context), timer_(io_context_),
    7043              :               tick_length_ms_(tick_length)
    7044              :             {
    7045              :                 timer_.expires_after(tick_length_ms_);
    7046              :                 timer_.async_wait(
    7047              :                   std::bind(&task_timer::tick_handler, this,
    7048              :                   std::placeholders::_1));
    7049              :             }
    7050              : 
    7051              :             ~task_timer() { timer_.cancel(); }
    7052              : 
    7053              :             /// Cancel the scheduling of the given task 
    7054              :             ///
    7055              :             /// \param identifier_type task identifier of the task to cancel.
    7056              :             void cancel(identifier_type id)
    7057              :             {
    7058              :                 tasks_.erase(id);
    7059              :                 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "task_timer task cancelled: " << this << ' ' << id;
    7060              :             }
    7061              : 
    7062              :             /// Schedule the given task to be executed after the default amount
    7063              :             /// of ticks.
    7064              : 
    7065              :             ///
    7066              :             /// \return identifier_type Used to cancel the thread.
    7067              :             /// It is not bound to this task_timer instance and in some cases
    7068              :             /// could lead to undefined behavior if used with other task_timer
    7069              :             /// objects or after the task has been successfully executed.
    7070              :             identifier_type schedule(const task_type& task)
    7071              :             {
    7072              :                 return schedule(task, get_default_timeout());
    7073              :             }
    7074              : 
    7075              :             /// Schedule the given task to be executed after the given time.
    7076              : 
    7077              :             ///
    7078              :             /// \param timeout The amount of ticks to wait before execution.
    7079              :             ///
    7080              :             /// \return identifier_type Used to cancel the thread.
    7081              :             /// It is not bound to this task_timer instance and in some cases
    7082              :             /// could lead to undefined behavior if used with other task_timer
    7083              :             /// objects or after the task has been successfully executed.
    7084              :             identifier_type schedule(const task_type& task, uint8_t timeout)
    7085              :             {
    7086              :                 tasks_.insert({++highest_id_,
    7087              :                                {clock_type::now() + (timeout * tick_length_ms_),
    7088              :                                 task}});
    7089              :                 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "task_timer scheduled: " << this << ' ' <<
    7090              :                                   highest_id_;
    7091              :                 return highest_id_;
    7092              :             }
    7093              : 
    7094              :             /// Set the default timeout for this task_timer instance.
    7095              :             /// (Default: 5)
    7096              : 
    7097              :             ///
    7098              :             /// \param timeout The amount of ticks to wait before
    7099              :             /// execution. 
    7100              :             /// For tick length \see tick_length_ms_ 
    7101              :             void set_default_timeout(uint8_t timeout) {
    7102              :                 default_timeout_ = timeout;
    7103              :             }
    7104              : 
    7105              :             /// Get the default timeout. (Default: 5)
    7106              :             uint8_t get_default_timeout() const {
    7107              :                 return default_timeout_;
    7108              :             }
    7109              : 
    7110              :             /// returns the length of one tick.
    7111              :             std::chrono::milliseconds get_tick_length() const {
    7112              :                 return tick_length_ms_;
    7113              :             }
    7114              : 
    7115              :         private:
    7116              :             void process_tasks()
    7117              :             {
    7118              :                 time_type current_time = clock_type::now();
    7119              :                 std::vector<identifier_type> finished_tasks;
    7120              : 
    7121              :                 for (const auto& task : tasks_)
    7122              :                 {
    7123              :                     if (task.second.first < current_time)
    7124              :                     {
    7125              :                         (task.second.second)();
    7126              :                         finished_tasks.push_back(task.first);
    7127              :                         CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "task_timer called: " << this <<
    7128              :                                           ' ' << task.first;
    7129              :                     }
    7130              :                 }
    7131              : 
    7132              :                 for (const auto& task : finished_tasks)
    7133              :                     tasks_.erase(task);
    7134              : 
    7135              :                 // If no task is currently scheduled, reset the issued ids back
    7136              :                 // to 0.
    7137              :                 if (tasks_.empty()) highest_id_ = 0;
    7138              :             }
    7139              : 
    7140              :             void tick_handler(const error_code& ec)
    7141              :             {
    7142              :                 if (ec) return;
    7143              : 
    7144              :                 process_tasks();
    7145              : 
    7146              :                 timer_.expires_after(tick_length_ms_);
    7147              :                 timer_.async_wait(
    7148              :                   std::bind(&task_timer::tick_handler, this, std::placeholders::_1));
    7149              :             }
    7150              : 
    7151              :         private:
    7152              :             asio::io_context& io_context_;
    7153              :             asio::basic_waitable_timer<clock_type> timer_;
    7154              :             std::map<identifier_type, std::pair<time_type, task_type>> tasks_;
    7155              : 
    7156              :             // A continuously increasing number to be issued to threads to
    7157              :             // identify them. If no tasks are scheduled, it will be reset to 0.
    7158              :             identifier_type highest_id_{0};
    7159              :             std::chrono::milliseconds tick_length_ms_;
    7160              :             uint8_t default_timeout_{5};
    7161              : 
    7162              :         };
    7163              :     } // namespace detail
    7164              : } // namespace crow
    7165              : 
    7166              : 
    7167              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
    7168              : #include <boost/asio.hpp>
    7169              : #else
    7170              : #ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
    7171              : #define ASIO_STANDALONE
    7172              : #endif
    7173              : #include <asio.hpp>
    7174              : #endif
    7175              : 
    7176              : 
    7177              : namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
    7178              : {
    7179              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
    7180              :     namespace asio = boost::asio;
    7181              : #endif
    7182              : 
    7183              :     /// Find and return the value associated with the key. (returns an empty string if nothing is found)
    7184              :     template<typename T>
    7185              :     inline const std::string& get_header_value(const T& headers, const std::string& key)
