    7186              :     {
    7187              :         if (headers.count(key))
    7188              :         {
    7189              :             return headers.find(key)->second;
    7190              :         }
    7191              :         static std::string empty;
    7192              :         return empty;
    7193              :     }
    7194              : 
    7195              :     /// An HTTP request.
    7196              :     struct request
    7197              :     {
    7198              :         HTTPMethod method;
    7199              :         std::string raw_url;     ///< The full URL containing the `?` and URL parameters.
    7200              :         std::string url;         ///< The endpoint without any parameters.
    7201              :         query_string url_params; ///< The parameters associated with the request. (everything after the `?` in the URL)
    7202              :         ci_map headers;
    7203              :         std::string body;
    7204              :         std::string remote_ip_address; ///< The IP address from which the request was sent.
    7205              :         unsigned char http_ver_major, http_ver_minor;
    7206              :         bool keep_alive,    ///< Whether or not the server should send a `connection: Keep-Alive` header to the client.
    7207              :           close_connection, ///< Whether or not the server should shut down the TCP connection once a response is sent.
    7208              :           upgrade;          ///< Whether or noth the server should change the HTTP connection to a different connection.
    7209              : 
    7210              :         void* middleware_context{};
    7211              :         void* middleware_container{};
    7212              :         asio::io_context* io_context{};
    7213              : 
    7214              :         /// Construct an empty request. (sets the method to `GET`)
    7215              :         request():
    7216              :           method(HTTPMethod::Get)
    7217              :         {}
    7218              : 
    7219              :         /// Construct a request with all values assigned.
    7220              :         request(HTTPMethod method_, std::string raw_url_, std::string url_, query_string url_params_, ci_map headers_, std::string body_, unsigned char http_major, unsigned char http_minor, bool has_keep_alive, bool has_close_connection, bool is_upgrade):
    7221              :           method(method_), raw_url(std::move(raw_url_)), url(std::move(url_)), url_params(std::move(url_params_)), headers(std::move(headers_)), body(std::move(body_)), http_ver_major(http_major), http_ver_minor(http_minor), keep_alive(has_keep_alive), close_connection(has_close_connection), upgrade(is_upgrade)
    7222              :         {}
    7223              : 
    7224              :         void add_header(std::string key, std::string value)
    7225              :         {
    7226              :             headers.emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
    7227              :         }
    7228              : 
    7229              :         const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key) const
    7230              :         {
    7231              :             return crow::get_header_value(headers, key);
    7232              :         }
    7233              : 
    7234              :         bool check_version(unsigned char major, unsigned char minor) const
    7235              :         {
    7236              :             return http_ver_major == major && http_ver_minor == minor;
    7237              :         }
    7238              : 
    7239              :         /// Get the body as parameters in QS format.
    7240              : 
    7241              :         ///
    7242              :         /// This is meant to be used with requests of type "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    7243              :         const query_string get_body_params() const
    7244              :         {
    7245              :             return query_string(body, false);
    7246              :         }
    7247              : 
    7248              :         /// Send data to whoever made this request with a completion handler and return immediately.
    7249              :         template<typename CompletionHandler>
    7250              :         void post(CompletionHandler handler)
    7251              :         {
    7252              :             asio::post(io_context, handler);
    7253              :         }
    7254              : 
    7255              :         /// Send data to whoever made this request with a completion handler.
    7256              :         template<typename CompletionHandler>
    7257              :         void dispatch(CompletionHandler handler)
    7258              :         {
    7259              :             asio::dispatch(io_context, handler);
    7260              :         }
    7261              :     };
    7262              : } // namespace crow
    7263              : 
    7264              : 
    7265              : #include <string>
    7266              : #include <unordered_map>
    7267              : #include <algorithm>
    7268              : 
    7269              : 
    7270              : namespace crow
    7271              : {
    7272              :     /// A wrapper for `nodejs/http-parser`.
    7273              : 
    7274              :     ///
    7275              :     /// Used to generate a \ref crow.request from the TCP socket buffer.
    7276              :     template<typename Handler>
    7277              :     struct HTTPParser : public http_parser
    7278              :     {
    7279              :         static int on_message_begin(http_parser*)
    7280              :         {
    7281              :             return 0;
    7282              :         }
    7283              :         static int on_method(http_parser* self_)
    7284              :         {
    7285              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7286              :             self->req.method = static_cast<HTTPMethod>(self->method);
    7287              : 
    7288              :             return 0;
    7289              :         }
    7290              :         static int on_url(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
    7291              :         {
    7292              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7293              :             self->req.raw_url.insert(self->req.raw_url.end(), at, at + length);
    7294              :             self->req.url_params = query_string(self->req.raw_url);
    7295              :             self->req.url = self->req.raw_url.substr(0, self->qs_point != 0 ? self->qs_point : std::string::npos);
    7296              : 
    7297              :             self->process_url();
    7298              : 
    7299              :             return 0;
    7300              :         }
    7301              :         static int on_header_field(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
    7302              :         {
    7303              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7304              :             switch (self->header_building_state)
    7305              :             {
    7306              :                 case 0:
    7307              :                     if (!self->header_value.empty())
    7308              :                     {
    7309              :                         self->req.headers.emplace(std::move(self->header_field), std::move(self->header_value));
    7310              :                     }
    7311              :                     self->header_field.assign(at, at + length);
    7312              :                     self->header_building_state = 1;
    7313              :                     break;
    7314              :                 case 1:
    7315              :                     self->header_field.insert(self->header_field.end(), at, at + length);
    7316              :                     break;
    7317              :             }
    7318              :             return 0;
    7319              :         }
    7320              :         static int on_header_value(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
    7321              :         {
    7322              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7323              :             switch (self->header_building_state)
    7324              :             {
    7325              :                 case 0:
    7326              :                     self->header_value.insert(self->header_value.end(), at, at + length);
    7327              :                     break;
    7328              :                 case 1:
    7329              :                     self->header_building_state = 0;
    7330              :                     self->header_value.assign(at, at + length);
    7331              :                     break;
    7332              :             }
    7333              :             return 0;
    7334              :         }
    7335              :         static int on_headers_complete(http_parser* self_)
    7336              :         {
    7337              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7338              :             if (!self->header_field.empty())
    7339              :             {
    7340              :                 self->req.headers.emplace(std::move(self->header_field), std::move(self->header_value));
    7341              :             }
    7342              : 
    7343              :             self->set_connection_parameters();
    7344              : 
    7345              :             self->process_header();
    7346              :             return 0;
    7347              :         }
    7348              :         static int on_body(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
    7349              :         {
    7350              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7351              :             self->req.body.insert(self->req.body.end(), at, at + length);
    7352              :             return 0;
    7353              :         }
    7354              :         static int on_message_complete(http_parser* self_)
    7355              :         {
    7356              :             HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
    7357              : 
    7358              :             self->message_complete = true;
    7359              :             self->process_message();
    7360              :             return 0;
    7361              :         }
    7362              :         HTTPParser(Handler* handler):
    7363              :           http_parser(),
    7364              :           handler_(handler)
    7365              :         {
    7366              :             http_parser_init(this);
    7367              :         }
    7368              : 
    7369              :         // return false on error
    7370              :         /// Parse a buffer into the different sections of an HTTP request.
    7371              :         bool feed(const char* buffer, int length)
    7372              :         {
    7373              :             if (message_complete)
    7374              :                 return true;
    7375              : 
    7376              :             const static http_parser_settings settings_{
    7377              :               on_message_begin,
    7378              :               on_method,
    7379              :               on_url,
    7380              :               on_header_field,
    7381              :               on_header_value,
    7382              :               on_headers_complete,
    7383              :               on_body,
    7384              :               on_message_complete,
    7385              :             };
    7386              : 
    7387              :             int nparsed = http_parser_execute(this, &settings_, buffer, length);
    7388              :             if (http_errno != CHPE_OK)
    7389              :             {
    7390              :                 return false;
    7391              :             }
    7392              :             return nparsed == length;
    7393              :         }
    7394              : 
    7395              :         bool done()
    7396              :         {
    7397              :             return feed(nullptr, 0);
    7398              :         }
    7399              : 
    7400              :         void clear()
    7401              :         {
    7402              :             req = crow::request();
    7403              :             header_field.clear();
    7404              :             header_value.clear();
    7405              :             header_building_state = 0;
    7406              :             qs_point = 0;
    7407              :             message_complete = false;
    7408              :             state = CROW_NEW_MESSAGE();
    7409              :         }
    7410              : 
    7411              :         inline void process_url()
    7412              :         {
    7413              :             handler_->handle_url();
    7414              :         }
    7415              : 
    7416              :         inline void process_header()
    7417              :         {
    7418              :             handler_->handle_header();
    7419              :         }
    7420              : 
    7421              :         inline void process_message()
    7422              :         {
    7423              :             handler_->handle();
    7424              :         }
    7425              : 
    7426              :         inline void set_connection_parameters()
    7427              :         {
    7428              :             req.http_ver_major = http_major;
    7429              :             req.http_ver_minor = http_minor;
    7430              : 
    7431              :             //NOTE(EDev): it seems that the problem is with crow's policy on closing the connection for HTTP_VERSION < 1.0, the behaviour for that in crow is "don't close the connection, but don't send a keep-alive either"
    7432              : 
    7433              :             // HTTP1.1 = always send keep_alive, HTTP1.0 = only send if header exists, HTTP?.? = never send
    7434              :             req.keep_alive = (http_major == 1 && http_minor == 0) ?
    7435              :                                ((flags & F_CONNECTION_KEEP_ALIVE) ? true : false) :
    7436              :                                ((http_major == 1 && http_minor == 1) ? true : false);
    7437              : 
    7438              :             // HTTP1.1 = only close if close header exists, HTTP1.0 = always close unless keep_alive header exists, HTTP?.?= never close
    7439              :             req.close_connection = (http_major == 1 && http_minor == 0) ?
    7440              :                                      ((flags & F_CONNECTION_KEEP_ALIVE) ? false : true) :
    7441              :                                      ((http_major == 1 && http_minor == 1) ? ((flags & F_CONNECTION_CLOSE) ? true : false) : false);
    7442              :             req.upgrade = static_cast<bool>(upgrade);
    7443              :         }
    7444              : 
    7445              :         /// The final request that this parser outputs.
    7446              :         ///
    7447              :         /// Data parsed is put directly into this object as soon as the related callback returns. (e.g. the request will have the cooorect method as soon as on_method() returns)
    7448              :         request req;
    7449              : 
    7450              :     private:
    7451              :         int header_building_state = 0;
    7452              :         bool message_complete = false;
    7453              :         std::string header_field;
    7454              :         std::string header_value;
    7455              : 
    7456              :         Handler* handler_; ///< This is currently an HTTP connection object (\ref crow.Connection).
    7457              :     };
    7458              : } // namespace crow
    7459              : 
    7460              : #undef CROW_NEW_MESSAGE
    7461              : #undef CROW_start_state
    7462              : 
    7463              : /**
    7464              :  * \file crow/mustache.h
    7465              :  * \brief This file includes the definition of the crow::mustache
    7466              :  * namespace and its members.
    7467              :  */
    7468              : 
    7469              : #include <string>
    7470              : #include <vector>
    7471              : #include <fstream>
    7472              : #include <iterator>
    7473              : #include <functional>
    7474              : 
    7475              : namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
    7476              : {
    7477              :     /**
    7478              :      * \namespace crow::mustache
    7479              :      * \brief In this namespace is defined most of the functions and
    7480              :      * classes related to template rendering.
    7481              :      *
    7482              :      * If you are here you might want to read these functions and
    7483              :      * classes:
    7484              :      *
    7485              :      * - \ref template_t
    7486              :      * - \ref load_text
    7487              :      * - \ref load_text_unsafe
    7488              :      * - \ref load
    7489              :      * - \ref load_unsafe
    7490              :      *
    7491              :      * As name suggest, crow uses [mustache](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mustache_(template_system))
    7492              :      * as main template rendering system.
    7493              :      *
    7494              :      * You may be interested in taking a look at the [Templating guide
    7495              :      * page](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/templating/).
    7496              :      */
    7497              :     namespace mustache
    7498              :     {
    7499              :         using context = json::wvalue;
    7500              : 
    7501              :         template_t load(const std::string& filename);
    7502              : 
    7503              :         /**
    7504              :          * \class invalid_template_exception
    7505              :          * \brief Represents compilation error of an template. Throwed
    7506              :          * specially at mustache compile time.
    7507              :          */
    7508              :         class invalid_template_exception : public std::exception
    7509              :         {
    7510              :         public:
    7511              :             invalid_template_exception(const std::string& msg_):
    7512              :               msg("crow::mustache error: " + msg_)
    7513              :             {}
    7514              :             virtual const char* what() const throw() override
    7515              :             {
    7516              :                 return msg.c_str();
    7517              :             }
    7518              :             std::string msg;
    7519              :         };
    7520              : 
    7521              :         /**
    7522              :          * \struct rendered_template
    7523              :          * \brief Returned object after call the
    7524              :          * \ref template_t::render() method. Its intended to be
    7525              :          * returned during a **rule declaration**.
    7526              :          *
    7527              :          * \see \ref CROW_ROUTE
    7528              :          * \see \ref CROW_BP_ROUTE
    7529              :          */
    7530              :         struct rendered_template : returnable
    7531              :         {
    7532              :             rendered_template():
    7533              :               returnable("text/html") {}
    7534              : 
    7535              :             rendered_template(std::string& body):
    7536              :               returnable("text/html"), body_(std::move(body)) {}
    7537              : 
    7538              :             std::string body_;
    7539              : 
    7540              :             std::string dump() const override
    7541              :             {
    7542              :                 return body_;
    7543              :             }
    7544              :         };
    7545              : 
    7546              :         /**
    7547              :          * \enum ActionType
    7548              :          * \brief Used in \ref Action to represent different parsing
    7549              :          * behaviors.
    7550              :          *
    7551              :          * \see \ref Action
    7552              :          */
    7553              :         enum class ActionType
    7554              :         {
    7555              :             Ignore,
    7556              :             Tag,
    7557              :             UnescapeTag,
    7558              :             OpenBlock,
    7559              :             CloseBlock,
    7560              :             ElseBlock,
    7561              :             Partial,
    7562              :         };
    7563              : 
    7564              :         /**
    7565              :          * \struct Action
    7566              :          * \brief Used during mustache template compilation to
    7567              :          * represent parsing actions.
    7568              :          *
    7569              :          * \see \ref compile
    7570              :          * \see \ref template_t
    7571              :          */
    7572              :         struct Action
    7573              :         {
    7574              :             bool has_end_match;
    7575              :             char tag_char;
    7576              :             int start;
    7577              :             int end;
    7578              :             int pos;
    7579              :             ActionType t;
    7580              : 
    7581              :             Action(char tag_char_, ActionType t_, size_t start_, size_t end_, size_t pos_ = 0):
    7582              :               has_end_match(false), tag_char(tag_char_), start(static_cast<int>(start_)), end(static_cast<int>(end_)), pos(static_cast<int>(pos_)), t(t_)
    7583              :             {
    7584              :             }
    7585              : 
    7586              :             bool missing_end_pair() const {
    7587              :                 switch (t)
    7588              :                 {
    7589              :                     case ActionType::Ignore:
    7590              :                     case ActionType::Tag:
    7591              :                     case ActionType::UnescapeTag:
    7592              :                     case ActionType::CloseBlock:
    7593              :                     case ActionType::Partial:
    7594              :                         return false;
    7595              : 
    7596              :                     // requires a match
    7597              :                     case ActionType::OpenBlock:
    7598              :                     case ActionType::ElseBlock:
    7599              :                         return !has_end_match;
    7600              : 
    7601              :                     default:
    7602              :                         throw std::logic_error("invalid type");
    7603              :                 }
    7604              :             }
    7605              :         };
    7606              : 
    7607              :         /**
    7608              :          * \class template_t
    7609              :          * \brief Compiled mustache template object.
    7610              :          *
    7611              :          * \warning Use \ref compile instead.
    7612              :          */
    7613              :         class template_t
    7614              :         {
    7615              :         public:
    7616              :             template_t(std::string body):
    7617              :               body_(std::move(body))
    7618              :             {
    7619              :                 // {{ {{# {{/ {{^ {{! {{> {{=
    7620              :                 parse();
    7621              :             }
    7622              : 
    7623              :         private:
    7624              :             std::string tag_name(const Action& action) const
    7625              :             {
    7626              :                 return body_.substr(action.start, action.end - action.start);
    7627              :             }
    7628              :             auto find_context(const std::string& name, const std::vector<const context*>& stack, bool shouldUseOnlyFirstStackValue = false) const -> std::pair<bool, const context&>
    7629              :             {
    7630              :                 if (name == ".")
    7631              :                 {
    7632              :                     return {true, *stack.back()};
    7633              :                 }
    7634              :                 static json::wvalue empty_str;
    7635              :                 empty_str = "";
    7636              : 
    7637              :                 int dotPosition = name.find(".");
    7638              :                 if (dotPosition == static_cast<int>(name.npos))
    7639              :                 {
    7640              :                     for (auto it = stack.rbegin(); it != stack.rend(); ++it)
    7641              :                     {
    7642              :                         if ((*it)->t() == json::type::Object)
    7643              :                         {
    7644              :                             if ((*it)->count(name))
    7645              :                                 return {true, (**it)[name]};
    7646              :                         }
    7647              :                     }
    7648              :                 }
    7649              :                 else
    7650              :                 {
    7651              :                     std::vector<int> dotPositions;
    7652              :                     dotPositions.push_back(-1);
    7653              :                     while (dotPosition != static_cast<int>(name.npos))
    7654              :                     {
    7655              :                         dotPositions.push_back(dotPosition);
    7656              :                         dotPosition = name.find(".", dotPosition + 1);
    7657              :                     }
    7658              :                     dotPositions.push_back(name.size());
    7659              :                     std::vector<std::string> names;
    7660              :                     names.reserve(dotPositions.size() - 1);
    7661              :                     for (int i = 1; i < static_cast<int>(dotPositions.size()); i++)
    7662              :                         names.emplace_back(name.substr(dotPositions[i - 1] + 1, dotPositions[i] - dotPositions[i - 1] - 1));
    7663              : 
    7664              :                     for (auto it = stack.rbegin(); it != stack.rend(); ++it)
    7665              :                     {
    7666              :                         const context* view = *it;
    7667              :                         bool found = true;
    7668              :                         for (auto jt = names.begin(); jt != names.end(); ++jt)
    7669              :                         {
    7670              :                             if (view->t() == json::type::Object &&
    7671              :                                 view->count(*jt))
    7672              :                             {
    7673              :                                 view = &(*view)[*jt];
    7674              :                             }
    7675              :                             else
    7676              :                             {
    7677              :                                 if (shouldUseOnlyFirstStackValue)
    7678              :                                 {
    7679              :                                     return {false, empty_str};
    7680              :                                 }
    7681              :                                 found = false;
    7682              :                                 break;
    7683              :                             }
    7684              :                         }
    7685              :                         if (found)
    7686              :                             return {true, *view};
    7687              :                     }
    7688              :                 }
    7689              : 
    7690              :                 return {false, empty_str};
    7691              :             }
    7692              : 
    7693              :             void escape(const std::string& in, std::string& out) const
    7694              :             {
    7695              :                 out.reserve(out.size() + in.size());
    7696              :                 for (auto it = in.begin(); it != in.end(); ++it)
    7697              :                 {
    7698              :                     switch (*it)
    7699              :                     {
    7700              :                         case '&': out += "&amp;"; break;
    7701              :                         case '<': out += "&lt;"; break;
    7702              :                         case '>': out += "&gt;"; break;
    7703              :                         case '"': out += "&quot;"; break;
    7704              :                         case '\'': out += "&#39;"; break;
    7705              :                         case '/': out += "&#x2F;"; break;
    7706              :                         case '`': out += "&#x60;"; break;
    7707              :                         case '=': out += "&#x3D;"; break;
    7708              :                         default: out += *it; break;
    7709              :                     }
    7710              :                 }
    7711              :             }
    7712              : 
    7713              :             bool isTagInsideObjectBlock(const int& current, const std::vector<const context*>& stack) const
    7714              :             {
    7715              :                 int openedBlock = 0;
    7716              :                 for (int i = current; i > 0; --i)
    7717              :                 {
    7718              :                     auto& action = actions_[i - 1];
    7719              : 
    7720              :                     if (action.t == ActionType::OpenBlock)
    7721              :                     {
    7722              :                         if (openedBlock == 0 && (*stack.rbegin())->t() == json::type::Object)
    7723              :                         {
    7724              :                             return true;
    7725              :                         }
    7726              :                         --openedBlock;
    7727              :                     }
    7728              :                     else if (action.t == ActionType::CloseBlock)
    7729              :                     {
    7730              :                         ++openedBlock;
    7731              :                     }
    7732              :                 }
    7733              : 
    7734              :                 return false;
    7735              :             }
    7736              : 
    7737              :             void render_internal(int actionBegin, int actionEnd, std::vector<const context*>& stack, std::string& out, int indent) const
    7738              :             {
    7739              :                 int current = actionBegin;
    7740              : 
    7741              :                 if (indent)
    7742              :                     out.insert(out.size(), indent, ' ');
    7743              : 
    7744              :                 while (current < actionEnd)
    7745              :                 {
    7746              :                     auto& fragment = fragments_[current];
    7747              :                     auto& action = actions_[current];
    7748              :                     render_fragment(fragment, indent, out);
    7749              :                     switch (action.t)
    7750              :                     {
    7751              :                         case ActionType::Ignore:
    7752              :                             // do nothing
    7753              :                             break;
    7754              :                         case ActionType::Partial:
    7755              :                         {
    7756              :                             std::string partial_name = tag_name(action);
    7757              :                             auto partial_templ = load(partial_name);
    7758              :                             int partial_indent = action.pos;
    7759              :                             partial_templ.render_internal(0, partial_templ.fragments_.size() - 1, stack, out, partial_indent ? indent + partial_indent : 0);
    7760              :                         }
    7761              :                         break;
    7762              :                         case ActionType::UnescapeTag:
    7763              :                         case ActionType::Tag:
    7764              :                         {
    7765              :                             bool shouldUseOnlyFirstStackValue = false;
    7766              :                             if (isTagInsideObjectBlock(current, stack))
    7767              :                             {
    7768              :                                 shouldUseOnlyFirstStackValue = true;
    7769              :                             }
    7770              :                             auto optional_ctx = find_context(tag_name(action), stack, shouldUseOnlyFirstStackValue);
    7771              :                             auto& ctx = optional_ctx.second;
    7772              :                             switch (ctx.t())
    7773              :                             {
    7774              :                                 case json::type::False:
    7775              :                                 case json::type::True:
    7776              :                                 case json::type::Number:
    7777              :                                     out += ctx.dump();
    7778              :                                     break;
    7779              :                                 case json::type::String:
    7780              :                                     if (action.t == ActionType::Tag)
    7781              :                                         escape(ctx.s, out);
    7782              :                                     else
    7783              :                                         out += ctx.s;
    7784              :                                     break;
    7785              :                                 case json::type::Function:
    7786              :                                 {
    7787              :                                     std::string execute_result = ctx.execute();
    7788              :                                     while (execute_result.find("{{") != std::string::npos)
    7789              :                                     {
    7790              :                                         template_t result_plug(execute_result);
    7791              :                                         execute_result = result_plug.render_string(*(stack[0]));
    7792              :                                     }
    7793              : 
    7794              :                                     if (action.t == ActionType::Tag)
    7795              :                                         escape(execute_result, out);
    7796              :                                     else
    7797              :                                         out += execute_result;
    7798              :                                 }
    7799              :                                 break;
    7800              :                                 default:
    7801              :                                     throw std::runtime_error("not implemented tag type" + utility::lexical_cast<std::string>(static_cast<int>(ctx.t())));
    7802              :                             }
    7803              :                         }
    7804              :                         break;
    7805              :                         case ActionType::ElseBlock:
    7806              :                         {
    7807              :                             static context nullContext;
    7808              :                             auto optional_ctx = find_context(tag_name(action), stack);
    7809              :                             if (!optional_ctx.first)
    7810              :                             {
    7811              :                                 stack.emplace_back(&nullContext);
    7812              :                                 break;
    7813              :                             }
    7814              : 
    7815              :                             auto& ctx = optional_ctx.second;
    7816              :                             switch (ctx.t())
    7817              :                             {
    7818              :                                 case json::type::List:
    7819              :                                     if (ctx.l && !ctx.l->empty())
    7820              :                                         current = action.pos;
    7821              :                                     else
    7822              :                                         stack.emplace_back(&nullContext);
    7823              :                                     break;
    7824              :                                 case json::type::False:
    7825              :                                 case json::type::Null:
    7826              :                                     stack.emplace_back(&nullContext);
    7827              :                                     break;
    7828              :                                 default:
    7829              :                                     current = action.pos;
    7830              :                                     break;
    7831              :                             }
    7832              :                             break;
    7833              :                         }
    7834              :                         case ActionType::OpenBlock:
    7835              :                         {
    7836              :                             auto optional_ctx = find_context(tag_name(action), stack);
    7837              :                             if (!optional_ctx.first)
    7838              :                             {
    7839              :                                 current = action.pos;
    7840              :                                 break;
    7841              :                             }
    7842              : 
    7843              :                             auto& ctx = optional_ctx.second;
    7844              :                             switch (ctx.t())
    7845              :                             {
    7846              :                                 case json::type::List:
    7847              :                                     if (ctx.l)
    7848              :                                         for (auto it = ctx.l->begin(); it != ctx.l->end(); ++it)
    7849              :                                         {
    7850              :                                             stack.push_back(&*it);
    7851              :                                             render_internal(current + 1, action.pos, stack, out, indent);
    7852              :                                             stack.pop_back();
    7853              :                                         }
    7854              :                                     current = action.pos;
    7855              :                                     break;
    7856              :                                 case json::type::Number:
    7857              :                                 case json::type::String:
    7858              :                                 case json::type::Object:
    7859              :                                 case json::type::True:
    7860              :                                     stack.push_back(&ctx);
    7861              :                                     break;
    7862              :                                 case json::type::False:
    7863              :                                 case json::type::Null:
    7864              :                                     current = action.pos;
    7865              :                                     break;
    7866              :                                 default:
    7867              :                                     throw std::runtime_error("{{#: not implemented context type: " + utility::lexical_cast<std::string>(static_cast<int>(ctx.t())));
    7868              :                                     break;
    7869              :                             }
    7870              :                             break;
    7871              :                         }
    7872              :                         case ActionType::CloseBlock:
    7873              :                             stack.pop_back();
    7874              :                             break;
    7875              :                         default:
    7876              :                             throw std::runtime_error("not implemented " + utility::lexical_cast<std::string>(static_cast<int>(action.t)));
    7877              :                     }
    7878              :                     current++;
    7879              :                 }
    7880              :                 auto& fragment = fragments_[actionEnd];
    7881              :                 render_fragment(fragment, indent, out);
    7882              :             }
    7883              :             void render_fragment(const std::pair<int, int> fragment, int indent, std::string& out) const
    7884              :             {
    7885              :                 if (indent)
    7886              :                 {
    7887              :                     for (int i = fragment.first; i < fragment.second; i++)
    7888              :                     {
    7889              :                         out += body_[i];
    7890              :                         if (body_[i] == '\n' && i + 1 != static_cast<int>(body_.size()))
    7891              :                             out.insert(out.size(), indent, ' ');
    7892              :                     }
    7893              :                 }
    7894              :                 else
    7895              :                     out.insert(out.size(), body_, fragment.first, fragment.second - fragment.first);
    7896              :             }
    7897              : 
    7898              :         public:
    7899              :             /// Output a returnable template from this mustache template
    7900              :             rendered_template render() const
    7901              :             {
    7902              :                 context empty_ctx;
    7903              :                 std::vector<const context*> stack;
    7904              :                 stack.emplace_back(&empty_ctx);
    7905              : 
    7906              :                 std::string ret;
    7907              :                 render_internal(0, fragments_.size() - 1, stack, ret, 0);
    7908              :                 return rendered_template(ret);
    7909              :             }
    7910              : 
    7911              :             /// Apply the values from the context provided and output a returnable template from this mustache template
    7912              :             rendered_template render(const context& ctx) const
    7913              :             {
    7914              :                 std::vector<const context*> stack;
    7915              :                 stack.emplace_back(&ctx);
    7916              : 
    7917              :                 std::string ret;
    7918              :                 render_internal(0, fragments_.size() - 1, stack, ret, 0);
    7919              :                 return rendered_template(ret);
    7920              :             }
    7921              : 
    7922              :             /// Apply the values from the context provided and output a returnable template from this mustache template
    7923              :             rendered_template render(const context&& ctx) const
    7924              :             {
    7925              :                 return render(ctx);
    7926              :             }
    7927              : 
    7928              :             /// Output a returnable template from this mustache template
    7929              :             std::string render_string() const
    7930              :             {
    7931              :                 context empty_ctx;
    7932              :                 std::vector<const context*> stack;
    7933              :                 stack.emplace_back(&empty_ctx);
    7934              : 
    7935              :                 std::string ret;
    7936              :                 render_internal(0, fragments_.size() - 1, stack, ret, 0);
    7937              :                 return ret;
    7938              :             }
    7939              : 
    7940              :             /// Apply the values from the context provided and output a returnable template from this mustache template
    7941              :             std::string render_string(const context& ctx) const
    7942              :             {
    7943              :                 std::vector<const context*> stack;
    7944              :                 stack.emplace_back(&ctx);
    7945              : 
    7946              :                 std::string ret;
    7947              :                 render_internal(0, fragments_.size() - 1, stack, ret, 0);
    7948              :                 return ret;
    7949              :             }
    7950              : 
    7951              :         private:
    7952              :             void parse()
    7953              :             {
    7954              :                 std::string tag_open = "{{";
    7955              :                 std::string tag_close = "}}";
    7956              : 
    7957              :                 std::vector<int> blockPositions;
    7958              : 
    7959              :                 size_t current = 0;
    7960              :                 while (1)
    7961              :                 {
    7962              :                     size_t idx = body_.find(tag_open, current);
    7963              :                     if (idx == body_.npos)
    7964              :                     {
    7965              :                         fragments_.emplace_back(static_cast<int>(current), static_cast<int>(body_.size()));
    7966              :                         actions_.emplace_back('!', ActionType::Ignore, 0, 0);
    7967              :                         break;
    7968              :                     }
    7969              :                     fragments_.emplace_back(static_cast<int>(current), static_cast<int>(idx));
    7970              : 
    7971              :                     idx += tag_open.size();
    7972              :                     size_t endIdx = body_.find(tag_close, idx);
    7973              :                     if (endIdx == idx)
    7974              :                     {
    7975              :                         throw invalid_template_exception("empty tag is not allowed");
    7976              :                     }
    7977              :                     if (endIdx == body_.npos)
    7978              :                     {
    7979              :                         // error, no matching tag
    7980              :                         throw invalid_template_exception("not matched opening tag");
    7981              :                     }
    7982              :                     current = endIdx + tag_close.size();
    7983              :                     char tag_char = body_[idx];
    7984              :                     switch (tag_char)
    7985              :                     {
    7986              :                         case '#':
    7987              :                             idx++;
    7988              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    7989              :                                 idx++;
    7990              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    7991              :                                 endIdx--;
    7992              :                             blockPositions.emplace_back(static_cast<int>(actions_.size()));
    7993              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::OpenBlock, idx, endIdx);
    7994              :                             break;
    7995              :                         case '/':
    7996              :                             idx++;
    7997              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    7998              :                                 idx++;
    7999              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    8000              :                                 endIdx--;
    8001              :                             {
    8002              :                                 if (blockPositions.empty())
    8003              :                                 {
    8004              :                                     throw invalid_template_exception(
    8005              :                                              std::string("unexpected closing tag: ")
    8006              :                                              + body_.substr(idx, endIdx - idx)
    8007              :                                              );
    8008              :                                 }
    8009              :                                 auto& matched = actions_[blockPositions.back()];
    8010              :                                 if (body_.compare(idx, endIdx - idx,
    8011              :                                                   body_, matched.start, matched.end - matched.start) != 0)
    8012              :                                 {
    8013              :                                      throw invalid_template_exception(
    8014              :                                              std::string("not matched {{")
    8015              :                                              + matched.tag_char
    8016              :                                              + "{{/ pair: "
    8017              :                                              + body_.substr(matched.start, matched.end - matched.start) + ", "
    8018              :                                              + body_.substr(idx, endIdx - idx)
    8019              :                                              );
    8020              :                                 }
    8021              :                                 matched.pos = static_cast<int>(actions_.size());
    8022              :                                 matched.has_end_match = true;
    8023              :                             }
    8024              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::CloseBlock, idx, endIdx, blockPositions.back());
    8025              :                             blockPositions.pop_back();
    8026              :                             break;
    8027              :                         case '^':
    8028              :                             idx++;
    8029              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    8030              :                                 idx++;
    8031              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    8032              :                                 endIdx--;
    8033              :                             blockPositions.emplace_back(static_cast<int>(actions_.size()));
    8034              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::ElseBlock, idx, endIdx);
    8035              :                             break;
    8036              :                         case '!':
    8037              :                             // do nothing action
    8038              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::Ignore, idx + 1, endIdx);
    8039              :                             break;
    8040              :                         case '>': // partial
    8041              :                             idx++;
    8042              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    8043              :                                 idx++;
    8044              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    8045              :                                 endIdx--;
    8046              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::Partial, idx, endIdx);
    8047              :                             break;
    8048              :                         case '{':
    8049              :                             if (tag_open != "{{" || tag_close != "}}")
    8050              :                                 throw invalid_template_exception("cannot use triple mustache when delimiter changed");
    8051              : 
    8052              :                             idx++;
    8053              :                             if (body_[endIdx + 2] != '}')
    8054              :                             {
    8055              :                                 throw invalid_template_exception("{{{: }}} not matched");
    8056              :                             }
    8057              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    8058              :                                 idx++;
    8059              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    8060              :                                 endIdx--;
    8061              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::UnescapeTag, idx, endIdx);
    8062              :                             current++;
    8063              :                             break;
    8064              :                         case '&':
    8065              :                             idx++;
    8066              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    8067              :                                 idx++;
    8068              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    8069              :                                 endIdx--;
    8070              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::UnescapeTag, idx, endIdx);
    8071              :                             break;
    8072              :                         case '=':
    8073              :                             // tag itself is no-op
    8074              :                             idx++;
    8075              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::Ignore, idx, endIdx);
    8076              :                             endIdx--;
    8077              :                             if (body_[endIdx] != '=')
    8078              :                                 throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: not matching = tag: " + body_.substr(idx, endIdx - idx));
    8079              :                             endIdx--;
    8080              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    8081              :                                 idx++;
    8082              :                             while (body_[endIdx] == ' ')
    8083              :                                 endIdx--;
    8084              :                             endIdx++;
    8085              :                             {
    8086              :                                 bool succeeded = false;
    8087              :                                 for (size_t i = idx; i < endIdx; i++)
    8088              :                                 {
    8089              :                                     if (body_[i] == ' ')
    8090              :                                     {
    8091              :                                         tag_open = body_.substr(idx, i - idx);
    8092              :                                         while (body_[i] == ' ')
    8093              :                                             i++;
    8094              :                                         tag_close = body_.substr(i, endIdx - i);
    8095              :                                         if (tag_open.empty())
    8096              :                                             throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: empty open tag");
    8097              :                                         if (tag_close.empty())
    8098              :                                             throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: empty close tag");
    8099              : 
    8100              :                                         if (tag_close.find(" ") != tag_close.npos)
    8101              :                                             throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: invalid open/close tag: " + tag_open + " " + tag_close);
    8102              :                                         succeeded = true;
    8103              :                                         break;
    8104              :                                     }
    8105              :                                 }
    8106              :                                 if (!succeeded)
    8107              :                                     throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: cannot find space between new open/close tags");
    8108              :                             }
    8109              :                             break;
    8110              :                         default:
    8111              :                             // normal tag case;
    8112              :                             while (body_[idx] == ' ')
    8113              :                                 idx++;
    8114              :                             while (body_[endIdx - 1] == ' ')
    8115              :                                 endIdx--;
    8116              :                             actions_.emplace_back(tag_char, ActionType::Tag, idx, endIdx);
    8117              :                             break;
    8118              :                     }
    8119              :                 }
    8120              : 
    8121              :                 // ensure no unmatched tags
    8122              :                 for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(actions_.size()); i++)
    8123              :                 {
    8124              :                     if (actions_[i].missing_end_pair())
    8125              :                     {
    8126              :                         throw invalid_template_exception(
    8127              :                                 std::string("open tag has no matching end tag {{")
    8128              :                                 + actions_[i].tag_char
    8129              :                                 + " {{/ pair: "
    8130              :                                 + body_.substr(actions_[i].start, actions_[i].end - actions_[i].start)
    8131              :                                 );
    8132              :                     }
    8133              :                 }
    8134              : 
    8135              :                 // removing standalones
    8136              :                 for (int i = static_cast<int>(actions_.size()) - 2; i >= 0; i--)
    8137              :                 {
    8138              :                     if (actions_[i].t == ActionType::Tag || actions_[i].t == ActionType::UnescapeTag)
    8139              :                         continue;
    8140              :                     auto& fragment_before = fragments_[i];
    8141              :                     auto& fragment_after = fragments_[i + 1];
    8142              :                     bool is_last_action = i == static_cast<int>(actions_.size()) - 2;
    8143              :                     bool all_space_before = true;
    8144              :                     int j, k;
    8145              :                     for (j = fragment_before.second - 1; j >= fragment_before.first; j--)
    8146              :                     {
    8147              :                         if (body_[j] != ' ')
    8148              :                         {
    8149              :                             all_space_before = false;
    8150              :                             break;
    8151              :                         }
    8152              :                     }
    8153              :                     if (all_space_before && i > 0)
    8154              :                         continue;
    8155              :                     if (!all_space_before && body_[j] != '\n')
    8156              :                         continue;
    8157              :                     bool all_space_after = true;
    8158              :                     for (k = fragment_after.first; k < static_cast<int>(body_.size()) && k < fragment_after.second; k++)
    8159              :                     {
    8160              :                         if (body_[k] != ' ')
    8161              :                         {
    8162              :                             all_space_after = false;
    8163              :                             break;
    8164              :                         }
    8165              :                     }
    8166              :                     if (all_space_after && !is_last_action)
    8167              :                         continue;
    8168              :                     if (!all_space_after &&
    8169              :                         !(
    8170              :                           body_[k] == '\n' ||
    8171              :                           (body_[k] == '\r' &&
    8172              :                            k + 1 < static_cast<int>(body_.size()) &&
    8173              :                            body_[k + 1] == '\n')))
    8174              :                         continue;
    8175              :                     if (actions_[i].t == ActionType::Partial)
    8176              :                     {
    8177              :                         actions_[i].pos = fragment_before.second - j - 1;
    8178              :                     }
    8179              :                     fragment_before.second = j + 1;
    8180              :                     if (!all_space_after)
    8181              :                     {
    8182              :                         if (body_[k] == '\n')
    8183              :                             k++;
    8184              :                         else
    8185              :                             k += 2;
    8186              :                         fragment_after.first = k;
    8187              :                     }
    8188              :                 }
    8189              :             }
    8190              : 
    8191              :             std::vector<std::pair<int, int>> fragments_;
    8192              :             std::vector<Action> actions_;
    8193              :             std::string body_;
    8194              :         };
    8195              : 
    8196              :         /// \brief The function that compiles a source into a mustache
    8197              :         /// template.
    8198              :         inline template_t compile(const std::string& body)
    8199              :         {
    8200              :             return template_t(body);
    8201              :         }
    8202              : 
    8203              :         namespace detail
    8204              :         {
    8205              :             inline std::string& get_template_base_directory_ref()
    8206              :             {
    8207              :                 static std::string template_base_directory = "templates";
    8208              :                 return template_base_directory;
    8209              :             }
    8210              : 
    8211              :             /// A base directory not related to any blueprint
    8212              :             inline std::string& get_global_template_base_directory_ref()
    8213              :             {
    8214              :                 static std::string template_base_directory = "templates";
    8215              :                 return template_base_directory;
    8216              :             }
    8217              :         } // namespace detail
    8218              : 
    8219              :         /// \brief The default way that \ref load, \ref load_unsafe,
    8220              :         /// \ref load_text and \ref load_text_unsafe use to read the
    8221              :         /// contents of a file.
    8222              :         inline std::string default_loader(const std::string& filename)
    8223              :         {
    8224              :             std::string path = detail::get_template_base_directory_ref();
    8225              :             std::ifstream inf(utility::join_path(path, filename));
    8226              :             if (!inf)
    8227              :             {
    8228              :                 CROW_LOG_WARNING << "Template \"" << filename << "\" not found.";
    8229              :                 return {};
    8230              :             }
    8231              :             return {std::istreambuf_iterator<char>(inf), std::istreambuf_iterator<char>()};
    8232              :         }
    8233              : 
    8234              :         namespace detail
    8235              :         {
    8236              :             inline std::function<std::string(std::string)>& get_loader_ref()
    8237              :             {
    8238              :                 static std::function<std::string(std::string)> loader = default_loader;
    8239              :                 return loader;
    8240              :             }
    8241              :         } // namespace detail
    8242              : 
    8243              :         /// \brief Defines the templates directory path at **route
    8244              :         /// level**. By default is `templates/`.
    8245              :         inline void set_base(const std::string& path)
    8246              :         {
    8247              :             auto& base = detail::get_template_base_directory_ref();
    8248              :             base = path;
    8249              :             if (base.back() != '\\' &&
    8250              :                 base.back() != '/')
    8251              :             {
    8252              :                 base += '/';
    8253              :             }
    8254              :         }
    8255              : 
    8256              :         /// \brief Defines the templates directory path at **global
    8257              :         /// level**. By default is `templates/`.
    8258              :         inline void set_global_base(const std::string& path)
    8259              :         {
    8260              :             auto& base = detail::get_global_template_base_directory_ref();
    8261              :             base = path;
    8262              :             if (base.back() != '\\' &&
    8263              :                 base.back() != '/')
    8264              :             {
    8265              :                 base += '/';
    8266              :             }
    8267              :         }
    8268              : 
    8269              :         /// \brief Change the way that \ref load, \ref load_unsafe,
    8270              :         /// \ref load_text and \ref load_text_unsafe reads a file.
    8271              :         ///
    8272              :         /// By default, the previously mentioned functions load files
    8273              :         /// using \ref default_loader, that only reads a file and
    8274              :         /// returns a std::string.
    8275              :         inline void set_loader(std::function<std::string(std::string)> loader)
    8276              :         {
    8277              :             detail::get_loader_ref() = std::move(loader);
    8278              :         }
    8279              : 
    8280              :         /// \brief Open, read and sanitize a file but returns a
    8281              :         /// std::string without a previous rendering process.
    8282              :         ///
    8283              :         /// Except for the **sanitize process** this function does the
    8284              :         /// almost the same thing that \ref load_text_unsafe.
    8285              :         inline std::string load_text(const std::string& filename)
    8286              :         {
    8287              :             std::string filename_sanitized(filename);
    8288              :             utility::sanitize_filename(filename_sanitized);
    8289              :             return detail::get_loader_ref()(filename_sanitized);
    8290              :         }
    8291              : 
    8292              :         /// \brief Open and read a file but returns a std::string
    8293              :         /// without a previous rendering process.
    8294              :         ///
    8295              :         /// This function is more like a helper to reduce code like
    8296              :         /// this...
    8297              :         ///
    8298              :         /// ```cpp
    8299              :         /// std::ifstream file("home.html");
    8300              :         /// return std::string({std::istreambuf_iterator<char>(file), std::istreambuf_iterator<char>()});
    8301              :         /// ```
    8302              :         ///
    8303              :         /// ... Into this...
    8304              :         ///
    8305              :         /// ```cpp
    8306              :         /// return load("home.html");
    8307              :         /// ```
    8308              :         ///
    8309              :         /// \warning Usually \ref load_text is more recommended to use
    8310              :         /// instead because it may prevent some [XSS Attacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_scripting).
    8311              :         /// **Never blindly trust your users!**
    8312              :         inline std::string load_text_unsafe(const std::string& filename)
    8313              :         {
    8314              :             return detail::get_loader_ref()(filename);
    8315              :         }
    8316              : 
    8317              :         /// \brief Open, read and renders a file using a mustache
    8318              :         /// compiler. It also sanitize the input before compilation.
    8319              :         inline template_t load(const std::string& filename)
    8320              :         {
    8321              :             std::string filename_sanitized(filename);
    8322              :             utility::sanitize_filename(filename_sanitized);
    8323              :             return compile(detail::get_loader_ref()(filename_sanitized));
    8324              :         }
    8325              : 
    8326              :         /// \brief Open, read and renders a file using a mustache
    8327              :         /// compiler. But it **do not** sanitize the input before
    8328              :         /// compilation.
    8329              :         ///
    8330              :         /// \warning Usually \ref load is more recommended to use
    8331              :         /// instead because it may prevent some [XSS Attacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_scripting).
    8332              :         /// **Never blindly trust your users!**
    8333              :         inline template_t load_unsafe(const std::string& filename)
    8334              :         {
    8335              :             return compile(detail::get_loader_ref()(filename));
    8336              :         }
    8337              :     } // namespace mustache
    8338              : } // namespace crow
    8339              : 
    8340              : #include <stdexcept>
    8341              : 
    8342              : namespace crow
    8343              : {
    8344              :     struct bad_request : public std::runtime_error
    8345              :     {
    8346              :         bad_request(const std::string& what_arg)
    8347              :             : std::runtime_error(what_arg) {}
    8348              : 
    8349              :         bad_request(const char* what_arg)
    8350              :             : std::runtime_error(what_arg) {}
    8351              :     };
    8352              : }
    8353              : 
    8354              : #include <string>
    8355              : #include <vector>
    8356              : #include <sstream>
    8357              : 
    8358              : 
    8359              : namespace crow
    8360              : {
    8361              : 
    8362              :     /// Encapsulates anything related to processing and organizing `multipart/xyz` messages
    8363              :     namespace multipart
    8364              :     {
    8365              : 
    8366              :         const std::string dd = "--";
    8367              : 
    8368              :         /// The first part in a section, contains metadata about the part
    8369              :         struct header
    8370              :         {
    8371              :             std::string value;                                   ///< The first part of the header, usually `Content-Type` or `Content-Disposition`
    8372              :             std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> params; ///< The parameters of the header, come after the `value`
    8373              : 
    8374              :             operator int() const { return std::stoi(value); }    ///< Returns \ref value as integer
    8375              :             operator double() const { return std::stod(value); } ///< Returns \ref value as double
    8376              :         };
    8377              : 
    8378              :         /// Multipart header map (key is header key).
    8379              :         using mph_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string, header, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
    8380              : 
    8381              :         /// Find and return the value object associated with the key. (returns an empty class if nothing is found)
    8382              :         template<typename O, typename T>
    8383              :         inline const O& get_header_value_object(const T& headers, const std::string& key)
    8384              :         {
    8385              :             if (headers.count(key))
    8386              :             {
    8387              :                 return headers.find(key)->second;
    8388              :             }
    8389              :             static O empty;
    8390              :             return empty;
    8391              :         }
    8392              : 
    8393              :         /// Same as \ref get_header_value_object() but for \ref multipart.header
    8394              :         template<typename T>
    8395              :         inline const header& get_header_object(const T& headers, const std::string& key)
    8396              :         {
    8397              :             return get_header_value_object<header>(headers, key);
    8398              :         }
    8399              : 
    8400              :         ///One part of the multipart message
    8401              : 
    8402              :         ///
    8403              :         /// It is usually separated from other sections by a `boundary`
    8404              :         struct part
    8405              :         {
    8406              :             mph_map headers;  ///< (optional) The first part before the data, Contains information regarding the type of data and encoding
    8407              :             std::string body; ///< The actual data in the part
    8408              : 
    8409              :             operator int() const { return std::stoi(body); }    ///< Returns \ref body as integer
    8410              :             operator double() const { return std::stod(body); } ///< Returns \ref body as double
    8411              : 
    8412              :             const header& get_header_object(const std::string& key) const
    8413              :             {
    8414              :                 return multipart::get_header_object(headers, key);
    8415              :             }
    8416              :         };
    8417              : 
    8418              :         /// Multipart map (key is the name parameter).
    8419              :         using mp_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string, part, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
    8420              : 
    8421              :         /// The parsed multipart request/response
    8422              :         struct message : public returnable
    8423              :         {
    8424              :             ci_map headers;          ///< The request/response headers
    8425              :             std::string boundary;    ///< The text boundary that separates different `parts`
    8426              :             std::vector<part> parts; ///< The individual parts of the message
    8427              :             mp_map part_map;         ///< The individual parts of the message, organized in a map with the `name` header parameter being the key
    8428              :
