    8429              :             const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key) const
    8430              :             {
    8431              :                 return crow::get_header_value(headers, key);
    8432              :             }
    8433              : 
    8434              :             part get_part_by_name(const std::string& name)
    8435              :             {
    8436              :                 mp_map::iterator result = part_map.find(name);
    8437              :                 if (result != part_map.end())
    8438              :                     return result->second;
    8439              :                 else
    8440              :                     return {};
    8441              :             }
    8442              : 
    8443              :             /// Represent all parts as a string (**does not include message headers**)
    8444              :             std::string dump() const override
    8445              :             {
    8446              :                 std::stringstream str;
    8447              :                 std::string delimiter = dd + boundary;
    8448              : 
    8449              :                 for (unsigned i = 0; i < parts.size(); i++)
    8450              :                 {
    8451              :                     str << delimiter << crlf;
    8452              :                     str << dump(i);
    8453              :                 }
    8454              :                 str << delimiter << dd << crlf;
    8455              :                 return str.str();
    8456              :             }
    8457              : 
    8458              :             /// Represent an individual part as a string
    8459              :             std::string dump(int part_) const
    8460              :             {
    8461              :                 std::stringstream str;
    8462              :                 part item = parts[part_];
    8463              :                 for (auto& item_h : item.headers)
    8464              :                 {
    8465              :                     str << item_h.first << ": " << item_h.second.value;
    8466              :                     for (auto& it : item_h.second.params)
    8467              :                     {
    8468              :                         str << "; " << it.first << '=' << pad(it.second);
    8469              :                     }
    8470              :                     str << crlf;
    8471              :                 }
    8472              :                 str << crlf;
    8473              :                 str << item.body << crlf;
    8474              :                 return str.str();
    8475              :             }
    8476              : 
    8477              :             /// Default constructor using default values
    8478              :             message(const ci_map& headers_, const std::string& boundary_, const std::vector<part>& sections):
    8479              :               returnable("multipart/form-data; boundary=CROW-BOUNDARY"), headers(headers_), boundary(boundary_), parts(sections)
    8480              :             {
    8481              :                 if (!boundary.empty())
    8482              :                     content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=" + boundary;
    8483              :                 for (auto& item : parts)
    8484              :                 {
    8485              :                     part_map.emplace(
    8486              :                       (get_header_object(item.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
    8487              :                       item);
    8488              :                 }
    8489              :             }
    8490              : 
    8491              :             /// Create a multipart message from a request data
    8492              :             explicit message(const request& req):
    8493              :               returnable("multipart/form-data; boundary=CROW-BOUNDARY"),
    8494              :               headers(req.headers),
    8495              :               boundary(get_boundary(get_header_value("Content-Type")))
    8496              :             {
    8497              :                 if (!boundary.empty())
    8498              :                 {
    8499              :                     content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=" + boundary;
    8500              :                     parse_body(req.body);
    8501              :                 }
    8502              :                 else
    8503              :                 {
    8504              :                     throw bad_request("Empty boundary in multipart message");
    8505              :                 }
    8506              :             }
    8507              : 
    8508              :         private:
    8509              :             std::string get_boundary(const std::string& header) const
    8510              :             {
    8511              :                 constexpr char boundary_text[] = "boundary=";
    8512              :                 size_t found = header.find(boundary_text);
    8513              :                 if (found != std::string::npos)
    8514              :                 {
    8515              :                     std::string to_return(header.substr(found + strlen(boundary_text)));
    8516              :                     if (to_return[0] == '\"')
    8517              :                     {
    8518              :                         to_return = to_return.substr(1, to_return.length() - 2);
    8519              :                     }
    8520              :                     return to_return;
    8521              :                 }
    8522              :                 return std::string();
    8523              :             }
    8524              : 
    8525              :             void parse_body(std::string body)
    8526              :             {
    8527              :                 std::string delimiter = dd + boundary;
    8528              : 
    8529              :                 // TODO(EDev): Exit on error
    8530              :                 while (body != (crlf))
    8531              :                 {
    8532              :                     size_t found = body.find(delimiter);
    8533              :                     if (found == std::string::npos)
    8534              :                     {
    8535              :                         // did not find delimiter; probably an ill-formed body; throw to indicate the issue to user
    8536              :                         throw bad_request("Unable to find delimiter in multipart message. Probably ill-formed body");
    8537              :                     }
    8538              :                     std::string section = body.substr(0, found);
    8539              : 
    8540              :                     // +2 is the CRLF.
    8541              :                     // We don't check it and delete it so that the same delimiter can be used for The last delimiter (--delimiter--CRLF).
    8542              :                     body.erase(0, found + delimiter.length() + 2);
    8543              :                     if (!section.empty())
    8544              :                     {
    8545              :                         part parsed_section(parse_section(section));
    8546              :                         part_map.emplace(
    8547              :                           (get_header_object(parsed_section.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
    8548              :                           parsed_section);
    8549              :                         parts.push_back(std::move(parsed_section));
    8550              :                     }
    8551              :                 }
    8552              :             }
    8553              : 
    8554              :             part parse_section(std::string& section)
    8555              :             {
    8556              :                 struct part to_return;
    8557              : 
    8558              :                 size_t found = section.find(crlf + crlf);
    8559              :                 std::string head_line = section.substr(0, found + 2);
    8560              :                 section.erase(0, found + 4);
    8561              : 
    8562              :                 parse_section_head(head_line, to_return);
    8563              :                 to_return.body = section.substr(0, section.length() - 2);
    8564              :                 return to_return;
    8565              :             }
    8566              : 
    8567              :             void parse_section_head(std::string& lines, part& part)
    8568              :             {
    8569              :                 while (!lines.empty())
    8570              :                 {
    8571              :                     header to_add;
    8572              : 
    8573              :                     const size_t found_crlf = lines.find(crlf);
    8574              :                     std::string line = lines.substr(0, found_crlf);
    8575              :                     std::string key;
    8576              :                     lines.erase(0, found_crlf + 2);
    8577              :                     // Add the header if available
    8578              :                     if (!line.empty())
    8579              :                     {
    8580              :                         const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
    8581              :                         std::string header = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
    8582              :                         if (found_semicolon != std::string::npos)
    8583              :                             line.erase(0, found_semicolon + 2);
    8584              :                         else
    8585              :                             line = std::string();
    8586              : 
    8587              :                         size_t header_split = header.find(": ");
    8588              :                         key = header.substr(0, header_split);
    8589              : 
    8590              :                         to_add.value = header.substr(header_split + 2);
    8591              :                     }
    8592              : 
    8593              :                     // Add the parameters
    8594              :                     while (!line.empty())
    8595              :                     {
    8596              :                         const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
    8597              :                         std::string param = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
    8598              :                         if (found_semicolon != std::string::npos)
    8599              :                             line.erase(0, found_semicolon + 2);
    8600              :                         else
    8601              :                             line = std::string();
    8602              : 
    8603              :                         size_t param_split = param.find('=');
    8604              : 
    8605              :                         std::string value = param.substr(param_split + 1);
    8606              : 
    8607              :                         to_add.params.emplace(param.substr(0, param_split), trim(value));
    8608              :                     }
    8609              :                     part.headers.emplace(key, to_add);
    8610              :                 }
    8611              :             }
    8612              : 
    8613              :             inline std::string trim(std::string& string, const char& excess = '"') const
    8614              :             {
    8615              :                 if (string.length() > 1 && string[0] == excess && string[string.length() - 1] == excess)
    8616              :                     return string.substr(1, string.length() - 2);
    8617              :                 return string;
    8618              :             }
    8619              : 
    8620              :             inline std::string pad(std::string& string, const char& padding = '"') const
    8621              :             {
    8622              :                 return (padding + string + padding);
    8623              :             }
    8624              :         };
    8625              :     } // namespace multipart
    8626              : } // namespace crow
    8627              : 
    8628              : 
    8629              : #include <charconv>
    8630              : #include <string>
    8631              : #include <vector>
    8632              : #include <string_view>
    8633              : #include <sstream>
    8634              : 
    8635              : // for crow::multipart::dd
    8636              : 
    8637              : namespace crow
    8638              : {
    8639              : 
    8640              :     /// Encapsulates anything related to processing and organizing `multipart/xyz` messages
    8641              :     namespace multipart
    8642              :     {
    8643              :         /// The first part in a section, contains metadata about the part
    8644              :         struct header_view
    8645              :         {
    8646              :             std::string_view value;                                        ///< The first part of the header, usually `Content-Type` or `Content-Disposition`
    8647              :             std::unordered_map<std::string_view, std::string_view> params; ///< The parameters of the header, come after the `value`
    8648              : 
    8649              :             /// Returns \ref value as integer
    8650              :             operator int() const
    8651              :             {
    8652              :                 int result = 0;
    8653              :                 std::from_chars(value.data(), value.data() + value.size(), result);
    8654              :                 return result;
    8655              :             }
    8656              : 
    8657              :             /// Returns \ref value as double
    8658              :             operator double() const
    8659              :             {
    8660              :                 // There's no std::from_chars for floating-point types in a lot of STLs
    8661              :                 return std::stod(static_cast<std::string>(value));
    8662              :             }
    8663              :         };
    8664              : 
    8665              :         /// Multipart header map (key is header key).
    8666              :         using mph_view_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string_view, header_view, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
    8667              : 
    8668              :         /// Finds and returns the header with the specified key. (returns an empty header if nothing is found)
    8669              :         inline const header_view& get_header_object(const mph_view_map& headers, const std::string_view key)
    8670              :         {
    8671              :             const auto header = headers.find(key);
    8672              :             if (header != headers.cend())
    8673              :             {
    8674              :                 return header->second;
    8675              :             }
    8676              : 
    8677              :             static header_view empty;
    8678              :             return empty;
    8679              :         }
    8680              : 
    8681              :         /// String padded with the specified padding (double quotes by default)
    8682              :         struct padded
    8683              :         {
    8684              :             std::string_view value;   ///< String to pad
    8685              :             const char padding = '"'; ///< Padding to use
    8686              : 
    8687              :             /// Outputs padded value to the stream
    8688              :             friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, const padded value_)
    8689              :             {
    8690              :                 return stream << value_.padding << value_.value << value_.padding;
    8691              :             }
    8692              :         };
    8693              : 
    8694              :         ///One part of the multipart message
    8695              : 
    8696              :         ///
    8697              :         /// It is usually separated from other sections by a `boundary`
    8698              :         struct part_view
    8699              :         {
    8700              :             mph_view_map headers;  ///< (optional) The first part before the data, Contains information regarding the type of data and encoding
    8701              :             std::string_view body; ///< The actual data in the part
    8702              : 
    8703              :             /// Returns \ref body as integer
    8704              :             operator int() const
    8705              :             {
    8706              :                 int result = 0;
    8707              :                 std::from_chars(body.data(), body.data() + body.size(), result);
    8708              :                 return result;
    8709              :             }
    8710              : 
    8711              :             /// Returns \ref body as double
    8712              :             operator double() const
    8713              :             {
    8714              :                 // There's no std::from_chars for floating-point types in a lot of STLs
    8715              :                 return std::stod(static_cast<std::string>(body));
    8716              :             }
    8717              : 
    8718              :             const header_view& get_header_object(const std::string_view key) const
    8719              :             {
    8720              :                 return multipart::get_header_object(headers, key);
    8721              :             }
    8722              : 
    8723              :             friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, const part_view& part)
    8724              :             {
    8725              :                 for (const auto& [header_key, header_value] : part.headers)
    8726              :                 {
    8727              :                     stream << header_key << ": " << header_value.value;
    8728              :                     for (const auto& [param_key, param_value] : header_value.params)
    8729              :                     {
    8730              :                         stream << "; " << param_key << '=' << padded{param_value};
    8731              :                     }
    8732              :                     stream << crlf;
    8733              :                 }
    8734              :                 stream << crlf;
    8735              :                 stream << part.body << crlf;
    8736              :                 return stream;
    8737              :             }
    8738              :         };
    8739              : 
    8740              :         /// Multipart map (key is the name parameter).
    8741              :         using mp_view_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string_view, part_view, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
    8742              : 
    8743              :         /// The parsed multipart request/response
    8744              :         struct message_view
    8745              :         {
    8746              :             std::reference_wrapper<const ci_map> headers; ///< The request/response headers
    8747              :             std::string boundary;                         ///< The text boundary that separates different `parts`
    8748              :             std::vector<part_view> parts;                 ///< The individual parts of the message
    8749              :             mp_view_map part_map;                         ///< The individual parts of the message, organized in a map with the `name` header parameter being the key
    8750              : 
    8751              :             const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key) const
    8752              :             {
    8753              :                 return crow::get_header_value(headers.get(), key);
    8754              :             }
    8755              : 
    8756              :             part_view get_part_by_name(const std::string_view name)
    8757              :             {
    8758              :                 mp_view_map::iterator result = part_map.find(name);
    8759              :                 if (result != part_map.end())
    8760              :                     return result->second;
    8761              :                 else
    8762              :                     return {};
    8763              :             }
    8764              : 
    8765              :             friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, const message_view message)
    8766              :             {
    8767              :                 std::string delimiter = dd + message.boundary;
    8768              : 
    8769              :                 for (const part_view& part : message.parts)
    8770              :                 {
    8771              :                     stream << delimiter << crlf;
    8772              :                     stream << part;
    8773              :                 }
    8774              :                 stream << delimiter << dd << crlf;
    8775              : 
    8776              :                 return stream;
    8777              :             }
    8778              : 
    8779              :             /// Represent all parts as a string (**does not include message headers**)
    8780              :             std::string dump() const
    8781              :             {
    8782              :                 std::ostringstream str;
    8783              :                 str << *this;
    8784              :                 return std::move(str).str();
    8785              :             }
    8786              : 
    8787              :             /// Represent an individual part as a string
    8788              :             std::string dump(int part_) const
    8789              :             {
    8790              :                 std::ostringstream str;
    8791              :                 str << parts.at(part_);
    8792              :                 return std::move(str).str();
    8793              :             }
    8794              : 
    8795              :             /// Default constructor using default values
    8796              :             message_view(const ci_map& headers_, const std::string& boundary_, const std::vector<part_view>& sections):
    8797              :               headers(headers_), boundary(boundary_), parts(sections)
    8798              :             {
    8799              :                 for (const part_view& item : parts)
    8800              :                 {
    8801              :                     part_map.emplace(
    8802              :                       (get_header_object(item.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
    8803              :                       item);
    8804              :                 }
    8805              :             }
    8806              : 
    8807              :             /// Create a multipart message from a request data
    8808              :             explicit message_view(const request& req):
    8809              :               headers(req.headers),
    8810              :               boundary(get_boundary(get_header_value("Content-Type")))
    8811              :             {
    8812              :                 parse_body(req.body);
    8813              :             }
    8814              : 
    8815              :         private:
    8816              :             std::string_view get_boundary(const std::string_view header) const
    8817              :             {
    8818              :                 constexpr std::string_view boundary_text = "boundary=";
    8819              :                 const size_t found = header.find(boundary_text);
    8820              :                 if (found == std::string_view::npos)
    8821              :                 {
    8822              :                     return std::string_view();
    8823              :                 }
    8824              : 
    8825              :                 const std::string_view to_return = header.substr(found + boundary_text.size());
    8826              :                 if (to_return[0] == '\"')
    8827              :                 {
    8828              :                     return to_return.substr(1, to_return.length() - 2);
    8829              :                 }
    8830              :                 return to_return;
    8831              :             }
    8832              : 
    8833              :             void parse_body(std::string_view body)
    8834              :             {
    8835              :                 const std::string delimiter = dd + boundary;
    8836              : 
    8837              :                 // TODO(EDev): Exit on error
    8838              :                 while (body != (crlf))
    8839              :                 {
    8840              :                     const size_t found = body.find(delimiter);
    8841              :                     if (found == std::string_view::npos)
    8842              :                     {
    8843              :                         // did not find delimiter; probably an ill-formed body; ignore the rest
    8844              :                         break;
    8845              :                     }
    8846              : 
    8847              :                     const std::string_view section = body.substr(0, found);
    8848              : 
    8849              :                     // +2 is the CRLF.
    8850              :                     // We don't check it and delete it so that the same delimiter can be used for The last delimiter (--delimiter--CRLF).
    8851              :                     body = body.substr(found + delimiter.length() + 2);
    8852              :                     if (!section.empty())
    8853              :                     {
    8854              :                         part_view parsed_section = parse_section(section);
    8855              :                         part_map.emplace(
    8856              :                           (get_header_object(parsed_section.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
    8857              :                           parsed_section);
    8858              :                         parts.push_back(std::move(parsed_section));
    8859              :                     }
    8860              :                 }
    8861              :             }
    8862              : 
    8863              :             part_view parse_section(std::string_view section)
    8864              :             {
    8865              :                 constexpr static std::string_view crlf2 = "\r\n\r\n";
    8866              : 
    8867              :                 const size_t found = section.find(crlf2);
    8868              :                 const std::string_view head_line = section.substr(0, found + 2);
    8869              :                 section = section.substr(found + 4);
    8870              : 
    8871              :                 return part_view{
    8872              :                   parse_section_head(head_line),
    8873              :                   section.substr(0, section.length() - 2),
    8874              :                 };
    8875              :             }
    8876              : 
    8877              :             mph_view_map parse_section_head(std::string_view lines)
    8878              :             {
    8879              :                 mph_view_map result;
    8880              : 
    8881              :                 while (!lines.empty())
    8882              :                 {
    8883              :                     header_view to_add;
    8884              : 
    8885              :                     const size_t found_crlf = lines.find(crlf);
    8886              :                     std::string_view line = lines.substr(0, found_crlf);
    8887              :                     std::string_view key;
    8888              :                     lines = lines.substr(found_crlf + 2);
    8889              :                     // Add the header if available
    8890              :                     if (!line.empty())
    8891              :                     {
    8892              :                         const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
    8893              :                         std::string_view header = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
    8894              :                         if (found_semicolon != std::string_view::npos)
    8895              :                             line = line.substr(found_semicolon + 2);
    8896              :                         else
    8897              :                             line = std::string_view();
    8898              : 
    8899              :                         const size_t header_split = header.find(": ");
    8900              :                         key = header.substr(0, header_split);
    8901              : 
    8902              :                         to_add.value = header.substr(header_split + 2);
    8903              :                     }
    8904              : 
    8905              :                     // Add the parameters
    8906              :                     while (!line.empty())
    8907              :                     {
    8908              :                         const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
    8909              :                         std::string_view param = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
    8910              :                         if (found_semicolon != std::string_view::npos)
    8911              :                             line = line.substr(found_semicolon + 2);
    8912              :                         else
    8913              :                             line = std::string_view();
    8914              : 
    8915              :                         const size_t param_split = param.find('=');
    8916              : 
    8917              :                         const std::string_view value = param.substr(param_split + 1);
    8918              : 
    8919              :                         to_add.params.emplace(param.substr(0, param_split), trim(value));
    8920              :                     }
    8921              :                     result.emplace(key, to_add);
    8922              :                 }
    8923              : 
    8924              :                 return result;
    8925              :             }
    8926              : 
    8927              :             inline std::string_view trim(const std::string_view string, const char excess = '"') const
    8928              :             {
    8929              :                 if (string.length() > 1 && string[0] == excess && string[string.length() - 1] == excess)
    8930              :                     return string.substr(1, string.length() - 2);
    8931              :                 return string;
    8932              :             }
    8933              :         };
    8934              :     } // namespace multipart
    8935              : } // namespace crow
    8936              : 
    8937              : #include <string>
    8938              : #include <unordered_map>
    8939              : #include <ios>
    8940              : #include <fstream>
    8941              : #include <sstream>
    8942              : // S_ISREG is not defined for windows
    8943              : // This defines it like suggested in https://stackoverflow.com/a/62371749
    8944              : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
    8945              : #define _CRT_INTERNAL_NONSTDC_NAMES 1
    8946              : #endif
    8947              : #include <sys/stat.h>
    8948              : #if !defined(S_ISREG) && defined(S_IFMT) && defined(S_IFREG)
    8949              : #define S_ISREG(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
    8950              : #endif
    8951              : 
    8952              : 
    8953              : 
    8954              : namespace crow
    8955              : {
    8956              :     template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler, typename... Middlewares>
    8957              :     class Connection;
    8958              : 
    8959              :     namespace websocket
    8960              :     {
    8961              :         template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler>
    8962              :         class Connection;
    8963              :     }
    8964              : 
    8965              :     class Router;
    8966              : 
    8967              :     /// HTTP response
    8968              :     struct response
    8969              :     {
    8970              :         template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler, typename... Middlewares>
    8971              :         friend class crow::Connection;
    8972              : 
    8973              :         template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler>
    8974              :         friend class websocket::Connection;
    8975              : 
    8976              :         friend class Router;
    8977              : 
    8978              :         int code{200};    ///< The Status code for the response.
    8979              :         std::string body; ///< The actual payload containing the response data.
    8980              :         ci_map headers;   ///< HTTP headers.
    8981              : 
    8982              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
    8983              :         bool compressed = true; ///< If compression is enabled and this is false, the individual response will not be compressed.
    8984              : #endif
    8985              :         bool skip_body = false;            ///< Whether this is a response to a HEAD request.
    8986              :         bool manual_length_header = false; ///< Whether Crow should automatically add a "Content-Length" header.
    8987              : 
    8988              :         /// Set the value of an existing header in the response.
    8989              :         void set_header(std::string key, std::string value)
    8990              :         {
    8991              :             headers.erase(key);
    8992              :             headers.emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
    8993              :         }
    8994              : 
    8995              :         /// Add a new header to the response.
    8996              :         void add_header(std::string key, std::string value)
    8997              :         {
    8998              :             headers.emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
    8999              :         }
    9000              : 
    9001              :         const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key)
    9002              :         {
    9003              :             return crow::get_header_value(headers, key);
    9004              :         }
    9005              : 
    9006              :         // naive validation of a mime-type string
    9007              :         static bool validate_mime_type(const std::string& candidate) noexcept
    9008              :         {
    9009              :             // Here we simply check that the candidate type starts with
    9010              :             // a valid parent type, and has at least one character afterwards.
    9011              :             std::array<std::string, 10> valid_parent_types = {
    9012              :               "application/", "audio/", "font/", "example/",
    9013              :               "image/", "message/", "model/", "multipart/",
    9014              :               "text/", "video/"};
    9015              :             for (const std::string& parent : valid_parent_types)
    9016              :             {
    9017              :                 // ensure the candidate is *longer* than the parent,
    9018              :                 // to avoid unnecessary string comparison and to
    9019              :                 // reject zero-length subtypes.
    9020              :                 if (candidate.size() <= parent.size())
    9021              :                 {
    9022              :                     continue;
    9023              :                 }
    9024              :                 // strncmp is used rather than substr to avoid allocation,
    9025              :                 // but a string_view approach would be better if Crow
    9026              :                 // migrates to C++17.
    9027              :                 if (strncmp(parent.c_str(), candidate.c_str(), parent.size()) == 0)
    9028              :                 {
    9029              :                     return true;
    9030              :                 }
    9031              :             }
    9032              :             return false;
    9033              :         }
    9034              : 
    9035              :         // Find the mime type from the content type either by lookup,
    9036              :         // or by the content type itself, if it is a valid a mime type.
    9037              :         // Defaults to text/plain.
    9038              :         static std::string get_mime_type(const std::string& contentType)
    9039              :         {
    9040              :             const auto mimeTypeIterator = mime_types.find(contentType);
    9041              :             if (mimeTypeIterator != mime_types.end())
    9042              :             {
    9043              :                 return mimeTypeIterator->second;
    9044              :             }
    9045              :             else if (validate_mime_type(contentType))
    9046              :             {
    9047              :                 return contentType;
    9048              :             }
    9049              :             else
    9050              :             {
    9051              :                 CROW_LOG_WARNING << "Unable to interpret mime type for content type '" << contentType << "'. Defaulting to text/plain.";
    9052              :                 return "text/plain";
    9053              :             }
    9054              :         }
    9055              : 
    9056              : 
    9057              :         // clang-format off
    9058              :         response() {}
    9059              :         explicit response(int code_) : code(code_) {}
    9060              :         response(std::string body_) : body(std::move(body_)) {}
    9061              :         response(int code_, std::string body_) : code(code_), body(std::move(body_)) {}
    9062              :         // clang-format on
    9063              :         response(returnable&& value)
    9064              :         {
    9065              :             body = value.dump();
    9066              :             set_header("Content-Type", value.content_type);
    9067              :         }
    9068              :         response(returnable& value)
    9069              :         {
    9070              :             body = value.dump();
    9071              :             set_header("Content-Type", value.content_type);
    9072              :         }
    9073              :         response(int code_, returnable& value):
    9074              :           code(code_)
    9075              :         {
    9076              :             body = value.dump();
    9077              :             set_header("Content-Type", value.content_type);
    9078              :         }
    9079              :         response(int code_, returnable&& value):
    9080              :           code(code_), body(value.dump())
    9081              :         {
    9082              :             set_header("Content-Type", std::move(value.content_type));
    9083              :         }
    9084              : 
    9085              :         response(response&& r)
    9086              :         {
    9087              :             *this = std::move(r);
    9088              :         }
    9089              : 
    9090              :         response(std::string contentType, std::string body_):
    9091              :           body(std::move(body_))
    9092              :         {
    9093              :             set_header("Content-Type", get_mime_type(contentType));
    9094              :         }
    9095              : 
    9096              :         response(int code_, std::string contentType, std::string body_):
    9097              :           code(code_), body(std::move(body_))
    9098              :         {
    9099              :             set_header("Content-Type", get_mime_type(contentType));
    9100              :         }
    9101              : 
    9102              :         response& operator=(const response& r) = delete;
    9103              : 
    9104              :         response& operator=(response&& r) noexcept
    9105              :         {
    9106              :             body = std::move(r.body);
    9107              :             code = r.code;
    9108              :             headers = std::move(r.headers);
    9109              :             completed_ = r.completed_;
    9110              :             file_info = std::move(r.file_info);
    9111              :             return *this;
    9112              :         }
    9113              : 
    9114              :         /// Check if the response has completed (whether response.end() has been called)
    9115              :         bool is_completed() const noexcept
    9116              :         {
    9117              :             return completed_;
    9118              :         }
    9119              : 
    9120              :         void clear()
    9121              :         {
    9122              :             body.clear();
    9123              :             code = 200;
    9124              :             headers.clear();
    9125              :             completed_ = false;
    9126              :             file_info = static_file_info{};
    9127              :         }
    9128              : 
    9129              :         /// Return a "Temporary Redirect" response.
    9130              : 
    9131              :         ///
    9132              :         /// Location can either be a route or a full URL.
    9133              :         void redirect(const std::string& location)
    9134              :         {
    9135              :             code = 307;
    9136              :             set_header("Location", location);
    9137              :         }
    9138              : 
    9139              :         /// Return a "Permanent Redirect" response.
    9140              : 
    9141              :         ///
    9142              :         /// Location can either be a route or a full URL.
    9143              :         void redirect_perm(const std::string& location)
    9144              :         {
    9145              :             code = 308;
    9146              :             set_header("Location", location);
    9147              :         }
    9148              : 
    9149              :         /// Return a "Found (Moved Temporarily)" response.
    9150              : 
    9151              :         ///
    9152              :         /// Location can either be a route or a full URL.
    9153              :         void moved(const std::string& location)
    9154              :         {
    9155              :             code = 302;
    9156              :             set_header("Location", location);
    9157              :         }
    9158              : 
    9159              :         /// Return a "Moved Permanently" response.
    9160              : 
    9161              :         ///
    9162              :         /// Location can either be a route or a full URL.
    9163              :         void moved_perm(const std::string& location)
    9164              :         {
    9165              :             code = 301;
    9166              :             set_header("Location", location);
    9167              :         }
    9168              : 
    9169              :         void write(const std::string& body_part)
    9170              :         {
    9171              :             body += body_part;
    9172              :         }
    9173              : 
    9174              :         /// Set the response completion flag and call the handler (to send the response).
    9175              :         void end()
    9176              :         {
    9177              :             if (!completed_)
    9178              :             {
    9179              :                 completed_ = true;
    9180              :                 if (skip_body)
    9181              :                 {
    9182              :                     set_header("Content-Length", std::to_string(body.size()));
    9183              :                     body = "";
    9184              :                     manual_length_header = true;
    9185              :                 }
    9186              :                 if (complete_request_handler_)
    9187              :                 {
    9188              :                     complete_request_handler_();
    9189              :                     manual_length_header = false;
    9190              :                     skip_body = false;
    9191              :                 }
    9192              :             }
    9193              :         }
    9194              : 
    9195              :         /// Same as end() except it adds a body part right before ending.
    9196              :         void end(const std::string& body_part)
    9197              :         {
    9198              :             body += body_part;
    9199              :             end();
    9200              :         }
    9201              : 
    9202              :         /// Check if the connection is still alive (usually by checking the socket status).
    9203              :         bool is_alive()
    9204              :         {
    9205              :             return is_alive_helper_ && is_alive_helper_();
    9206              :         }
    9207              : 
    9208              :         /// Check whether the response has a static file defined.
    9209              :         bool is_static_type()
    9210              :         {
    9211              :             return file_info.path.size();
    9212              :         }
    9213              : 
    9214              :         /// This constains metadata (coming from the `stat` command) related to any static files associated with this response.
    9215              : 
    9216              :         ///
    9217              :         /// Either a static file or a string body can be returned as 1 response.
    9218              :         struct static_file_info
    9219              :         {
    9220              :             std::string path = "";
    9221              :             struct stat statbuf;
    9222              :             int statResult;
    9223              :         };
    9224              : 
    9225              :         /// Return a static file as the response body, the content_type may be specified explicitly.
    9226              :         void set_static_file_info(std::string path, std::string content_type = "")
    9227              :         {
    9228              :             utility::sanitize_filename(path);
    9229              :             set_static_file_info_unsafe(path, content_type);
    9230              :         }
    9231              : 
    9232              :         /// Return a static file as the response body without sanitizing the path (use set_static_file_info instead),
    9233              :         /// the content_type may be specified explicitly.
    9234              :         void set_static_file_info_unsafe(std::string path, std::string content_type = "")
    9235              :         {
    9236              :             file_info.path = path;
    9237              :             file_info.statResult = stat(file_info.path.c_str(), &file_info.statbuf);
    9238              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
    9239              :             compressed = false;
    9240              : #endif
    9241              :             if (file_info.statResult == 0 && S_ISREG(file_info.statbuf.st_mode))
    9242              :             {
    9243              :                 code = 200;
    9244              :                 this->add_header("Content-Length", std::to_string(file_info.statbuf.st_size));
    9245              : 
    9246              :                 if (content_type.empty())
    9247              :                 {
    9248              :                     std::size_t last_dot = path.find_last_of('.');
    9249              :                     std::string extension = path.substr(last_dot + 1);
    9250              : 
    9251              :                     if (!extension.empty())
    9252              :                     {
    9253              :                         this->add_header("Content-Type", get_mime_type(extension));
    9254              :                     }
    9255              :                 }
    9256              :                 else
    9257              :                 {
    9258              :                     this->add_header("Content-Type", content_type);
    9259              :                 }
    9260              :             }
    9261              :             else
    9262              :             {
    9263              :                 code = 404;
    9264              :                 file_info.path.clear();
    9265              :             }
    9266              :         }
    9267              : 
    9268              :     private:
    9269              :         void write_header_into_buffer(std::vector<asio::const_buffer>& buffers, std::string& content_length_buffer, bool add_keep_alive, const std::string& server_name)
    9270              :         {
    9271              :             // TODO(EDev): HTTP version in status codes should be dynamic
    9272              :             // Keep in sync with common.h/status
    9273              :             static std::unordered_map<int, std::string> statusCodes = {
    9274              :               {status::CONTINUE, "HTTP/1.1 100 Continue\r\n"},
    9275              :               {status::SWITCHING_PROTOCOLS, "HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols\r\n"},
    9276              : 
    9277              :               {status::OK, "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n"},
    9278              :               {status::CREATED, "HTTP/1.1 201 Created\r\n"},
    9279              :               {status::ACCEPTED, "HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted\r\n"},
    9280              :               {status::NON_AUTHORITATIVE_INFORMATION, "HTTP/1.1 203 Non-Authoritative Information\r\n"},
    9281              :               {status::NO_CONTENT, "HTTP/1.1 204 No Content\r\n"},
    9282              :               {status::RESET_CONTENT, "HTTP/1.1 205 Reset Content\r\n"},
    9283              :               {status::PARTIAL_CONTENT, "HTTP/1.1 206 Partial Content\r\n"},
    9284              : 
    9285              :               {status::MULTIPLE_CHOICES, "HTTP/1.1 300 Multiple Choices\r\n"},
    9286              :               {status::MOVED_PERMANENTLY, "HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently\r\n"},
    9287              :               {status::FOUND, "HTTP/1.1 302 Found\r\n"},
    9288              :               {status::SEE_OTHER, "HTTP/1.1 303 See Other\r\n"},
    9289              :               {status::NOT_MODIFIED, "HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified\r\n"},
    9290              :               {status::TEMPORARY_REDIRECT, "HTTP/1.1 307 Temporary Redirect\r\n"},
    9291              :               {status::PERMANENT_REDIRECT, "HTTP/1.1 308 Permanent Redirect\r\n"},
    9292              : 
    9293              :               {status::BAD_REQUEST, "HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request\r\n"},
    9294              :               {status::UNAUTHORIZED, "HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized\r\n"},
    9295              :               {status::FORBIDDEN, "HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden\r\n"},
    9296              :               {status::NOT_FOUND, "HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found\r\n"},
    9297              :               {status::METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED, "HTTP/1.1 405 Method Not Allowed\r\n"},
    9298              :               {status::NOT_ACCEPTABLE, "HTTP/1.1 406 Not Acceptable\r\n"},
    9299              :               {status::PROXY_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED, "HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required\r\n"},
    9300              :               {status::CONFLICT, "HTTP/1.1 409 Conflict\r\n"},
    9301              :               {status::GONE, "HTTP/1.1 410 Gone\r\n"},
    9302              :               {status::PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE, "HTTP/1.1 413 Payload Too Large\r\n"},
    9303              :               {status::UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE, "HTTP/1.1 415 Unsupported Media Type\r\n"},
    9304              :               {status::RANGE_NOT_SATISFIABLE, "HTTP/1.1 416 Range Not Satisfiable\r\n"},
    9305              :               {status::EXPECTATION_FAILED, "HTTP/1.1 417 Expectation Failed\r\n"},
    9306              :               {status::PRECONDITION_REQUIRED, "HTTP/1.1 428 Precondition Required\r\n"},
    9307              :               {status::TOO_MANY_REQUESTS, "HTTP/1.1 429 Too Many Requests\r\n"},
    9308              :               {status::UNAVAILABLE_FOR_LEGAL_REASONS, "HTTP/1.1 451 Unavailable For Legal Reasons\r\n"},
    9309              : 
    9310              :               {status::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, "HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error\r\n"},
    9311              :               {status::NOT_IMPLEMENTED, "HTTP/1.1 501 Not Implemented\r\n"},
    9312              :               {status::BAD_GATEWAY, "HTTP/1.1 502 Bad Gateway\r\n"},
    9313              :               {status::SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE, "HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable\r\n"},
    9314              :               {status::GATEWAY_TIMEOUT, "HTTP/1.1 504 Gateway Timeout\r\n"},
    9315              :               {status::VARIANT_ALSO_NEGOTIATES, "HTTP/1.1 506 Variant Also Negotiates\r\n"},
    9316              :             };
    9317              : 
    9318              :             static const std::string seperator = ": ";
    9319              : 
    9320              :             buffers.clear();
    9321              :             buffers.reserve(4 * (headers.size() + 5) + 3);
    9322              : 
    9323              :             if (!statusCodes.count(code))
    9324              :             {
    9325              :                 CROW_LOG_WARNING << this << " status code "
    9326              :                                  << "(" << code << ")"
    9327              :                                  << " not defined, returning 500 instead";
    9328              :                 code = 500;
    9329              :             }
    9330              : 
    9331              :             auto& status = statusCodes.find(code)->second;
    9332              :             buffers.emplace_back(status.data(), status.size());
    9333              : 
    9334              :             if (code >= 400 && body.empty())
    9335              :                 body = statusCodes[code].substr(9);
    9336              : 
    9337              :             for (auto& kv : headers)
    9338              :             {
    9339              :                 buffers.emplace_back(kv.first.data(), kv.first.size());
    9340              :                 buffers.emplace_back(seperator.data(), seperator.size());
    9341              :                 buffers.emplace_back(kv.second.data(), kv.second.size());
    9342              :                 buffers.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
    9343              :             }
    9344              : 
    9345              :             if (!manual_length_header && !headers.count("content-length"))
    9346              :             {
    9347              :                 content_length_buffer = std::to_string(body.size());
    9348              :                 static std::string content_length_tag = "Content-Length: ";
    9349              :                 buffers.emplace_back(content_length_tag.data(), content_length_tag.size());
    9350              :                 buffers.emplace_back(content_length_buffer.data(), content_length_buffer.size());
    9351              :                 buffers.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
    9352              :             }
    9353              :             if (!headers.count("server") && !server_name.empty())
    9354              :             {
    9355              :                 static std::string server_tag = "Server: ";
    9356              :                 buffers.emplace_back(server_tag.data(), server_tag.size());
    9357              :                 buffers.emplace_back(server_name.data(), server_name.size());
    9358              :                 buffers.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
    9359              :             }
    9360              :             /*if (!headers.count("date"))
    9361              :             {
    9362              :                 static std::string date_tag = "Date: ";
    9363              :                 date_str_ = get_cached_date_str();
    9364              :                 buffers.emplace_back(date_tag.data(), date_tag.size());
    9365              :                 buffers.emplace_back(date_str_.data(), date_str_.size());
    9366              :                 buffers.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
    9367              :             }*/
    9368              :             if (add_keep_alive)
    9369              :             {
    9370              :                 static std::string keep_alive_tag = "Connection: Keep-Alive";
    9371              :                 buffers.emplace_back(keep_alive_tag.data(), keep_alive_tag.size());
    9372              :                 buffers.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
    9373              :             }
    9374              : 
    9375              :             buffers.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
    9376              :         }
    9377              : 
    9378              :         bool completed_{};
    9379              :         std::function<void()> complete_request_handler_;
    9380              :         std::function<bool()> is_alive_helper_;
    9381              :         static_file_info file_info;
    9382              :     };
    9383              : } // namespace crow
    9384              : 
    9385              : #include <iomanip>
    9386              : #include <memory>
    9387              : 
    9388              : namespace crow
    9389              : {
    9390              :     // Any middleware requires following 3 members:
    9391              : 
    9392              :     // struct context;
    9393              :     //      storing data for the middleware; can be read from another middleware or handlers
    9394              : 
    9395              :     // before_handle
    9396              :     //      called before handling the request.
    9397              :     //      if res.end() is called, the operation is halted.
    9398              :     //      (still call after_handle of this middleware)
    9399              :     //      2 signatures:
    9400              :     //      void before_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx)
    9401              :     //          if you only need to access this middlewares context.
    9402              :     //      template <typename AllContext>
    9403              :     //      void before_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
    9404              :     //          you can access another middlewares' context by calling `all_ctx.template get<MW>()'
    9405              :     //          ctx == all_ctx.template get<CurrentMiddleware>()
    9406              : 
    9407              :     // after_handle
    9408              :     //      called after handling the request.
    9409              :     //      void after_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx)
    9410              :     //      template <typename AllContext>
    9411              :     //      void after_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
    9412              : 
    9413              :     struct CookieParser
    9414              :     {
    9415              :         // Cookie stores key, value and attributes
    9416              :         struct Cookie
    9417              :         {
    9418              :             enum class SameSitePolicy
    9419              :             {
    9420              :                 Strict,
    9421              :                 Lax,
    9422              :                 None
    9423              :             };
    9424              : 
    9425              :             template<typename U>
    9426              :             Cookie(const std::string& key, U&& value):
    9427              :               Cookie()
    9428              :             {
    9429              :                 key_ = key;
    9430              :                 value_ = std::forward<U>(value);
    9431              :             }
    9432              : 
    9433              :             Cookie(const std::string& key):
    9434              :               Cookie(key, "") {}
    9435              : 
    9436              :             // format cookie to HTTP header format
    9437              :             std::string dump() const
    9438              :             {
    9439              :                 const static char* HTTP_DATE_FORMAT = "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT";
    9440              : 
    9441              :                 std::stringstream ss;
    9442              :                 ss << key_ << '=';
    9443              :                 ss << (value_.empty() ? "\"\"" : value_);
    9444              :                 dumpString(ss, !domain_.empty(), "Domain=", domain_);
    9445              :                 dumpString(ss, !path_.empty(), "Path=", path_);
    9446              :                 dumpString(ss, secure_, "Secure");
    9447              :                 dumpString(ss, httponly_, "HttpOnly");
    9448              :                 if (expires_at_)
    9449              :                 {
    9450              :                     ss << DIVIDER << "Expires="
    9451              :                        << std::put_time(expires_at_.get(), HTTP_DATE_FORMAT);
    9452              :                 }
    9453              :                 if (max_age_)
    9454              :                 {
    9455              :                     ss << DIVIDER << "Max-Age=" << *max_age_;
    9456              :                 }
    9457              :                 if (same_site_)
    9458              :                 {
    9459              :                     ss << DIVIDER << "SameSite=";
    9460              :                     switch (*same_site_)
    9461              :                     {
    9462              :                         case SameSitePolicy::Strict:
    9463              :                             ss << "Strict";
    9464              :                             break;
    9465              :                         case SameSitePolicy::Lax:
    9466              :                             ss << "Lax";
    9467              :                             break;
    9468              :                         case SameSitePolicy::None:
    9469              :                             ss << "None";
    9470              :                             break;
    9471              :                     }
    9472              :                 }
    9473              :                 return ss.str();
    9474              :             }
    9475              : 
    9476              :             const std::string& name()
    9477              :             {
    9478              :                 return key_;
    9479              :             }
    9480              : 
    9481              :             template<typename U>
    9482              :             Cookie& value(U&& value)
    9483              :             {
    9484              :                 value_ = std::forward<U>(value);
    9485              :                 return *this;
    9486              :             }
    9487              : 
    9488              :             // Expires attribute
    9489              :             Cookie& expires(const std::tm& time)
    9490              :             {
    9491              :                 expires_at_ = std::unique_ptr<std::tm>(new std::tm(time));
    9492              :                 return *this;
    9493              :             }
    9494              : 
    9495              :             // Max-Age attribute
    9496              :             Cookie& max_age(long long seconds)
    9497              :             {
    9498              :                 max_age_ = std::unique_ptr<long long>(new long long(seconds));
    9499              :                 return *this;
    9500              :             }
    9501              : 
    9502              :             // Domain attribute
    9503              :             Cookie& domain(const std::string& name)
    9504              :             {
    9505              :                 domain_ = name;
    9506              :                 return *this;
    9507              :             }
    9508              : 
    9509              :             // Path attribute
    9510              :             Cookie& path(const std::string& path)
    9511              :             {
    9512              :                 path_ = path;
    9513              :                 return *this;
    9514              :             }
    9515              : 
    9516              :             // Secured attribute
    9517              :             Cookie& secure()
    9518              :             {
    9519              :                 secure_ = true;
    9520              :                 return *this;
    9521              :             }
    9522              : 
    9523              :             // HttpOnly attribute
    9524              :             Cookie& httponly()
    9525              :             {
    9526              :                 httponly_ = true;
    9527              :                 return *this;
    9528              :             }
    9529              : 
    9530              :             // SameSite attribute
    9531              :             Cookie& same_site(SameSitePolicy ssp)
    9532              :             {
    9533              :                 same_site_ = std::unique_ptr<SameSitePolicy>(new SameSitePolicy(ssp));
    9534              :                 return *this;
    9535              :             }
    9536              : 
    9537              :             Cookie(const Cookie& c):
    9538              :               key_(c.key_),
    9539              :               value_(c.value_),
    9540              :               domain_(c.domain_),
    9541              :               path_(c.path_),
    9542              :               secure_(c.secure_),
    9543              :               httponly_(c.httponly_)
    9544              :             {
    9545              :                 if (c.max_age_)
    9546              :                     max_age_ = std::unique_ptr<long long>(new long long(*c.max_age_));
    9547              : 
    9548              :                 if (c.expires_at_)
    9549              :                     expires_at_ = std::unique_ptr<std::tm>(new std::tm(*c.expires_at_));
    9550              : 
    9551              :                 if (c.same_site_)
    9552              :                     same_site_ = std::unique_ptr<SameSitePolicy>(new SameSitePolicy(*c.same_site_));
    9553              :             }
    9554              : 
    9555              :         private:
    9556              :             Cookie() = default;
    9557              : 
    9558              :             static void dumpString(std::stringstream& ss, bool cond, const char* prefix,
    9559              :                                    const std::string& value = "")
    9560              :             {
    9561              :                 if (cond)
    9562              :                 {
    9563              :                     ss << DIVIDER << prefix << value;
    9564              :                 }
    9565              :             }
    9566              : 
    9567              :         private:
    9568              :             std::string key_;
    9569              :             std::string value_;
    9570              :             std::unique_ptr<long long> max_age_{};
    9571              :             std::string domain_ = "";
    9572              :             std::string path_ = "";
    9573              :             bool secure_ = false;
    9574              :             bool httponly_ = false;
    9575              :             std::unique_ptr<std::tm> expires_at_{};
    9576              :             std::unique_ptr<SameSitePolicy> same_site_{};
    9577              : 
    9578              :             static constexpr const char* DIVIDER = "; ";
    9579              :         };
    9580              : 
    9581              : 
    9582              :         struct context
    9583              :         {
    9584              :             std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> jar;
    9585              : 
    9586              :             std::string get_cookie(const std::string& key) const
    9587              :             {
    9588              :                 auto cookie = jar.find(key);
    9589              :                 if (cookie != jar.end())
    9590              :                     return cookie->second;
    9591              :                 return {};
    9592              :             }
    9593              : 
    9594              :             template<typename U>
    9595              :             Cookie& set_cookie(const std::string& key, U&& value)
    9596              :             {
    9597              :                 cookies_to_add.emplace_back(key, std::forward<U>(value));
    9598              :                 return cookies_to_add.back();
    9599              :             }
    9600              : 
    9601              :             Cookie& set_cookie(Cookie cookie)
    9602              :             {
    9603              :                 cookies_to_add.push_back(std::move(cookie));
    9604              :                 return cookies_to_add.back();
    9605              :             }
    9606              : 
    9607              :         private:
    9608              :             friend struct CookieParser;
    9609              :             std::vector<Cookie> cookies_to_add;
    9610              :         };
    9611              : 
    9612              :         void before_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx)
    9613              :         {
    9614              :             // TODO(dranikpg): remove copies, use string_view with c++17
    9615              :             int count = req.headers.count("Cookie");
    9616              :             if (!count)
    9617              :                 return;
    9618              :             if (count > 1)
    9619              :             {
    9620              :                 res.code = 400;
    9621              :                 res.end();
    9622              :                 return;
    9623              :             }
    9624              :             std::string cookies = req.get_header_value("Cookie");
    9625              :             size_t pos = 0;
    9626              :             while (pos < cookies.size())
    9627              :             {
    9628              :                 size_t pos_equal = cookies.find('=', pos);
    9629              :                 if (pos_equal == cookies.npos)
    9630              :                     break;
    9631              :                 std::string name = cookies.substr(pos, pos_equal - pos);
    9632              :                 name = utility::trim(name);
    9633              :                 pos = pos_equal + 1;
    9634              :                 if (pos == cookies.size())
    9635              :                     break;
    9636              : 
    9637              :                 size_t pos_semicolon = cookies.find(';', pos);
    9638              :                 std::string value = cookies.substr(pos, pos_semicolon - pos);
    9639              : 
    9640              :                 value = utility::trim(value);
    9641              :                 if (value[0] == '"' && value[value.size() - 1] == '"')
    9642              :                 {
    9643              :                     value = value.substr(1, value.size() - 2);
    9644              :                 }
    9645              : 
    9646              :                 ctx.jar.emplace(std::move(name), std::move(value));
    9647              : 
    9648              :                 pos = pos_semicolon;
    9649              :                 if (pos == cookies.npos)
    9650              :                     break;
    9651              :                 pos++;
    9652              :             }
    9653              :         }
    9654              : 
    9655              :         void after_handle(request& /*req*/, response& res, context& ctx)
    9656              :         {
    9657              :             for (const auto& cookie : ctx.cookies_to_add)
    9658              :             {
    9659              :                 res.add_header("Set-Cookie", cookie.dump());
    9660              :             }
    9661              :         }
    9662              :     };
    9663              : 
    9664              :     /*
    9665              :     App<CookieParser, AnotherJarMW> app;
    9666              :     A B C
    9667              :     A::context
    9668              :         int aa;
    9669              : 
    9670              :     ctx1 : public A::context
    9671              :     ctx2 : public ctx1, public B::context
    9672              :     ctx3 : public ctx2, public C::context
    9673              : 
    9674              :     C depends on A
    9675              : 
    9676              :     C::handle
    9677              :         context.aaa
    9678              : 
    9679              :     App::context : private CookieParser::context, ...
    9680              :     {
    9681              :         jar
    9682              : 
    9683              :     }
    9684              : 
    9685              :     SimpleApp
    9686              :     */
    9687              : } // namespace crow
    9688              : 
    9689              : 
    9690              : namespace crow
    9691              : {
    9692              : 
    9693              :     struct UTF8
    9694              :     {
    9695              :         struct context
    9696              :         {};
    9697              : 
    9698              :         void before_handle(request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, context& /*ctx*/)
    9699              :         {}
    9700              : 
    9701              :         void after_handle(request& /*req*/, response& res, context& /*ctx*/)
    9702              :         {
    9703              :             if (get_header_value(res.headers, "Content-Type").empty())
    9704              :             {
    9705              :                 res.set_header("Content-Type", "text/plain; charset=utf-8");
    9706              :             }
    9707              :         }
    9708              :     };
    9709              : 
    9710              : } // namespace crow
    9711              : 
    9712              : 
    9713              : 
    9714              : #include <unordered_map>
    9715              : #include <unordered_set>
    9716              : #include <set>
    9717              : #include <queue>
    9718              : 
    9719              : #include <memory>
    9720              : #include <string>
    9721              : #include <cstdio>
    9722              : #include <mutex>
    9723              : 
    9724              : #include <fstream>
    9725              : #include <sstream>
    9726              : 
    9727              : #include <type_traits>
    9728              : #include <functional>
    9729              : #include <chrono>
    9730              : 
    9731              : #include <variant>
    9732              : 
    9733              : namespace
    9734              : {
    9735              :     // convert all integer values to int64_t
    9736              :     template<typename T>
    9737              :     using wrap_integral_t = typename std::conditional<
    9738              :       std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_same<bool, T>::value
    9739              :         // except for uint64_t because that could lead to overflow on conversion
    9740              :         && !std::is_same<uint64_t, T>::value,
    9741              :       int64_t, T>::type;
    9742              : 
    9743              :     // convert char[]/char* to std::string
    9744              :     template<typename T>
    9745              :     using wrap_char_t = typename std::conditional<
    9746              :       std::is_same<typename std::decay<T>::type, char*>::value,
    9747              :       std::string, T>::type;
    9748              : 
    9749              :     // Upgrade to correct type for multi_variant use
    9750              :     template<typename T>
    9751              :     using wrap_mv_t = wrap_char_t<wrap_integral_t<T>>;
    9752              : } // namespace
    9753              : 
    9754              : namespace crow
    9755              : {
    9756              :     namespace session
    9757              :     {
    9758              : 
    9759              :         using multi_value_types = black_magic::S<bool, int64_t, double, std::string>;
    9760              : 
    9761              :         /// A multi_value is a safe variant wrapper with json conversion support
    9762              :         struct multi_value
    9763              :         {
    9764              :             json::wvalue json() const
