    9765              :             {
    9766              :                 // clang-format off
    9767              :                 return std::visit([](auto arg) {
    9768              :                     return json::wvalue(arg);
    9769              :                 }, v_);
    9770              :                 // clang-format on
    9771              :             }
    9772              : 
    9773              :             static multi_value from_json(const json::rvalue&);
    9774              : 
    9775              :             std::string string() const
    9776              :             {
    9777              :                 // clang-format off
    9778              :                 return std::visit([](auto arg) {
    9779              :                     if constexpr (std::is_same_v<decltype(arg), std::string>)
    9780              :                         return arg;
    9781              :                     else
    9782              :                         return std::to_string(arg);
    9783              :                 }, v_);
    9784              :                 // clang-format on
    9785              :             }
    9786              : 
    9787              :             template<typename T, typename RT = wrap_mv_t<T>>
    9788              :             RT get(const T& fallback)
    9789              :             {
    9790              :                 if (const RT* val = std::get_if<RT>(&v_)) return *val;
    9791              :                 return fallback;
    9792              :             }
    9793              : 
    9794              :             template<typename T, typename RT = wrap_mv_t<T>>
    9795              :             void set(T val)
    9796              :             {
    9797              :                 v_ = RT(std::move(val));
    9798              :             }
    9799              : 
    9800              :             typename multi_value_types::rebind<std::variant> v_;
    9801              :         };
    9802              : 
    9803              :         inline multi_value multi_value::from_json(const json::rvalue& rv)
    9804              :         {
    9805              :             using namespace json;
    9806              :             switch (rv.t())
    9807              :             {
    9808              :                 case type::Number:
    9809              :                 {
    9810              :                     if (rv.nt() == num_type::Floating_point || rv.nt() == num_type::Double_precision_floating_point)
    9811              :                         return multi_value{rv.d()};
    9812              :                     else if (rv.nt() == num_type::Unsigned_integer)
    9813              :                         return multi_value{int64_t(rv.u())};
    9814              :                     else
    9815              :                         return multi_value{rv.i()};
    9816              :                 }
    9817              :                 case type::False: return multi_value{false};
    9818              :                 case type::True: return multi_value{true};
    9819              :                 case type::String: return multi_value{std::string(rv)};
    9820              :                 default: return multi_value{false};
    9821              :             }
    9822              :         }
    9823              : 
    9824              :         /// Expiration tracker keeps track of soonest-to-expire keys
    9825              :         struct ExpirationTracker
    9826              :         {
    9827              :             using DataPair = std::pair<uint64_t /*time*/, std::string /*key*/>;
    9828              : 
    9829              :             /// Add key with time to tracker.
    9830              :             /// If the key is already present, it will be updated
    9831              :             void add(std::string key, uint64_t time)
    9832              :             {
    9833              :                 auto it = times_.find(key);
    9834              :                 if (it != times_.end()) remove(key);
    9835              :                 times_[key] = time;
    9836              :                 queue_.insert({time, std::move(key)});
    9837              :             }
    9838              : 
    9839              :             void remove(const std::string& key)
    9840              :             {
    9841              :                 auto it = times_.find(key);
    9842              :                 if (it != times_.end())
    9843              :                 {
    9844              :                     queue_.erase({it->second, key});
    9845              :                     times_.erase(it);
    9846              :                 }
    9847              :             }
    9848              : 
    9849              :             /// Get expiration time of soonest-to-expire entry
    9850              :             uint64_t peek_first() const
    9851              :             {
    9852              :                 if (queue_.empty()) return std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max();
    9853              :                 return queue_.begin()->first;
    9854              :             }
    9855              : 
    9856              :             std::string pop_first()
    9857              :             {
    9858              :                 auto it = times_.find(queue_.begin()->second);
    9859              :                 auto key = it->first;
    9860              :                 times_.erase(it);
    9861              :                 queue_.erase(queue_.begin());
    9862              :                 return key;
    9863              :             }
    9864              : 
    9865              :             using iterator = typename std::set<DataPair>::const_iterator;
    9866              : 
    9867              :             iterator begin() const { return queue_.cbegin(); }
    9868              : 
    9869              :             iterator end() const { return queue_.cend(); }
    9870              : 
    9871              :         private:
    9872              :             std::set<DataPair> queue_;
    9873              :             std::unordered_map<std::string, uint64_t> times_;
    9874              :         };
    9875              : 
    9876              :         /// CachedSessions are shared across requests
    9877              :         struct CachedSession
    9878              :         {
    9879              :             std::string session_id;
    9880              :             std::string requested_session_id; // session hasn't been created yet, but a key was requested
    9881              : 
    9882              :             std::unordered_map<std::string, multi_value> entries;
    9883              :             std::unordered_set<std::string> dirty; // values that were changed after last load
    9884              : 
    9885              :             void* store_data;
    9886              :             bool requested_refresh;
    9887              : 
    9888              :             // number of references held - used for correctly destroying the cache.
    9889              :             // No need to be atomic, all SessionMiddleware accesses are synchronized
    9890              :             int referrers;
    9891              :             std::recursive_mutex mutex;
    9892              :         };
    9893              :     } // namespace session
    9894              : 
    9895              :     // SessionMiddleware allows storing securely and easily small snippets of user information
    9896              :     template<typename Store>
    9897              :     struct SessionMiddleware
    9898              :     {
    9899              :         using lock = std::scoped_lock<std::mutex>;
    9900              :         using rc_lock = std::scoped_lock<std::recursive_mutex>;
    9901              : 
    9902              :         struct context
    9903              :         {
    9904              :             // Get a mutex for locking this session
    9905              :             std::recursive_mutex& mutex()
    9906              :             {
    9907              :                 check_node();
    9908              :                 return node->mutex;
    9909              :             }
    9910              : 
    9911              :             // Check whether this session is already present
    9912              :             bool exists() { return bool(node); }
    9913              : 
    9914              :             // Get a value by key or fallback if it doesn't exist or is of another type
    9915              :             template<typename F>
    9916              :             auto get(const std::string& key, const F& fallback = F())
    9917              :               // This trick lets the multi_value deduce the return type from the fallback
    9918              :               // which allows both:
    9919              :               //   context.get<std::string>("key")
    9920              :               //   context.get("key", "") -> char[] is transformed into string by multivalue
    9921              :               // to return a string
    9922              :               -> decltype(std::declval<session::multi_value>().get<F>(std::declval<F>()))
    9923              :             {
    9924              :                 if (!node) return fallback;
    9925              :                 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
    9926              : 
    9927              :                 auto it = node->entries.find(key);
    9928              :                 if (it != node->entries.end()) return it->second.get<F>(fallback);
    9929              :                 return fallback;
    9930              :             }
    9931              : 
    9932              :             // Set a value by key
    9933              :             template<typename T>
    9934              :             void set(const std::string& key, T value)
    9935              :             {
    9936              :                 check_node();
    9937              :                 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
    9938              : 
    9939              :                 node->dirty.insert(key);
    9940              :                 node->entries[key].set(std::move(value));
    9941              :             }
    9942              : 
    9943              :             bool contains(const std::string& key)
    9944              :             {
    9945              :                 if (!node) return false;
    9946              :                 return node->entries.find(key) != node->entries.end();
    9947              :             }
    9948              : 
    9949              :             // Atomically mutate a value with a function
    9950              :             template<typename Func>
    9951              :             void apply(const std::string& key, const Func& f)
    9952              :             {
    9953              :                 using traits = utility::function_traits<Func>;
    9954              :                 using arg = typename std::decay<typename traits::template arg<0>>::type;
    9955              :                 using retv = typename std::decay<typename traits::result_type>::type;
    9956              :                 check_node();
    9957              :                 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
    9958              :                 node->dirty.insert(key);
    9959              :                 node->entries[key].set<retv>(f(node->entries[key].get(arg{})));
    9960              :             }
    9961              : 
    9962              :             // Remove a value from the session
    9963              :             void remove(const std::string& key)
    9964              :             {
    9965              :                 if (!node) return;
    9966              :                 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
    9967              :                 node->dirty.insert(key);
    9968              :                 node->entries.erase(key);
    9969              :             }
    9970              : 
    9971              :             // Format value by key as a string
    9972              :             std::string string(const std::string& key)
    9973              :             {
    9974              :                 if (!node) return "";
    9975              :                 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
    9976              : 
    9977              :                 auto it = node->entries.find(key);
    9978              :                 if (it != node->entries.end()) return it->second.string();
    9979              :                 return "";
    9980              :             }
    9981              : 
    9982              :             // Get a list of keys present in session
    9983              :             std::vector<std::string> keys()
    9984              :             {
    9985              :                 if (!node) return {};
    9986              :                 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
    9987              : 
    9988              :                 std::vector<std::string> out;
    9989              :                 for (const auto& p : node->entries)
    9990              :                     out.push_back(p.first);
    9991              :                 return out;
    9992              :             }
    9993              : 
    9994              :             // Delay expiration by issuing another cookie with an updated expiration time
    9995              :             // and notifying the store
    9996              :             void refresh_expiration()
    9997              :             {
    9998              :                 if (!node) return;
    9999              :                 node->requested_refresh = true;
   10000              :             }
   10001              : 
   10002              :         private:
   10003              :             friend struct SessionMiddleware;
   10004              : 
   10005              :             void check_node()
   10006              :             {
   10007              :                 if (!node) node = std::make_shared<session::CachedSession>();
   10008              :             }
   10009              : 
   10010              :             std::shared_ptr<session::CachedSession> node;
   10011              :         };
   10012              : 
   10013              :         template<typename... Ts>
   10014              :         SessionMiddleware(
   10015              :           CookieParser::Cookie cookie,
   10016              :           int id_length,
   10017              :           Ts... ts):
   10018              :           id_length_(id_length),
   10019              :           cookie_(cookie),
   10020              :           store_(std::forward<Ts>(ts)...), mutex_(new std::mutex{})
   10021              :         {}
   10022              : 
   10023              :         template<typename... Ts>
   10024              :         SessionMiddleware(Ts... ts):
   10025              :           SessionMiddleware(
   10026              :             CookieParser::Cookie("session").path("/").max_age(/*month*/ 30 * 24 * 60 * 60),
   10027              :             /*id_length */ 20, // around 10^34 possible combinations, but small enough to fit into SSO
   10028              :             std::forward<Ts>(ts)...)
   10029              :         {}
   10030              : 
   10031              :         template<typename AllContext>
   10032              :         void before_handle(request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
   10033              :         {
   10034              :             lock l(*mutex_);
   10035              : 
   10036              :             auto& cookies = all_ctx.template get<CookieParser>();
   10037              :             auto session_id = load_id(cookies);
   10038              :             if (session_id == "") return;
   10039              : 
   10040              :             // search entry in cache
   10041              :             auto it = cache_.find(session_id);
   10042              :             if (it != cache_.end())
   10043              :             {
   10044              :                 it->second->referrers++;
   10045              :                 ctx.node = it->second;
   10046              :                 return;
   10047              :             }
   10048              : 
   10049              :             // check this is a valid entry before loading
   10050              :             if (!store_.contains(session_id)) return;
   10051              : 
   10052              :             auto node = std::make_shared<session::CachedSession>();
   10053              :             node->session_id = session_id;
   10054              :             node->referrers = 1;
   10055              : 
   10056              :             try
   10057              :             {
   10058              :                 store_.load(*node);
   10059              :             }
   10060              :             catch (...)
   10061              :             {
   10062              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Exception occurred during session load";
   10063              :                 return;
   10064              :             }
   10065              : 
   10066              :             ctx.node = node;
   10067              :             cache_[session_id] = node;
   10068              :         }
   10069              : 
   10070              :         template<typename AllContext>
   10071              :         void after_handle(request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
   10072              :         {
   10073              :             lock l(*mutex_);
   10074              :             if (!ctx.node || --ctx.node->referrers > 0) return;
   10075              :             ctx.node->requested_refresh |= ctx.node->session_id == "";
   10076              : 
   10077              :             // generate new id
   10078              :             if (ctx.node->session_id == "")
   10079              :             {
   10080              :                 // check for requested id
   10081              :                 ctx.node->session_id = std::move(ctx.node->requested_session_id);
   10082              :                 if (ctx.node->session_id == "")
   10083              :                 {
   10084              :                     ctx.node->session_id = utility::random_alphanum(id_length_);
   10085              :                 }
   10086              :             }
   10087              :             else
   10088              :             {
   10089              :                 cache_.erase(ctx.node->session_id);
   10090              :             }
   10091              : 
   10092              :             if (ctx.node->requested_refresh)
   10093              :             {
   10094              :                 auto& cookies = all_ctx.template get<CookieParser>();
   10095              :                 store_id(cookies, ctx.node->session_id);
   10096              :             }
   10097              : 
   10098              :             try
   10099              :             {
   10100              :                 store_.save(*ctx.node);
   10101              :             }
   10102              :             catch (...)
   10103              :             {
   10104              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Exception occurred during session save";
   10105              :                 return;
   10106              :             }
   10107              :         }
   10108              : 
   10109              :     private:
   10110              :         std::string next_id()
   10111              :         {
   10112              :             std::string id;
   10113              :             do
   10114              :             {
   10115              :                 id = utility::random_alphanum(id_length_);
   10116              :             } while (store_.contains(id));
   10117              :             return id;
   10118              :         }
   10119              : 
   10120              :         std::string load_id(const CookieParser::context& cookies)
   10121              :         {
   10122              :             return cookies.get_cookie(cookie_.name());
   10123              :         }
   10124              : 
   10125              :         void store_id(CookieParser::context& cookies, const std::string& session_id)
   10126              :         {
   10127              :             cookie_.value(session_id);
   10128              :             cookies.set_cookie(cookie_);
   10129              :         }
   10130              : 
   10131              :     private:
   10132              :         int id_length_;
   10133              : 
   10134              :         // prototype for cookie
   10135              :         CookieParser::Cookie cookie_;
   10136              : 
   10137              :         Store store_;
   10138              : 
   10139              :         // mutexes are immovable
   10140              :         std::unique_ptr<std::mutex> mutex_;
   10141              :         std::unordered_map<std::string, std::shared_ptr<session::CachedSession>> cache_;
   10142              :     };
   10143              : 
   10144              :     /// InMemoryStore stores all entries in memory
   10145              :     struct InMemoryStore
   10146              :     {
   10147              :         // Load a value into the session cache.
   10148              :         // A load is always followed by a save, no loads happen consecutively
   10149              :         void load(session::CachedSession& cn)
   10150              :         {
   10151              :             // load & stores happen sequentially, so moving is safe
   10152              :             cn.entries = std::move(entries[cn.session_id]);
   10153              :         }
   10154              : 
   10155              :         // Persist session data
   10156              :         void save(session::CachedSession& cn)
   10157              :         {
   10158              :             entries[cn.session_id] = std::move(cn.entries);
   10159              :             // cn.dirty is a list of changed keys since the last load
   10160              :         }
   10161              : 
   10162              :         bool contains(const std::string& key)
   10163              :         {
   10164              :             return entries.count(key) > 0;
   10165              :         }
   10166              : 
   10167              :         std::unordered_map<std::string, std::unordered_map<std::string, session::multi_value>> entries;
   10168              :     };
   10169              : 
   10170              :     // FileStore stores all data as json files in a folder.
   10171              :     // Files are deleted after expiration. Expiration refreshes are automatically picked up.
   10172              :     struct FileStore
   10173              :     {
   10174              :         FileStore(const std::string& folder, uint64_t expiration_seconds = /*month*/ 30 * 24 * 60 * 60):
   10175              :           path_(folder), expiration_seconds_(expiration_seconds)
   10176              :         {
   10177              :             std::ifstream ifs(get_filename(".expirations", false));
   10178              : 
   10179              :             auto current_ts = chrono_time();
   10180              :             std::string key;
   10181              :             uint64_t time;
   10182              :             while (ifs >> key >> time)
   10183              :             {
   10184              :                 if (current_ts > time)
   10185              :                 {
   10186              :                     evict(key);
   10187              :                 }
   10188              :                 else if (contains(key))
   10189              :                 {
   10190              :                     expirations_.add(key, time);
   10191              :                 }
   10192              :             }
   10193              :         }
   10194              : 
   10195              :         ~FileStore()
   10196              :         {
   10197              :             std::ofstream ofs(get_filename(".expirations", false), std::ios::trunc);
   10198              :             for (const auto& p : expirations_)
   10199              :                 ofs << p.second << " " << p.first << "\n";
   10200              :         }
   10201              : 
   10202              :         // Delete expired entries
   10203              :         // At most 3 to prevent freezes
   10204              :         void handle_expired()
   10205              :         {
   10206              :             int deleted = 0;
   10207              :             auto current_ts = chrono_time();
   10208              :             while (current_ts > expirations_.peek_first() && deleted < 3)
   10209              :             {
   10210              :                 evict(expirations_.pop_first());
   10211              :                 deleted++;
   10212              :             }
   10213              :         }
   10214              : 
   10215              :         void load(session::CachedSession& cn)
   10216              :         {
   10217              :             handle_expired();
   10218              : 
   10219              :             std::ifstream file(get_filename(cn.session_id));
   10220              : 
   10221              :             std::stringstream buffer;
   10222              :             buffer << file.rdbuf() << std::endl;
   10223              : 
   10224              :             for (const auto& p : json::load(buffer.str()))
   10225              :                 cn.entries[p.key()] = session::multi_value::from_json(p);
   10226              :         }
   10227              : 
   10228              :         void save(session::CachedSession& cn)
   10229              :         {
   10230              :             if (cn.requested_refresh)
   10231              :                 expirations_.add(cn.session_id, chrono_time() + expiration_seconds_);
   10232              :             if (cn.dirty.empty()) return;
   10233              : 
   10234              :             std::ofstream file(get_filename(cn.session_id));
   10235              :             json::wvalue jw;
   10236              :             for (const auto& p : cn.entries)
   10237              :                 jw[p.first] = p.second.json();
   10238              :             file << jw.dump() << std::flush;
   10239              :         }
   10240              : 
   10241              :         std::string get_filename(const std::string& key, bool suffix = true)
   10242              :         {
   10243              :             return utility::join_path(path_, key + (suffix ? ".json" : ""));
   10244              :         }
   10245              : 
   10246              :         bool contains(const std::string& key)
   10247              :         {
   10248              :             std::ifstream file(get_filename(key));
   10249              :             return file.good();
   10250              :         }
   10251              : 
   10252              :         void evict(const std::string& key)
   10253              :         {
   10254              :             std::remove(get_filename(key).c_str());
   10255              :         }
   10256              : 
   10257              :         uint64_t chrono_time() const
   10258              :         {
   10259              :             return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::seconds>(
   10260              :                      std::chrono::steady_clock::now().time_since_epoch())
   10261              :               .count();
   10262              :         }
   10263              : 
   10264              :         std::string path_;
   10265              :         uint64_t expiration_seconds_;
   10266              :         session::ExpirationTracker expirations_;
   10267              :     };
   10268              : 
   10269              : } // namespace crow
   10270              : 
   10271              : 
   10272              : 
   10273              : #include <tuple>
   10274              : #include <type_traits>
   10275              : #include <iostream>
   10276              : #include <utility>
   10277              : 
   10278              : namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
   10279              : {
   10280              : 
   10281              :     /// Local middleware should extend ILocalMiddleware
   10282              :     struct ILocalMiddleware
   10283              :     {
   10284              :         using call_global = std::false_type;
   10285              :     };
   10286              : 
   10287              :     namespace detail
   10288              :     {
   10289              :         template<typename MW>
   10290              :         struct check_before_handle_arity_3_const
   10291              :         {
   10292              :             template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) const = &T::before_handle>
   10293              :             struct get
   10294              :             {};
   10295              :         };
   10296              : 
   10297              :         template<typename MW>
   10298              :         struct check_before_handle_arity_3
   10299              :         {
   10300              :             template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) = &T::before_handle>
   10301              :             struct get
   10302              :             {};
   10303              :         };
   10304              : 
   10305              :         template<typename MW>
   10306              :         struct check_after_handle_arity_3_const
   10307              :         {
   10308              :             template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) const = &T::after_handle>
   10309              :             struct get
   10310              :             {};
   10311              :         };
   10312              : 
   10313              :         template<typename MW>
   10314              :         struct check_after_handle_arity_3
   10315              :         {
   10316              :             template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) = &T::after_handle>
   10317              :             struct get
   10318              :             {};
   10319              :         };
   10320              : 
   10321              :         template<typename MW>
   10322              :         struct check_global_call_false
   10323              :         {
   10324              :             template<typename T, typename std::enable_if<T::call_global::value == false, bool>::type = true>
   10325              :             struct get
   10326              :             {};
   10327              :         };
   10328              : 
   10329              :         template<typename T>
   10330              :         struct is_before_handle_arity_3_impl
   10331              :         {
   10332              :             template<typename C>
   10333              :             static std::true_type f(typename check_before_handle_arity_3_const<T>::template get<C>*);
   10334              : 
   10335              :             template<typename C>
   10336              :             static std::true_type f(typename check_before_handle_arity_3<T>::template get<C>*);
   10337              : 
   10338              :             template<typename C>
   10339              :             static std::false_type f(...);
   10340              : 
   10341              :         public:
   10342              :             static const bool value = decltype(f<T>(nullptr))::value;
   10343              :         };
   10344              : 
   10345              :         template<typename T>
   10346              :         struct is_after_handle_arity_3_impl
   10347              :         {
   10348              :             template<typename C>
   10349              :             static std::true_type f(typename check_after_handle_arity_3_const<T>::template get<C>*);
   10350              : 
   10351              :             template<typename C>
   10352              :             static std::true_type f(typename check_after_handle_arity_3<T>::template get<C>*);
   10353              : 
   10354              :             template<typename C>
   10355              :             static std::false_type f(...);
   10356              : 
   10357              :         public:
   10358              :             static constexpr bool value = decltype(f<T>(nullptr))::value;
   10359              :         };
   10360              : 
   10361              :         template<typename MW>
   10362              :         struct is_middleware_global
   10363              :         {
   10364              :             template<typename C>
   10365              :             static std::false_type f(typename check_global_call_false<MW>::template get<C>*);
   10366              : 
   10367              :             template<typename C>
   10368              :             static std::true_type f(...);
   10369              : 
   10370              :             static const bool value = decltype(f<MW>(nullptr))::value;
   10371              :         };
   10372              : 
   10373              :         template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
   10374              :         typename std::enable_if<!is_before_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
   10375              :           before_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
   10376              :         {
   10377              :             mw.before_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>(), ctx);
   10378              :         }
   10379              : 
   10380              :         template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
   10381              :         typename std::enable_if<is_before_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
   10382              :           before_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
   10383              :         {
   10384              :             mw.before_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>());
   10385              :         }
   10386              : 
   10387              :         template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
   10388              :         typename std::enable_if<!is_after_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
   10389              :           after_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
   10390              :         {
   10391              :             mw.after_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>(), ctx);
   10392              :         }
   10393              : 
   10394              :         template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
   10395              :         typename std::enable_if<is_after_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
   10396              :           after_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
   10397              :         {
   10398              :             mw.after_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>());
   10399              :         }
   10400              : 
   10401              : 
   10402              :         template<typename CallCriteria,
   10403              :                  int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10404              :         typename std::enable_if<(N < std::tuple_size<typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::value), bool>::type
   10405              :           middleware_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx)
   10406              :         {
   10407              : 
   10408              :             using CurrentMW = typename std::tuple_element<N, typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::type;
   10409              : 
   10410              :             if (!cc.template enabled<CurrentMW>(N))
   10411              :             {
   10412              :                 return middleware_call_helper<CallCriteria, N + 1, Context, Container>(cc, middlewares, req, res, ctx);
   10413              :             }
   10414              : 
   10415              :             using parent_context_t = typename Context::template partial<N - 1>;
   10416              :             before_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
   10417              :             if (res.is_completed())
   10418              :             {
   10419              :                 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
   10420              :                 return true;
   10421              :             }
   10422              : 
   10423              :             if (middleware_call_helper<CallCriteria, N + 1, Context, Container>(cc, middlewares, req, res, ctx))
   10424              :             {
   10425              :                 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
   10426              :                 return true;
   10427              :             }
   10428              : 
   10429              :             return false;
   10430              :         }
   10431              : 
   10432              :         template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10433              :         typename std::enable_if<(N >= std::tuple_size<typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::value), bool>::type
   10434              :           middleware_call_helper(const CallCriteria& /*cc*/, Container& /*middlewares*/, request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, Context& /*ctx*/)
   10435              :         {
   10436              :             return false;
   10437              :         }
   10438              : 
   10439              :         template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10440              :         typename std::enable_if<(N < 0)>::type
   10441              :           after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& /*cc*/, Container& /*middlewares*/, Context& /*context*/, request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/)
   10442              :         {
   10443              :         }
   10444              : 
   10445              :         template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10446              :         typename std::enable_if<(N == 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res)
   10447              :         {
   10448              :             using parent_context_t = typename Context::template partial<N - 1>;
   10449              :             using CurrentMW = typename std::tuple_element<N, typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::type;
   10450              :             if (cc.template enabled<CurrentMW>(N))
   10451              :             {
   10452              :                 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
   10453              :             }
   10454              :         }
   10455              : 
   10456              :         template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10457              :         typename std::enable_if<(N > 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res)
   10458              :         {
   10459              :             using parent_context_t = typename Context::template partial<N - 1>;
   10460              :             using CurrentMW = typename std::tuple_element<N, typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::type;
   10461              :             if (cc.template enabled<CurrentMW>(N))
   10462              :             {
   10463              :                 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
   10464              :             }
   10465              :             after_handlers_call_helper<CallCriteria, N - 1, Context, Container>(cc, middlewares, ctx, req, res);
   10466              :         }
   10467              : 
   10468              :         // A CallCriteria that accepts only global middleware
   10469              :         struct middleware_call_criteria_only_global
   10470              :         {
   10471              :             template<typename MW>
   10472              :             constexpr bool enabled(int) const
   10473              :             {
   10474              :                 return is_middleware_global<MW>::value;
   10475              :             }
   10476              :         };
   10477              : 
   10478              :         template<typename F, typename... Args>
   10479              :         typename std::enable_if<black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value, void>::type
   10480              :           wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& /*req*/, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
   10481              :         {
   10482              :             static_assert(!std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
   10483              :                           "Handler function cannot have void return type; valid return types: string, int, crow::response, crow::returnable");
   10484              : 
   10485              :             res = crow::response(f(std::forward<Args>(args)...));
   10486              :             res.end();
   10487              :         }
   10488              : 
   10489              :         template<typename F, typename... Args>
   10490              :         typename std::enable_if<
   10491              :           !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
   10492              :             black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value,
   10493              :           void>::type
   10494              :           wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
   10495              :         {
   10496              :             static_assert(!std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
   10497              :                           "Handler function cannot have void return type; valid return types: string, int, crow::response, crow::returnable");
   10498              : 
   10499              :             res = crow::response(f(req, std::forward<Args>(args)...));
   10500              :             res.end();
   10501              :         }
   10502              : 
   10503              :         template<typename F, typename... Args>
   10504              :         typename std::enable_if<
   10505              :           !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
   10506              :             !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value &&
   10507              :             black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::response&, Args...>>::value,
   10508              :           void>::type
   10509              :           wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& /*req*/, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
   10510              :         {
   10511              :             static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::response&>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
   10512              :                           "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
   10513              : 
   10514              :             f(res, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
   10515              :         }
   10516              : 
   10517              :         template<typename F, typename... Args>
   10518              :         typename std::enable_if<
   10519              :           !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
   10520              :             !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value &&
   10521              :             !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::response&, Args...>>::value &&
   10522              :             black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...>>::value,
   10523              :           void>::type
   10524              :           wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
   10525              :         {
   10526              :             static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request&>(), std::declval<crow::response&>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
   10527              :                           "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
   10528              : 
   10529              :             f(req, res, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
   10530              :         }
   10531              : 
   10532              :         // wrapped_handler_call transparently wraps a handler call behind (req, res, args...)
   10533              :         template<typename F, typename... Args>
   10534              :         typename std::enable_if<
   10535              :           !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
   10536              :             !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value &&
   10537              :             !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::response&, Args...>>::value &&
   10538              :             !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...>>::value,
   10539              :           void>::type
   10540              :           wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
   10541              :         {
   10542              :             static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request&>(), std::declval<crow::response&>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
   10543              :                           "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
   10544              : 
   10545              :             f(req, res, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
   10546              :         }
   10547              : 
   10548              :         template<bool Reversed>
   10549              :         struct middleware_call_criteria_dynamic
   10550              :         {};
   10551              : 
   10552              :         template<>
   10553              :         struct middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<false>
   10554              :         {
   10555              :             middleware_call_criteria_dynamic(const std::vector<int>& indices_):
   10556              :               indices(indices_), slider(0) {}
   10557              : 
   10558              :             template<typename>
   10559              :             bool enabled(int mw_index) const
   10560              :             {
   10561              :                 if (slider < int(indices.size()) && indices[slider] == mw_index)
   10562              :                 {
   10563              :                     slider++;
   10564              :                     return true;
   10565              :                 }
   10566              :                 return false;
   10567              :             }
   10568              : 
   10569              :         private:
   10570              :             const std::vector<int>& indices;
   10571              :             mutable int slider;
   10572              :         };
   10573              : 
   10574              :         template<>
   10575              :         struct middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<true>
   10576              :         {
   10577              :             middleware_call_criteria_dynamic(const std::vector<int>& indices_):
   10578              :               indices(indices_), slider(int(indices_.size()) - 1) {}
   10579              : 
   10580              :             template<typename>
   10581              :             bool enabled(int mw_index) const
   10582              :             {
   10583              :                 if (slider >= 0 && indices[slider] == mw_index)
   10584              :                 {
   10585              :                     slider--;
   10586              :                     return true;
   10587              :                 }
   10588              :                 return false;
   10589              :             }
   10590              : 
   10591              :         private:
   10592              :             const std::vector<int>& indices;
   10593              :             mutable int slider;
   10594              :         };
   10595              : 
   10596              :     } // namespace detail
   10597              : } // namespace crow
   10598              : 
   10599              : 
   10600              : 
   10601              : namespace crow
   10602              : {
   10603              :     namespace detail
   10604              :     {
   10605              : 
   10606              : 
   10607              :         template<typename... Middlewares>
   10608              :         struct partial_context : public black_magic::pop_back<Middlewares...>::template rebind<partial_context>, public black_magic::last_element_type<Middlewares...>::type::context
   10609              :         {
   10610              :             using parent_context = typename black_magic::pop_back<Middlewares...>::template rebind<::crow::detail::partial_context>;
   10611              :             template<int N>
   10612              :             using partial = typename std::conditional<N == sizeof...(Middlewares) - 1, partial_context, typename parent_context::template partial<N>>::type;
   10613              : 
   10614              :             template<typename T>
   10615              :             typename T::context& get()
   10616              :             {
   10617              :                 return static_cast<typename T::context&>(*this);
   10618              :             }
   10619              :         };
   10620              : 
   10621              : 
   10622              : 
   10623              :         template<>
   10624              :         struct partial_context<>
   10625              :         {
   10626              :             template<int>
   10627              :             using partial = partial_context;
   10628              :         };
   10629              : 
   10630              : 
   10631              :         template<typename... Middlewares>
   10632              :         struct context : private partial_context<Middlewares...>
   10633              :         //struct context : private Middlewares::context... // simple but less type-safe
   10634              :         {
   10635              :             template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10636              :             friend typename std::enable_if<(N == 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res);
   10637              :             template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10638              :             friend typename std::enable_if<(N > 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res);
   10639              : 
   10640              :             template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
   10641              :             friend typename std::enable_if<(N < std::tuple_size<typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::value), bool>::type
   10642              :               middleware_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx);
   10643              : 
   10644              :             template<typename T>
   10645              :             typename T::context& get()
   10646              :             {
   10647              :                 return static_cast<typename T::context&>(*this);
   10648              :             }
   10649              : 
   10650              :             template<int N>
   10651              :             using partial = typename partial_context<Middlewares...>::template partial<N>;
   10652              :         };
   10653              :     } // namespace detail
   10654              : } // namespace crow
   10655              : 
   10656              : 
   10657              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
   10658              : #include <boost/asio.hpp>
   10659              : #else
   10660              : #ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
   10661              : #define ASIO_STANDALONE
   10662              : #endif
   10663              : #include <asio.hpp>
   10664              : #endif
   10665              : 
   10666              : #include <algorithm>
   10667              : #include <atomic>
   10668              : #include <chrono>
   10669              : #include <memory>
   10670              : #include <vector>
   10671              : 
   10672              : 
   10673              : namespace crow
   10674              : {
   10675              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
   10676              :     namespace asio = boost::asio;
   10677              :     using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
   10678              : #else
   10679              :     using error_code = asio::error_code;
   10680              : #endif
   10681              :     using tcp = asio::ip::tcp;
   10682              : 
   10683              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   10684              :     static std::atomic<int> connectionCount;
   10685              : #endif
   10686              : 
   10687              :     /// An HTTP connection.
   10688              :     template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler, typename... Middlewares>
   10689              :     class Connection : public std::enable_shared_from_this<Connection<Adaptor, Handler, Middlewares...>>
   10690              :     {
   10691              :         friend struct crow::response;
   10692              : 
   10693              :     public:
   10694              :         Connection(
   10695              :           asio::io_context& io_context,
   10696              :           Handler* handler,
   10697              :           const std::string& server_name,
   10698              :           std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares,
   10699              :           std::function<std::string()>& get_cached_date_str_f,
   10700              :           detail::task_timer& task_timer,
   10701              :           typename Adaptor::context* adaptor_ctx_,
   10702              :           std::atomic<unsigned int>& queue_length):
   10703              :           adaptor_(io_context, adaptor_ctx_),
   10704              :           handler_(handler),
   10705              :           parser_(this),
   10706              :           req_(parser_.req),
   10707              :           server_name_(server_name),
   10708              :           middlewares_(middlewares),
   10709              :           get_cached_date_str(get_cached_date_str_f),
   10710              :           task_timer_(task_timer),
   10711              :           res_stream_threshold_(handler->stream_threshold()),
   10712              :           queue_length_(queue_length)
   10713              :         {
   10714              :             queue_length_++;
   10715              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   10716              :             connectionCount++;
   10717              :             CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Connection (" << this << ") allocated, total: " << connectionCount;
   10718              : #endif
   10719              :         }
   10720              : 
   10721              :         ~Connection()
   10722              :         {
   10723              :             queue_length_--;
   10724              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   10725              :             connectionCount--;
   10726              :             CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Connection (" << this << ") freed, total: " << connectionCount;
   10727              : #endif
   10728              :         }
   10729              : 
   10730              :         /// The TCP socket on top of which the connection is established.
   10731              :         decltype(std::declval<Adaptor>().raw_socket())& socket()
   10732              :         {
   10733              :             return adaptor_.raw_socket();
   10734              :         }
   10735              : 
   10736              :         void start()
   10737              :         {
   10738              :             auto self = this->shared_from_this();
   10739              :             adaptor_.start([self](const error_code& ec) {
   10740              :                 if (!ec)
   10741              :                 {
   10742              :                     self->start_deadline();
   10743              :                     self->parser_.clear();
   10744              : 
   10745              :                     self->do_read();
   10746              :                 }
   10747              :                 else
   10748              :                 {
   10749              :                     CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Could not start adaptor: " << ec.message();
   10750              :                 }
   10751              :             });
   10752              :         }
   10753              : 
   10754              :         void handle_url()
   10755              :         {
   10756              :             routing_handle_result_ = handler_->handle_initial(req_, res);
   10757              :             // if no route is found for the request method, return the response without parsing or processing anything further.
   10758              :             if (!routing_handle_result_->rule_index && !routing_handle_result_->catch_all)
   10759              :             {
   10760              :                 parser_.done();
   10761              :                 need_to_call_after_handlers_ = true;
   10762              :                 complete_request();
   10763              :             }
   10764              :         }
   10765              : 
   10766              :         void handle_header()
   10767              :         {
   10768              :             // HTTP 1.1 Expect: 100-continue
   10769              :             if (req_.http_ver_major == 1 && req_.http_ver_minor == 1 && get_header_value(req_.headers, "expect") == "100-continue")
   10770              :             {
   10771              :                 continue_requested = true;
   10772              :                 buffers_.clear();
   10773              :                 static std::string expect_100_continue = "HTTP/1.1 100 Continue\r\n\r\n";
   10774              :                 buffers_.emplace_back(expect_100_continue.data(), expect_100_continue.size());
   10775              :                 do_write_sync(buffers_);
   10776              :             }
   10777              :         }
   10778              : 
   10779              :         void handle()
   10780              :         {
   10781              :             // TODO(EDev): cancel_deadline_timer should be looked into, it might be a good idea to add it to handle_url() and then restart the timer once everything passes
   10782              :             cancel_deadline_timer();
   10783              :             bool is_invalid_request = false;
   10784              :             add_keep_alive_ = false;
   10785              : 
   10786              :             // Create context
   10787              :             ctx_ = detail::context<Middlewares...>();
   10788              :             req_.middleware_context = static_cast<void*>(&ctx_);
   10789              :             req_.middleware_container = static_cast<void*>(middlewares_);
   10790              :             req_.io_context = &adaptor_.get_io_context();
   10791              :             req_.remote_ip_address = adaptor_.address();
   10792              :             add_keep_alive_ = req_.keep_alive;
   10793              :             close_connection_ = req_.close_connection;
   10794              : 
   10795              :             if (req_.check_version(1, 1)) // HTTP/1.1
   10796              :             {
   10797              :                 if (!req_.headers.count("host"))
   10798              :                 {
   10799              :                     is_invalid_request = true;
   10800              :                     res = response(400);
   10801              :                 }
   10802              :                 else if (req_.upgrade)
   10803              :                 {
   10804              :                     // h2 or h2c headers
   10805              :                     if (req_.get_header_value("upgrade").find("h2")==0)
   10806              :                     {
   10807              :                         // TODO(ipkn): HTTP/2
   10808              :                         // currently, ignore upgrade header
   10809              :                     }
   10810              :                     else
   10811              :                     {
   10812              : 
   10813              :                         detail::middleware_call_helper<detail::middleware_call_criteria_only_global,
   10814              :                                                        0, decltype(ctx_), decltype(*middlewares_)>({}, *middlewares_, req_, res, ctx_);
   10815              :                         close_connection_ = true;
   10816              :                         handler_->handle_upgrade(req_, res, std::move(adaptor_));
   10817              :                         return;
   10818              :                     }
   10819              :                 }
   10820              :             }
   10821              : 
   10822              :             CROW_LOG_INFO << "Request: " << utility::lexical_cast<std::string>(adaptor_.remote_endpoint()) << " " << this << " HTTP/" << (char)(req_.http_ver_major + '0') << "." << (char)(req_.http_ver_minor + '0') << ' ' << method_name(req_.method) << " " << req_.url;
   10823              : 
   10824              : 
   10825              :             need_to_call_after_handlers_ = false;
   10826              :             if (!is_invalid_request)
   10827              :             {
   10828              :                 res.complete_request_handler_ = nullptr;
   10829              :                 auto self = this->shared_from_this();
   10830              :                 res.is_alive_helper_ = [self]() -> bool {
   10831              :                     return self->adaptor_.is_open();
   10832              :                 };
   10833              : 
   10834              :                 detail::middleware_call_helper<detail::middleware_call_criteria_only_global,
   10835              :                                                0, decltype(ctx_), decltype(*middlewares_)>({}, *middlewares_, req_, res, ctx_);
   10836              : 
   10837              :                 if (!res.completed_)
   10838              :                 {
   10839              :                     res.complete_request_handler_ = [self] {
   10840              :                         self->complete_request();
   10841              :                     };
   10842              :                     need_to_call_after_handlers_ = true;
   10843              :                     handler_->handle(req_, res, routing_handle_result_);
   10844              :                     if (add_keep_alive_)
   10845              :                         res.set_header("connection", "Keep-Alive");
   10846              :                 }
   10847              :                 else
   10848              :                 {
   10849              :                     complete_request();
   10850              :                 }
   10851              :             }
   10852              :             else
   10853              :             {
   10854              :                 complete_request();
   10855              :             }
   10856              :         }
   10857              : 
   10858              :         /// Call the after handle middleware and send the write the response to the connection.
   10859              :         void complete_request()
   10860              :         {
   10861              :             CROW_LOG_INFO << "Response: " << this << ' ' << req_.raw_url << ' ' << res.code << ' ' << close_connection_;
   10862              :             res.is_alive_helper_ = nullptr;
   10863              : 
   10864              :             if (need_to_call_after_handlers_)
   10865              :             {
   10866              :                 need_to_call_after_handlers_ = false;
   10867              : 
   10868              :                 // call all after_handler of middlewares
   10869              :                 detail::after_handlers_call_helper<
   10870              :                   detail::middleware_call_criteria_only_global,
   10871              :                   (static_cast<int>(sizeof...(Middlewares)) - 1),
   10872              :                   decltype(ctx_),
   10873              :                   decltype(*middlewares_)>({}, *middlewares_, ctx_, req_, res);
   10874              :             }
   10875              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
   10876              :             if (!res.body.empty() && handler_->compression_used())
   10877              :             {
   10878              :                 std::string accept_encoding = req_.get_header_value("Accept-Encoding");
   10879              :                 if (!accept_encoding.empty() && res.compressed)
   10880              :                 {
   10881              :                     switch (handler_->compression_algorithm())
   10882              :                     {
   10883              :                         case compression::DEFLATE:
   10884              :                             if (accept_encoding.find("deflate") != std::string::npos)
   10885              :                             {
   10886              :                                 res.body = compression::compress_string(res.body, compression::algorithm::DEFLATE);
   10887              :                                 res.set_header("Content-Encoding", "deflate");
   10888              :                             }
   10889              :                             break;
   10890              :                         case compression::GZIP:
   10891              :                             if (accept_encoding.find("gzip") != std::string::npos)
   10892              :                             {
   10893              :                                 res.body = compression::compress_string(res.body, compression::algorithm::GZIP);
   10894              :                                 res.set_header("Content-Encoding", "gzip");
   10895              :                             }
   10896              :                             break;
   10897              :                         default:
   10898              :                             break;
   10899              :                     }
   10900              :                 }
   10901              :             }
   10902              : #endif
   10903              : 
   10904              :             prepare_buffers();
   10905              : 
   10906              :             if (res.is_static_type())
   10907              :             {
   10908              :                 do_write_static();
   10909              :             }
   10910              :             else
   10911              :             {
   10912              :                 do_write_general();
   10913              :             }
   10914              :         }
   10915              : 
   10916              :     private:
   10917              :         void prepare_buffers()
   10918              :         {
   10919              :             res.complete_request_handler_ = nullptr;
   10920              :             res.is_alive_helper_ = nullptr;
   10921              : 
   10922              :             if (!adaptor_.is_open())
   10923              :             {
   10924              :                 //CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " delete (socket is closed) " << is_reading << ' ' << is_writing;
   10925              :                 //delete this;
   10926              :                 return;
   10927              :             }
   10928              :             res.write_header_into_buffer(buffers_, content_length_, add_keep_alive_, server_name_);
   10929              :         }
   10930              : 
   10931              :         void do_write_static()
   10932              :         {
   10933              :             asio::write(adaptor_.socket(), buffers_);
   10934              : 
   10935              :             if (res.file_info.statResult == 0)
   10936              :             {
   10937              :                 std::ifstream is(res.file_info.path.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
   10938              :                 std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers{1};
   10939              :                 char buf[16384];
   10940              :                 is.read(buf, sizeof(buf));
   10941              :                 while (is.gcount() > 0)
   10942              :                 {
   10943              :                     buffers[0] = asio::buffer(buf, is.gcount());
   10944              :                     do_write_sync(buffers);
   10945              :                     is.read(buf, sizeof(buf));
   10946              :                 }
   10947              :             }
   10948              :             if (close_connection_)
   10949              :             {
   10950              :                 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   10951              :                 adaptor_.close();
   10952              :                 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " from write (static)";
   10953              :             }
   10954              : 
   10955              :             res.end();
   10956              :             res.clear();
   10957              :             buffers_.clear();
   10958              :             parser_.clear();
   10959              :         }
   10960              : 
   10961              :         void do_write_general()
   10962              :         {
   10963              :             if (res.body.length() < res_stream_threshold_)
   10964              :             {
   10965              :                 res_body_copy_.swap(res.body);
   10966              :                 buffers_.emplace_back(res_body_copy_.data(), res_body_copy_.size());
   10967              : 
   10968              :                 do_write_sync(buffers_);
   10969              : 
   10970              :                 if (need_to_start_read_after_complete_)
   10971              :                 {
   10972              :                     need_to_start_read_after_complete_ = false;
   10973              :                     start_deadline();
   10974              :                     do_read();
   10975              :                 }
   10976              :             }
   10977              :             else
   10978              :             {
   10979              :                 asio::write(adaptor_.socket(), buffers_); // Write the response start / headers
   10980              :                 cancel_deadline_timer();
   10981              :                 if (res.body.length() > 0)
   10982              :                 {
   10983              :                     std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers{1};
   10984              :                     const uint8_t* data = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(res.body.data());
   10985              :                     size_t length = res.body.length();
   10986              :                     for (size_t transferred = 0; transferred < length;)
   10987              :                     {
   10988              :                         size_t to_transfer = CROW_MIN(16384UL, length - transferred);
   10989              :                         buffers[0] = asio::const_buffer(data + transferred, to_transfer);
   10990              :                         do_write_sync(buffers);
   10991              :                         transferred += to_transfer;
   10992              :                     }
   10993              :                 }
   10994              :                 if (close_connection_)
   10995              :                 {
   10996              :                     adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   10997              :                     adaptor_.close();
   10998              :                     CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " from write (res_stream)";
   10999              :                 }
   11000              : 
   11001              :                 res.end();
   11002              :                 res.clear();
   11003              :                 buffers_.clear();
   11004              :                 parser_.clear();
   11005              :             }
   11006              :         }
   11007              : 
   11008              :         void do_read()
   11009              :         {
   11010              :             auto self = this->shared_from_this();
   11011              :             adaptor_.socket().async_read_some(
   11012              :               asio::buffer(buffer_),
   11013              :               [self](const error_code& ec, std::size_t bytes_transferred) {
   11014              :                   bool error_while_reading = true;
   11015              :                   if (!ec)
   11016              :                   {
   11017              :                       bool ret = self->parser_.feed(self->buffer_.data(), bytes_transferred);
   11018              :                       if (ret && self->adaptor_.is_open())
   11019              :                       {
   11020              :                           error_while_reading = false;
   11021              :                       }
   11022              :                   }
   11023              : 
   11024              :                   if (error_while_reading)
   11025              :                   {
   11026              :                       self->cancel_deadline_timer();
   11027              :                       self->parser_.done();
   11028              :                       self->adaptor_.shutdown_read();
   11029              :                       self->adaptor_.close();
   11030              :                       CROW_LOG_DEBUG << self << " from read(1) with description: \"" << http_errno_description(static_cast<http_errno>(self->parser_.http_errno)) << '\"';
   11031              :                   }
   11032              :                   else if (self->close_connection_)
   11033              :                   {
   11034              :                       self->cancel_deadline_timer();
   11035              :                       self->parser_.done();
   11036              :                       // adaptor will close after write
   11037              :                   }
   11038              :                   else if (!self->need_to_call_after_handlers_)
   11039              :                   {
   11040              :                       self->start_deadline();
   11041              :                       self->do_read();
   11042              :                   }
   11043              :                   else
   11044              :                   {
   11045              :                       // res will be completed later by user
   11046              :                       self->need_to_start_read_after_complete_ = true;
   11047              :                   }
   11048              :               });
   11049              :         }
   11050              : 
   11051              :         void do_write()
   11052              :         {
   11053              :             auto self = this->shared_from_this();
   11054              :             asio::async_write(
   11055              :               adaptor_.socket(), buffers_,
   11056              :               [self](const error_code& ec, std::size_t /*bytes_transferred*/) {
   11057              :                   self->res.clear();
   11058              :                   self->res_body_copy_.clear();
   11059              :                   if (!self->continue_requested)
   11060              :                   {
   11061              :                       self->parser_.clear();
   11062              :                   }
   11063              :                   else
   11064              :                   {
   11065              :                       self->continue_requested = false;
   11066              :                   }
   11067              : 
   11068              :                   if (!ec)
   11069              :                   {
   11070              :                       if (self->close_connection_)
   11071              :                       {
   11072              :                           self->adaptor_.shutdown_write();
   11073              :                           self->adaptor_.close();
   11074              :                           CROW_LOG_DEBUG << self << " from write(1)";
   11075              :                       }
   11076              :                   }
   11077              :                   else
   11078              :                   {
   11079              :                       CROW_LOG_DEBUG << self << " from write(2)";
   11080              :                   }
   11081              :               });
   11082              :         }
   11083              : 
   11084              :         inline void do_write_sync(std::vector<asio::const_buffer>& buffers)
   11085              :         {
   11086              :             error_code ec;
