   11087              :             asio::write(adaptor_.socket(), buffers, ec);
   11088              : 
   11089              :             this->res.clear();
   11090              :             this->res_body_copy_.clear();
   11091              :             if (this->continue_requested)
   11092              :             {
   11093              :                 this->continue_requested = false;
   11094              :             }
   11095              :             else
   11096              :             {
   11097              :                 this->parser_.clear();
   11098              :             }
   11099              : 
   11100              :             if (ec)
   11101              :             {
   11102              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << ec << " - happened while sending buffers";
   11103              :                 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " from write (sync)(2)";
   11104              :             }
   11105              :         }
   11106              : 
   11107              :         void cancel_deadline_timer()
   11108              :         {
   11109              :             CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " timer cancelled: " << &task_timer_ << ' ' << task_id_;
   11110              :             task_timer_.cancel(task_id_);
   11111              :         }
   11112              : 
   11113              :         void start_deadline(/*int timeout = 5*/)
   11114              :         {
   11115              :             cancel_deadline_timer();
   11116              : 
   11117              :             auto self = this->shared_from_this();
   11118              :             task_id_ = task_timer_.schedule([self] {
   11119              :                 if (!self->adaptor_.is_open())
   11120              :                 {
   11121              :                     return;
   11122              :                 }
   11123              :                 self->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   11124              :                 self->adaptor_.close();
   11125              :             });
   11126              :             CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " timer added: " << &task_timer_ << ' ' << task_id_;
   11127              :         }
   11128              : 
   11129              :     private:
   11130              :         Adaptor adaptor_;
   11131              :         Handler* handler_;
   11132              : 
   11133              :         std::array<char, 4096> buffer_;
   11134              : 
   11135              :         HTTPParser<Connection> parser_;
   11136              :         std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> routing_handle_result_;
   11137              :         request& req_;
   11138              :         response res;
   11139              : 
   11140              :         bool close_connection_ = false;
   11141              : 
   11142              :         const std::string& server_name_;
   11143              :         std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers_;
   11144              : 
   11145              :         std::string content_length_;
   11146              :         std::string date_str_;
   11147              :         std::string res_body_copy_;
   11148              : 
   11149              :         detail::task_timer::identifier_type task_id_{};
   11150              : 
   11151              :         bool continue_requested{};
   11152              :         bool need_to_call_after_handlers_{};
   11153              :         bool need_to_start_read_after_complete_{};
   11154              :         bool add_keep_alive_{};
   11155              : 
   11156              :         std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares_;
   11157              :         detail::context<Middlewares...> ctx_;
   11158              : 
   11159              :         std::function<std::string()>& get_cached_date_str;
   11160              :         detail::task_timer& task_timer_;
   11161              : 
   11162              :         size_t res_stream_threshold_;
   11163              : 
   11164              :         std::atomic<unsigned int>& queue_length_;
   11165              :     };
   11166              : 
   11167              : } // namespace crow
   11168              : 
   11169              : 
   11170              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
   11171              : #include <boost/asio.hpp>
   11172              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   11173              : #include <boost/asio/ssl.hpp>
   11174              : #endif
   11175              : #else
   11176              : #ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
   11177              : #define ASIO_STANDALONE
   11178              : #endif
   11179              : #include <asio.hpp>
   11180              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   11181              : #include <asio/ssl.hpp>
   11182              : #endif
   11183              : #endif
   11184              : 
   11185              : #include <atomic>
   11186              : #include <chrono>
   11187              : #include <cstdint>
   11188              : #include <future>
   11189              : #include <memory>
   11190              : #include <thread>
   11191              : #include <vector>
   11192              : 
   11193              : 
   11194              : 
   11195              : namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
   11196              : {
   11197              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
   11198              :     namespace asio = boost::asio;
   11199              :     using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
   11200              : #else
   11201              :     using error_code = asio::error_code;
   11202              : #endif
   11203              :     using tcp = asio::ip::tcp;
   11204              :     using stream_protocol = asio::local::stream_protocol;
   11205              : 
   11206              :     template<typename Handler, typename Acceptor = TCPAcceptor, typename Adaptor = SocketAdaptor, typename... Middlewares>
   11207              :     class Server
   11208              :     {
   11209              :     public:
   11210              :       Server(Handler* handler,
   11211              :              typename Acceptor::endpoint endpoint, 
   11212              :              std::string server_name = std::string("Crow/") + VERSION,
   11213              :              std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares = nullptr,
   11214              :              unsigned int concurrency = 1,
   11215              :              uint8_t timeout = 5,
   11216              :              typename Adaptor::context* adaptor_ctx = nullptr):
   11217              :           concurrency_(concurrency),
   11218              :           task_queue_length_pool_(concurrency_ - 1),
   11219              :           acceptor_(io_context_),
   11220              :           signals_(io_context_),
   11221              :           tick_timer_(io_context_),
   11222              :           handler_(handler),
   11223              :           timeout_(timeout),
   11224              :           server_name_(server_name),
   11225              :           middlewares_(middlewares),
   11226              :           adaptor_ctx_(adaptor_ctx)
   11227              :         {
   11228              :             if (startup_failed_) {
   11229              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Startup failed; not running server.";
   11230              :                 return;
   11231              :             }
   11232              : 
   11233              :             error_code ec;
   11234              : 
   11235              :             acceptor_.raw_acceptor().open(endpoint.protocol(), ec);
   11236              :             if (ec) {
   11237              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Failed to open acceptor: " << ec.message();
   11238              :                 startup_failed_ = true;
   11239              :                 return;
   11240              :             }
   11241              : 
   11242              :             acceptor_.raw_acceptor().set_option(Acceptor::reuse_address_option(), ec);
   11243              :             if (ec) {
   11244              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Failed to set socket option: " << ec.message();
   11245              :                 startup_failed_ = true;
   11246              :                 return;
   11247              :             }
   11248              : 
   11249              :             acceptor_.raw_acceptor().bind(endpoint, ec);
   11250              :             if (ec) {
   11251              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Failed to bind to " << acceptor_.address()
   11252              :                             << ":" << acceptor_.port() << " - " << ec.message();
   11253              :                 startup_failed_ = true;
   11254              :                 return;
   11255              :             }
   11256              : 
   11257              :             acceptor_.raw_acceptor().listen(tcp::acceptor::max_listen_connections, ec);
   11258              :             if (ec) {
   11259              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Failed to listen on port: " << ec.message();
   11260              :                 startup_failed_ = true;
   11261              :                 return;
   11262              :             }
   11263              : 
   11264              : 
   11265              :         }
   11266              : 
   11267              :         void set_tick_function(std::chrono::milliseconds d, std::function<void()> f)
   11268              :         {
   11269              :             tick_interval_ = d;
   11270              :             tick_function_ = f;
   11271              :         }
   11272              : 
   11273              :         void on_tick()
   11274              :         {
   11275              :             tick_function_();
   11276              :             tick_timer_.expires_after(std::chrono::milliseconds(tick_interval_.count()));
   11277              :             tick_timer_.async_wait([this](const error_code& ec) {
   11278              :                 if (ec)
   11279              :                     return;
   11280              :                 on_tick();
   11281              :             });
   11282              :         }
   11283              : 
   11284              :         void run()
   11285              :         {
   11286              : 
   11287              :             if (startup_failed_) {
   11288              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Server startup failed. Aborting run().";
   11289              :                 return;
   11290              :             }
   11291              : 
   11292              :             uint16_t worker_thread_count = concurrency_ - 1;
   11293              :             for (int i = 0; i < worker_thread_count; i++)
   11294              :                 io_context_pool_.emplace_back(new asio::io_context());
   11295              :             get_cached_date_str_pool_.resize(worker_thread_count);
   11296              :             task_timer_pool_.resize(worker_thread_count);
   11297              : 
   11298              :             std::vector<std::future<void>> v;
   11299              :             std::atomic<int> init_count(0);
   11300              :             for (uint16_t i = 0; i < worker_thread_count; i++)
   11301              :                 v.push_back(
   11302              :                   std::async(
   11303              :                     std::launch::async, [this, i, &init_count] {
   11304              :                         // thread local date string get function
   11305              :                         auto last = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
   11306              : 
   11307              :                         std::string date_str;
   11308              :                         auto update_date_str = [&] {
   11309              :                             auto last_time_t = time(0);
   11310              :                             tm my_tm;
   11311              : 
   11312              : #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
   11313              :                             gmtime_s(&my_tm, &last_time_t);
   11314              : #else
   11315              :                             gmtime_r(&last_time_t, &my_tm);
   11316              : #endif
   11317              :                             date_str.resize(100);
   11318              :                             size_t date_str_sz = strftime(&date_str[0], 99, "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT", &my_tm);
   11319              :                             date_str.resize(date_str_sz);
   11320              :                         };
   11321              :                         update_date_str();
   11322              :                         get_cached_date_str_pool_[i] = [&]() -> std::string {
   11323              :                             if (std::chrono::steady_clock::now() - last >= std::chrono::seconds(1))
   11324              :                             {
   11325              :                                 last = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
   11326              :                                 update_date_str();
   11327              :                             }
   11328              :                             return date_str;
   11329              :                         };
   11330              : 
   11331              :                         // initializing task timers
   11332              :                         detail::task_timer task_timer(*io_context_pool_[i]);
   11333              :                         task_timer.set_default_timeout(timeout_);
   11334              :                         task_timer_pool_[i] = &task_timer;
   11335              :                         task_queue_length_pool_[i] = 0;
   11336              : 
   11337              :                         init_count++;
   11338              :                         while (1)
   11339              :                         {
   11340              :                             try
   11341              :                             {
   11342              :                                 if (io_context_pool_[i]->run() == 0)
   11343              :                                 {
   11344              :                                     // when io_service.run returns 0, there are no more works to do.
   11345              :                                     break;
   11346              :                                 }
   11347              :                             }
   11348              :                             catch (std::exception& e)
   11349              :                             {
   11350              :                                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Worker Crash: An uncaught exception occurred: " << e.what();
   11351              :                             }
   11352              :                         }
   11353              :                     }));
   11354              : 
   11355              :             if (tick_function_ && tick_interval_.count() > 0)
   11356              :             {
   11357              :                 tick_timer_.expires_after(std::chrono::milliseconds(tick_interval_.count()));
   11358              :                 tick_timer_.async_wait(
   11359              :                   [this](const error_code& ec) {
   11360              :                       if (ec)
   11361              :                           return;
   11362              :                       on_tick();
   11363              :                   });
   11364              :             }
   11365              :             handler_->port(acceptor_.port());
   11366              :             handler_->address_is_bound();
   11367              :             CROW_LOG_INFO << server_name_ 
   11368              :                           << " server is running at " << acceptor_.url_display(handler_->ssl_used()) 
   11369              :                           << " using " << concurrency_ << " threads";
   11370              :             CROW_LOG_INFO << "Call `app.loglevel(crow::LogLevel::Warning)` to hide Info level logs.";
   11371              : 
   11372              :             signals_.async_wait(
   11373              :               [&](const error_code& /*error*/, int /*signal_number*/) {
   11374              :                   stop();
   11375              :               });
   11376              : 
   11377              :             while (worker_thread_count != init_count)
   11378              :                 std::this_thread::yield();
   11379              : 
   11380              :             do_accept();
   11381              : 
   11382              :             std::thread(
   11383              :               [this] {
   11384              :                   notify_start();
   11385              :                   io_context_.run();
   11386              :                   CROW_LOG_INFO << "Exiting.";
   11387              :               })
   11388              :               .join();
   11389              :         }
   11390              : 
   11391              :         void stop()
   11392              :         {
   11393              :             shutting_down_ = true; // Prevent the acceptor from taking new connections
   11394              : 
   11395              :             // Explicitly close the acceptor
   11396              :             // else asio will throw an exception (linux only), when trying to start server again:
   11397              :             // what():  bind: Address already in use
   11398              :             if (acceptor_.raw_acceptor().is_open())
   11399              :             {
   11400              :                 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Closing acceptor. " << &acceptor_;
   11401              :                 error_code ec;
   11402              :                 acceptor_.raw_acceptor().close(ec);
   11403              :                 if (ec)
   11404              :                 {
   11405              :                     CROW_LOG_WARNING << "Failed to close acceptor: " << ec.message();
   11406              :                 }
   11407              :             }
   11408              : 
   11409              :             for (auto& io_context : io_context_pool_)
   11410              :             {
   11411              :                 if (io_context != nullptr)
   11412              :                 {
   11413              :                     CROW_LOG_INFO << "Closing IO service " << &io_context;
   11414              :                     io_context->stop(); // Close all io_services (and HTTP connections)
   11415              :                 }
   11416              :             }
   11417              : 
   11418              :             CROW_LOG_INFO << "Closing main IO service (" << &io_context_ << ')';
   11419              :             io_context_.stop(); // Close main io_service
   11420              :         }
   11421              : 
   11422              :         
   11423              :         uint16_t port() const {
   11424              :             return acceptor_.local_endpoint().port();
   11425              :         }
   11426              : 
   11427              :         /// Wait until the server has properly started or until timeout
   11428              :         std::cv_status wait_for_start(std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point wait_until)
   11429              :         {
   11430              :             std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
   11431              : 
   11432              :             std::cv_status status = std::cv_status::no_timeout;
   11433              :             while (!server_started_ && !startup_failed_ && status == std::cv_status::no_timeout)
   11434              :                 status = cv_started_.wait_until(lock, wait_until);
   11435              :             return status;
   11436              :         }
   11437              : 
   11438              : 
   11439              :         void signal_clear()
   11440              :         {
   11441              :             signals_.clear();
   11442              :         }
   11443              : 
   11444              :         void signal_add(int signal_number)
   11445              :         {
   11446              :             signals_.add(signal_number);
   11447              :         }
   11448              : 
   11449              :     private:
   11450              :         size_t pick_io_context_idx()
   11451              :         {
   11452              :             size_t min_queue_idx = 0;
   11453              : 
   11454              :             // TODO improve load balancing
   11455              :             // size_t is used here to avoid the security issue https://codeql.github.com/codeql-query-help/cpp/cpp-comparison-with-wider-type/
   11456              :             // even though the max value of this can be only uint16_t as concurrency is uint16_t.
   11457              :             for (size_t i = 1; i < task_queue_length_pool_.size() && task_queue_length_pool_[min_queue_idx] > 0; i++)
   11458              :             // No need to check other io_services if the current one has no tasks
   11459              :             {
   11460              :                 if (task_queue_length_pool_[i] < task_queue_length_pool_[min_queue_idx])
   11461              :                     min_queue_idx = i;
   11462              :             }
   11463              :             return min_queue_idx;
   11464              :         }
   11465              : 
   11466              :         void do_accept()
   11467              :         {
   11468              :             if (!shutting_down_)
   11469              :             {
   11470              :                 size_t context_idx = pick_io_context_idx();
   11471              :                 asio::io_context& ic = *io_context_pool_[context_idx];
   11472              :                 auto p = std::make_shared<Connection<Adaptor, Handler, Middlewares...>>(
   11473              :                     ic, handler_, server_name_, middlewares_,
   11474              :                     get_cached_date_str_pool_[context_idx], *task_timer_pool_[context_idx], adaptor_ctx_, task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx]);
   11475              :                     
   11476              :                 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << &ic << " {" << context_idx << "} queue length: " << task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx];
   11477              : 
   11478              :                 acceptor_.raw_acceptor().async_accept(
   11479              :                   p->socket(),
   11480              :                   [this, p, &ic](error_code ec) {
   11481              :                       if (!ec)
   11482              :                       {
   11483              :                           asio::post(ic,
   11484              :                             [p] {
   11485              :                                 p->start();
   11486              :                             });
   11487              :                       }
   11488              :                       do_accept();
   11489              :                   });
   11490              :             }
   11491              :         }
   11492              : 
   11493              :         /// Notify anything using `wait_for_start()` to proceed
   11494              :         void notify_start()
   11495              :         {
   11496              :             std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
   11497              :             server_started_ = true;
   11498              :             cv_started_.notify_all();
   11499              :         }
   11500              : 
   11501              :     private:
   11502              :         unsigned int concurrency_{2};
   11503              :         std::vector<std::atomic<unsigned int>> task_queue_length_pool_;
   11504              :         std::vector<std::unique_ptr<asio::io_context>> io_context_pool_;
   11505              :         asio::io_context io_context_;
   11506              :         std::vector<detail::task_timer*> task_timer_pool_;
   11507              :         std::vector<std::function<std::string()>> get_cached_date_str_pool_;
   11508              :         Acceptor acceptor_;
   11509              :         bool shutting_down_ = false;
   11510              :         bool server_started_{false};
   11511              :         bool startup_failed_ = false;
   11512              :         std::condition_variable cv_started_;
   11513              :         std::mutex start_mutex_;
   11514              :         asio::signal_set signals_;
   11515              : 
   11516              :         asio::basic_waitable_timer<std::chrono::high_resolution_clock> tick_timer_;
   11517              : 
   11518              :         Handler* handler_;
   11519              :         std::uint8_t timeout_;
   11520              :         std::string server_name_;
   11521              :         bool use_unix_;
   11522              : 
   11523              :         std::chrono::milliseconds tick_interval_;
   11524              :         std::function<void()> tick_function_;
   11525              : 
   11526              :         std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares_;
   11527              : 
   11528              :         typename Adaptor::context* adaptor_ctx_;
   11529              :     };
   11530              : } // namespace crow
   11531              : 
   11532              : #include <array>
   11533              : #include <memory>
   11534              : #include <optional>
   11535              : #include <string>
   11536              : #include <thread>
   11537              : 
   11538              : namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
   11539              : {
   11540              : #ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
   11541              :     namespace asio = boost::asio;
   11542              :     using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
   11543              : #else
   11544              :     using error_code = asio::error_code;
   11545              : #endif
   11546              : 
   11547              :     /**
   11548              :      * \namespace crow::websocket
   11549              :      * \brief Namespace that includes the \ref Connection class
   11550              :      * and \ref connection struct. Useful for WebSockets connection.
   11551              :      *
   11552              :      * Used specially in crow/websocket.h, crow/app.h and crow/routing.h
   11553              :      */
   11554              :     namespace websocket
   11555              :     {
   11556              :         enum class WebSocketReadState
   11557              :         {
   11558              :             MiniHeader,
   11559              :             Len16,
   11560              :             Len64,
   11561              :             Mask,
   11562              :             Payload,
   11563              :         };
   11564              : 
   11565              :         // Codes taken from https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6455#section-7.4.1
   11566              :         enum CloseStatusCode : uint16_t {
   11567              :             NormalClosure = 1000,
   11568              :             EndpointGoingAway = 1001,
   11569              :             ProtocolError = 1002,
   11570              :             UnacceptableData = 1003,
   11571              :             InconsistentData = 1007,
   11572              :             PolicyViolated = 1008,
   11573              :             MessageTooBig = 1009,
   11574              :             ExtensionsNotNegotiated = 1010,
   11575              :             UnexpectedCondition = 1011,
   11576              : 
   11577              :             // Reserved for applications only, should not send/receive these to/from clients
   11578              :             NoStatusCodePresent = 1005,
   11579              :             ClosedAbnormally = 1006,
   11580              :             TLSHandshakeFailure = 1015,
   11581              : 
   11582              :             StartStatusCodesForLibraries = 3000,
   11583              :             StartStatusCodesForPrivateUse = 4000,
   11584              :             // Status code should be between 1000 and 4999 inclusive
   11585              :             StartStatusCodes = NormalClosure,
   11586              :             EndStatusCodes = 4999,
   11587              :         };
   11588              : 
   11589              :         /// A base class for websocket connection.
   11590              :         struct connection
   11591              :         {
   11592              :             virtual void send_binary(std::string msg) = 0;
   11593              :             virtual void send_text(std::string msg) = 0;
   11594              :             virtual void send_ping(std::string msg) = 0;
   11595              :             virtual void send_pong(std::string msg) = 0;
   11596              :             virtual void close(std::string const& msg = "quit", uint16_t status_code = CloseStatusCode::NormalClosure) = 0;
   11597              :             virtual std::string get_remote_ip() = 0;
   11598              :             virtual std::string get_subprotocol() const = 0;
   11599              :             virtual ~connection() = default;
   11600              : 
   11601              :             void userdata(void* u) { userdata_ = u; }
   11602              :             void* userdata() { return userdata_; }
   11603              : 
   11604              :         private:
   11605              :             void* userdata_;
   11606              :         };
   11607              : 
   11608              :         // Modified version of the illustration in RFC6455 Section-5.2
   11609              :         //
   11610              :         //
   11611              :         //  0               1               2               3               -byte
   11612              :         //  0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 -bit
   11613              :         // +-+-+-+-+-------+-+-------------+-------------------------------+
   11614              :         // |F|R|R|R| opcode|M| Payload len |    Extended payload length    |
   11615              :         // |I|S|S|S|  (4)  |A|     (7)     |             (16/64)           |
   11616              :         // |N|V|V|V|       |S|             |   (if payload len==126/127)   |
   11617              :         // | |1|2|3|       |K|             |                               |
   11618              :         // +-+-+-+-+-------+-+-------------+ - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +
   11619              :         // |     Extended payload length continued, if payload len == 127  |
   11620              :         // + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +-------------------------------+
   11621              :         // |                               |Masking-key, if MASK set to 1  |
   11622              :         // +-------------------------------+-------------------------------+
   11623              :         // | Masking-key (continued)       |          Payload Data         |
   11624              :         // +-------------------------------- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +
   11625              :         // :                     Payload Data continued ...                :
   11626              :         // + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +
   11627              :         // |                     Payload Data continued ...                |
   11628              :         // +---------------------------------------------------------------+
   11629              :         //
   11630              : 
   11631              :         /// A websocket connection.
   11632              : 
   11633              :         template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler>
   11634              :         class Connection : public connection, public std::enable_shared_from_this<Connection<Adaptor, Handler>>
   11635              :         {
   11636              :         public:
   11637              :             /// Factory for a connection.
   11638              :             ///
   11639              :             /// Requires a request with an "Upgrade: websocket" header.<br>
   11640              :             /// Automatically handles the handshake.
   11641              :             static void create(const crow::request& req, Adaptor adaptor, Handler* handler,
   11642              :                                uint64_t max_payload, const std::vector<std::string>& subprotocols,
   11643              :                                std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&)> open_handler,
   11644              :                                std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, bool)> message_handler,
   11645              :                                std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, uint16_t)> close_handler,
   11646              :                                std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&)> error_handler,
   11647              :                                std::function<void(const crow::request&, std::optional<crow::response>&, void**)> accept_handler,
   11648              :                                bool mirror_protocols)
   11649              :             {
   11650              :                 auto conn = std::shared_ptr<Connection>(new Connection(std::move(adaptor), 
   11651              :                                                                        handler, max_payload,
   11652              :                                                                        std::move(open_handler), 
   11653              :                                                                        std::move(message_handler), 
   11654              :                                                                        std::move(close_handler),
   11655              :                                                                        std::move(error_handler), 
   11656              :                                                                        std::move(accept_handler)));
   11657              :                 
   11658              :                 // Perform handshake validation
   11659              :                 if (!utility::string_equals(req.get_header_value("upgrade"), "websocket"))
   11660              :                 {
   11661              :                     conn->adaptor_.close();
   11662              :                     return;
   11663              :                 }
   11664              : 
   11665              :                 std::string requested_subprotocols_header = req.get_header_value("Sec-WebSocket-Protocol");
   11666              :                 if (!subprotocols.empty() || !requested_subprotocols_header.empty())
   11667              :                 {
   11668              :                     auto requested_subprotocols = utility::split(requested_subprotocols_header, ", ");
   11669              :                     auto subprotocol = utility::find_first_of(subprotocols.begin(), subprotocols.end(), requested_subprotocols.begin(), requested_subprotocols.end());
   11670              :                     if (subprotocol != subprotocols.end())
   11671              :                     {
   11672              :                         conn->subprotocol_ = *subprotocol;
   11673              :                     }
   11674              :                 }
   11675              : 
   11676              :                 if (mirror_protocols & !requested_subprotocols_header.empty())
   11677              :                 {
   11678              :                     conn->subprotocol_ = requested_subprotocols_header;
   11679              :                 }
   11680              : 
   11681              :                 if (conn->accept_handler_)
   11682              :                 {
   11683              :                     void* ud = nullptr;
   11684              :                     std::optional<crow::response> res;
   11685              :                     conn->accept_handler_(req, res, &ud);
   11686              :                     if (res)
   11687              :                     {
   11688              :                         std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers;
   11689              :                         auto server_name = "";
   11690              :                         std::string content_length_buffer;
   11691              :                         res->write_header_into_buffer(buffers, content_length_buffer, req.keep_alive, server_name);
   11692              :                         buffers.emplace_back(res->body.data(), res->body.size());
   11693              :                         error_code ec;
   11694              :                         asio::write(conn->adaptor_.socket(), buffers, ec);
   11695              :                         conn->adaptor_.close();
   11696              :                         return;
   11697              :                     }
   11698              :                     conn->userdata(ud);
   11699              :                 }
   11700              : 
   11701              :                 // Sec-WebSocket-Key: dGhlIHNhbXBsZSBub25jZQ==
   11702              :                 // Sec-WebSocket-Version: 13
   11703              :                 std::string magic = req.get_header_value("Sec-WebSocket-Key") + "258EAFA5-E914-47DA-95CA-C5AB0DC85B11";
   11704              :                 sha1::SHA1 s;
   11705              :                 s.processBytes(magic.data(), magic.size());
   11706              :                 uint8_t digest[20];
   11707              :                 s.getDigestBytes(digest);
   11708              : 
   11709              :                 conn->handler_->add_websocket(conn);
   11710              :                 conn->start(crow::utility::base64encode((unsigned char*)digest, 20));
   11711              :             }
   11712              : 
   11713              :             ~Connection() noexcept override = default;
   11714              : 
   11715              :             template<typename Callable>
   11716              :             struct WeakWrappedMessage
   11717              :             {
   11718              :                 Callable callable;
   11719              :                 std::weak_ptr<void> watch;
   11720              : 
   11721              :                 void operator()()
   11722              :                 {
   11723              :                     if (auto anchor = watch.lock())
   11724              :                     {
   11725              :                         std::move(callable)();
   11726              :                     }
   11727              :                 }
   11728              :             };
   11729              : 
   11730              :             /// Send data through the socket.
   11731              :             template<typename CompletionHandler>
   11732              :             void dispatch(CompletionHandler&& handler)
   11733              :             {
   11734              :                 asio::dispatch(adaptor_.get_io_context(),
   11735              :                                WeakWrappedMessage<typename std::decay<CompletionHandler>::type>{
   11736              :                                  std::forward<CompletionHandler>(handler), anchor_});
   11737              :             }
   11738              : 
   11739              :             /// Send data through the socket and return immediately.
   11740              :             template<typename CompletionHandler>
   11741              :             void post(CompletionHandler&& handler)
   11742              :             {
   11743              :                 asio::post(adaptor_.get_io_context(),
   11744              :                            WeakWrappedMessage<typename std::decay<CompletionHandler>::type>{
   11745              :                              std::forward<CompletionHandler>(handler), anchor_});
   11746              :             }
   11747              : 
   11748              :             /// Send a "Ping" message.
   11749              : 
   11750              :             ///
   11751              :             /// Usually invoked to check if the other point is still online.
   11752              :             void send_ping(std::string msg) override
   11753              :             {
   11754              :                 send_data(0x9, std::move(msg));
   11755              :             }
   11756              : 
   11757              :             /// Send a "Pong" message.
   11758              : 
   11759              :             ///
   11760              :             /// Usually automatically invoked as a response to a "Ping" message.
   11761              :             void send_pong(std::string msg) override
   11762              :             {
   11763              :                 send_data(0xA, std::move(msg));
   11764              :             }
   11765              : 
   11766              :             /// Send a binary encoded message.
   11767              :             void send_binary(std::string msg) override
   11768              :             {
   11769              :                 send_data(0x2, std::move(msg));
   11770              :             }
   11771              : 
   11772              :             /// Send a plaintext message.
   11773              :             void send_text(std::string msg) override
   11774              :             {
   11775              :                 send_data(0x1, std::move(msg));
   11776              :             }
   11777              : 
   11778              :             /// Send a close signal.
   11779              : 
   11780              :             ///
   11781              :             /// Sets a flag to destroy the object once the message is sent.
   11782              :             void close(std::string const& msg, uint16_t status_code) override
   11783              :             {
   11784              :                 dispatch([shared_this = this->shared_from_this(), msg, status_code]() mutable {
   11785              :                     shared_this->has_sent_close_ = true;
   11786              :                     if (shared_this->has_recv_close_ && !shared_this->is_close_handler_called_)
   11787              :                     {
   11788              :                         shared_this->is_close_handler_called_ = true;
   11789              :                         if (shared_this->close_handler_)
   11790              :                             shared_this->close_handler_(*shared_this, msg, status_code);
   11791              :                     }
   11792              :                     auto header = shared_this->build_header(0x8, msg.size() + 2);
   11793              :                     char status_buf[2];
   11794              :                     *(uint16_t*)(status_buf) = htons(status_code);
   11795              : 
   11796              :                     shared_this->write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(header));
   11797              :                     shared_this->write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::string(status_buf, 2));
   11798              :                     shared_this->write_buffers_.emplace_back(msg);
   11799              :                     shared_this->do_write();
   11800              :                 });
   11801              :             }
   11802              : 
   11803              :             std::string get_remote_ip() override
   11804              :             {
   11805              :                 return adaptor_.address();
   11806              :             }
   11807              : 
   11808              :             void set_max_payload_size(uint64_t payload)
   11809              :             {
   11810              :                 max_payload_bytes_ = payload;
   11811              :             }
   11812              : 
   11813              :             /// Returns the matching client/server subprotocol, empty string if none matched. 
   11814              :             std::string get_subprotocol() const override
   11815              :             {
   11816              :                 return subprotocol_;
   11817              :             }
   11818              : 
   11819              :         protected:
   11820              :             /// Generate the websocket headers using an opcode and the message size (in bytes).
   11821              :             std::string build_header(int opcode, size_t size)
   11822              :             {
   11823              :                 char buf[2 + 8] = "\x80\x00";
   11824              :                 buf[0] += opcode;
   11825              :                 if (size < 126)
   11826              :                 {
   11827              :                     buf[1] += static_cast<char>(size);
   11828              :                     return {buf, buf + 2};
   11829              :                 }
   11830              :                 else if (size < 0x10000)
   11831              :                 {
   11832              :                     buf[1] += 126;
   11833              :                     *(uint16_t*)(buf + 2) = htons(static_cast<uint16_t>(size));
   11834              :                     return {buf, buf + 4};
   11835              :                 }
   11836              :                 else
   11837              :                 {
   11838              :                     buf[1] += 127;
   11839              :                     *reinterpret_cast<uint64_t*>(buf + 2) = ((1 == htonl(1)) ? static_cast<uint64_t>(size) : (static_cast<uint64_t>(htonl((size)&0xFFFFFFFF)) << 32) | htonl(static_cast<uint64_t>(size) >> 32));
   11840              :                     return {buf, buf + 10};
   11841              :                 }
   11842              :             }
   11843              : 
   11844              :             /// Send the HTTP upgrade response.
   11845              : 
   11846              :             ///
   11847              :             /// Finishes the handshake process, then starts reading messages from the socket.
   11848              :             void start(std::string&& hello)
   11849              :             {
   11850              :                 static const std::string header =
   11851              :                   "HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols\r\n"
   11852              :                   "Upgrade: websocket\r\n"
   11853              :                   "Connection: Upgrade\r\n"
   11854              :                   "Sec-WebSocket-Accept: ";
   11855              :                 write_buffers_.emplace_back(header);
   11856              :                 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(hello));
   11857              :                 write_buffers_.emplace_back(crlf);
   11858              :                 if (!subprotocol_.empty())
   11859              :                 {
   11860              :                     write_buffers_.emplace_back("Sec-WebSocket-Protocol: ");
   11861              :                     write_buffers_.emplace_back(subprotocol_);
   11862              :                     write_buffers_.emplace_back(crlf);
   11863              :                 }
   11864              :                 write_buffers_.emplace_back(crlf);
   11865              :                 do_write();
   11866              :                 if (open_handler_)
   11867              :                     open_handler_(*this);
   11868              :                 do_read();
   11869              :             }
   11870              : 
   11871              :             /// Read a websocket message.
   11872              : 
   11873              :             ///
   11874              :             /// Involves:<br>
   11875              :             /// Handling headers (opcodes, size).<br>
   11876              :             /// Unmasking the payload.<br>
   11877              :             /// Reading the actual payload.<br>
   11878              :             void do_read()
   11879              :             {
   11880              :                 if (has_sent_close_ && has_recv_close_)
   11881              :                 {
   11882              :                     close_connection_ = true;
   11883              :                     adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   11884              :                     adaptor_.close();
   11885              :                     check_destroy();
   11886              :                     return;
   11887              :                 }
   11888              : 
   11889              :                 is_reading = true;
   11890              :                 switch (state_)
   11891              :                 {
   11892              :                     case WebSocketReadState::MiniHeader:
   11893              :                     {
   11894              :                         mini_header_ = 0;
   11895              :                         //asio::async_read(adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer(&mini_header_, 1),
   11896              :                         adaptor_.socket().async_read_some(
   11897              :                           asio::buffer(&mini_header_, 2),
   11898              :                           [shared_this = this->shared_from_this()](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
   11899              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   11900              :                                                                bytes_transferred
   11901              : #endif
   11902              :                           )
   11903              : 
   11904              :                           {
   11905              :                               shared_this->is_reading = false;
   11906              :                               shared_this->mini_header_ = ntohs(shared_this->mini_header_);
   11907              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   11908              : 
   11909              :                               if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 2)
   11910              :                               {
   11911              :                                   throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:MiniHeader:async_read fail:asio bug?");
   11912              :                               }
   11913              : #endif
   11914              : 
   11915              :                               if (!ec)
   11916              :                               {
   11917              :                                   if ((shared_this->mini_header_ & 0x80) == 0x80)
   11918              :                                       shared_this->has_mask_ = true;
   11919              :                                   else //if the websocket specification is enforced and the message isn't masked, terminate the connection
   11920              :                                   {
   11921              : #ifndef CROW_ENFORCE_WS_SPEC
   11922              :                                       shared_this->has_mask_ = false;
   11923              : #else
   11924              :                                       shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   11925              :                                       shared_this->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   11926              :                                       shared_this->adaptor_.close();
   11927              :                                       if (shared_this->error_handler_)
   11928              :                                           shared_this->error_handler_(*shared_this, "Client connection not masked.");
   11929              :                                       shared_this->check_destroy(CloseStatusCode::UnacceptableData);
   11930              : #endif
   11931              :                                   }
   11932              : 
   11933              :                                   if ((shared_this->mini_header_ & 0x7f) == 127)
   11934              :                                   {
   11935              :                                       shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::Len64;
   11936              :                                   }
   11937              :                                   else if ((shared_this->mini_header_ & 0x7f) == 126)
   11938              :                                   {
   11939              :                                       shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::Len16;
   11940              :                                   }
   11941              :                                   else
   11942              :                                   {
   11943              :                                       shared_this->remaining_length_ = shared_this->mini_header_ & 0x7f;
   11944              :                                       shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::Mask;
   11945              :                                   }
   11946              :                                   shared_this->do_read();
   11947              :                               }
   11948              :                               else
   11949              :                               {
   11950              :                                   shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   11951              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   11952              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.close();
   11953              :                                   if (shared_this->error_handler_)
   11954              :                                       shared_this->error_handler_(*shared_this, ec.message());
   11955              :                                   shared_this->check_destroy();
   11956              :                               }
   11957              :                           });
   11958              :                     }
   11959              :                     break;
   11960              :                     case WebSocketReadState::Len16:
   11961              :                     {
   11962              :                         remaining_length_ = 0;
   11963              :                         remaining_length16_ = 0;
   11964              :                         asio::async_read(
   11965              :                           adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer(&remaining_length16_, 2),
   11966              :                           [shared_this = this->shared_from_this()](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
   11967              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   11968              :                                                                bytes_transferred
   11969              : #endif
   11970              :                           ) {
   11971              :                               shared_this->is_reading = false;
   11972              :                               shared_this->remaining_length16_ = ntohs(shared_this->remaining_length16_);
   11973              :                               shared_this->remaining_length_ = shared_this->remaining_length16_;
   11974              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   11975              :                               if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 2)
   11976              :                               {
   11977              :                                   throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:Len16:async_read fail:asio bug?");
   11978              :                               }
   11979              : #endif
   11980              : 
   11981              :                               if (!ec)
   11982              :                               {
   11983              :                                   shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::Mask;
   11984              :                                   shared_this->do_read();
   11985              :                               }
   11986              :                               else
   11987              :                               {
   11988              :                                   shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   11989              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   11990              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.close();
   11991              :                                   if (shared_this->error_handler_)
   11992              :                                       shared_this->error_handler_(*shared_this, ec.message());
   11993              :                                   shared_this->check_destroy();
   11994              :                               }
   11995              :                           });
   11996              :                     }
   11997              :                     break;
   11998              :                     case WebSocketReadState::Len64:
   11999              :                     {
   12000              :                         asio::async_read(
   12001              :                           adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer(&remaining_length_, 8),
   12002              :                           [shared_this = this->shared_from_this()](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
   12003              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   12004              :                                                                bytes_transferred
   12005              : #endif
   12006              :                           ) {
   12007              :                               shared_this->is_reading = false;
   12008              :                               shared_this->remaining_length_ = ((1 == ntohl(1)) ? (shared_this->remaining_length_) : (static_cast<uint64_t>(ntohl((shared_this->remaining_length_)&0xFFFFFFFF)) << 32) | ntohl((shared_this->remaining_length_) >> 32));
   12009              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   12010              :                               if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 8)
   12011              :                               {
   12012              :                                   throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:Len16:async_read fail:asio bug?");
   12013              :                               }
   12014              : #endif
   12015              : 
   12016              :                               if (!ec)
   12017              :                               {
   12018              :                                   shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::Mask;
   12019              :                                   shared_this->do_read();
   12020              :                               }
   12021              :                               else
   12022              :                               {
   12023              :                                   shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   12024              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   12025              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.close();
   12026              :                                   if (shared_this->error_handler_)
   12027              :                                       shared_this->error_handler_(*shared_this, ec.message());
   12028              :                                   shared_this->check_destroy();
   12029              :                               }
   12030              :                           });
   12031              :                     }
   12032              :                     break;
   12033              :                     case WebSocketReadState::Mask:
   12034              :                         if (remaining_length_ > max_payload_bytes_)
   12035              :                         {
   12036              :                             close_connection_ = true;
   12037              :                             adaptor_.close();
   12038              :                             if (error_handler_)
   12039              :                                 error_handler_(*this, "Message length exceeds maximum payload.");
   12040              :                             check_destroy(MessageTooBig);
   12041              :                         }
   12042              :                         else if (has_mask_)
   12043              :                         {
   12044              :                             asio::async_read(
   12045              :                               adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer((char*)&mask_, 4),
   12046              :                               [shared_this = this->shared_from_this()](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
   12047              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   12048              :                                                                    bytes_transferred
   12049              : #endif
   12050              :                               ) {
   12051              :                                   shared_this->is_reading = false;
   12052              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   12053              :                                   if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 4)
   12054              :                                   {
   12055              :                                       throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:Mask:async_read fail:asio bug?");
   12056              :                                   }
   12057              : #endif
   12058              : 
   12059              :                                   if (!ec)
   12060              :                                   {
   12061              :                                       shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::Payload;
   12062              :                                       shared_this->do_read();
   12063              :                                   }
   12064              :                                   else
   12065              :                                   {
   12066              :                                       shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   12067              :                                       if (shared_this->error_handler_)
   12068              :                                           shared_this->error_handler_(*shared_this, ec.message());
   12069              :                                       shared_this->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   12070              :                                       shared_this->adaptor_.close();
   12071              :                                       shared_this->check_destroy();
   12072              :                                   }
   12073              :                               });
   12074              :                         }
   12075              :                         else
   12076              :                         {
   12077              :                             state_ = WebSocketReadState::Payload;
   12078              :                             do_read();
   12079              :                         }
   12080              :                         break;
   12081              :                     case WebSocketReadState::Payload:
   12082              :                     {
   12083              :                         auto to_read = static_cast<std::uint64_t>(buffer_.size());
   12084              :                         if (remaining_length_ < to_read)
   12085              :                             to_read = remaining_length_;
   12086              :                         adaptor_.socket().async_read_some(
   12087              :                           asio::buffer(buffer_, static_cast<std::size_t>(to_read)),
   12088              :                           [shared_this = this->shared_from_this()](const error_code& ec, std::size_t bytes_transferred) {
   12089              :                               shared_this->is_reading = false;
   12090              : 
   12091              :                               if (!ec)
   12092              :                               {
   12093              :                                   shared_this->fragment_.insert(shared_this->fragment_.end(), shared_this->buffer_.begin(), shared_this->buffer_.begin() + bytes_transferred);
   12094              :                                   shared_this->remaining_length_ -= bytes_transferred;
   12095              :                                   if (shared_this->remaining_length_ == 0)
   12096              :                                   {
   12097              :                                       if (shared_this->handle_fragment())
   12098              :                                       {
   12099              :                                           shared_this->state_ = WebSocketReadState::MiniHeader;
   12100              :                                           shared_this->do_read();
   12101              :                                       }
   12102              :                                   }
   12103              :                                   else
   12104              :                                       shared_this->do_read();
   12105              :                               }
   12106              :                               else
   12107              :                               {
   12108              :                                   shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   12109              :                                   if (shared_this->error_handler_)
   12110              :                                       shared_this->error_handler_(*shared_this, ec.message());
   12111              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   12112              :                                   shared_this->adaptor_.close();
   12113              :                                   shared_this->check_destroy();
   12114              :                               }
   12115              :                           });
   12116              :                     }
   12117              :                     break;
   12118              :                 }
   12119              :             }
   12120              : 
   12121              :             /// Check if the FIN bit is set.
   12122              :             bool is_FIN()
   12123              :             {
   12124              :                 return mini_header_ & 0x8000;
   12125              :             }
   12126              : 
   12127              :             /// Extract the opcode from the header.
   12128              :             int opcode()
   12129              :             {
   12130              :                 return (mini_header_ & 0x0f00) >> 8;
   12131              :             }
   12132              : 
   12133              :             /// Process the payload fragment.
   12134              : 
   12135              :             ///
   12136              :             /// Unmasks the fragment, checks the opcode, merges fragments into 1 message body, and calls the appropriate handler.
   12137              :             bool handle_fragment()
   12138              :             {
   12139              :                 if (has_mask_)
   12140              :                 {
   12141              :                     for (decltype(fragment_.length()) i = 0; i < fragment_.length(); i++)
   12142              :                     {
   12143              :                         fragment_[i] ^= ((char*)&mask_)[i % 4];
   12144              :                     }
   12145              :                 }
   12146              :                 switch (opcode())
   12147              :                 {
   12148              :                     case 0: // Continuation
   12149              :                     {
   12150              :                         message_ += fragment_;
   12151              :                         if (is_FIN())
   12152              :                         {
   12153              :                             if (message_handler_)
   12154              :                                 message_handler_(*this, message_, is_binary_);
   12155              :                             message_.clear();
   12156              :                         }
   12157              :                     }
   12158              :                     break;
   12159              :                     case 1: // Text
   12160              :                     {
   12161              :                         is_binary_ = false;
   12162              :                         message_ += fragment_;
   12163              :                         if (is_FIN())
   12164              :                         {
   12165              :                             if (message_handler_)
   12166              :                                 message_handler_(*this, message_, is_binary_);
   12167              :                             message_.clear();
   12168              :                         }
   12169              :                     }
   12170              :                     break;
   12171              :                     case 2: // Binary
   12172              :                     {
   12173              :                         is_binary_ = true;
   12174              :                         message_ += fragment_;
   12175              :                         if (is_FIN())
   12176              :                         {
   12177              :                             if (message_handler_)
   12178              :                                 message_handler_(*this, message_, is_binary_);
   12179              :                             message_.clear();
   12180              :                         }
   12181              :                     }
   12182              :                     break;
   12183              :                     case 0x8: // Close
   12184              :                     {
   12185              :                         has_recv_close_ = true;
   12186              : 
   12187              : 
   12188              :                         uint16_t status_code = NoStatusCodePresent;
   12189              :                         std::string::size_type message_start = 2;
   12190              :                         if (fragment_.size() >= 2)
   12191              :                         {
   12192              :                             status_code = ntohs(((uint16_t*)fragment_.data())[0]);
   12193              :                         } else {
   12194              :                             // no message will crash substr
   12195              :                             message_start = 0;
   12196              :                         }
   12197              : 
   12198              :                         if (!has_sent_close_)
   12199              :                         {
   12200              :                             close(fragment_.substr(message_start), status_code);
   12201              :                         }
   12202              :                         else
   12203              :                         {
   12204              : 
   12205              :                             close_connection_ = true;
   12206              :                             if (!is_close_handler_called_)
   12207              :                             {
   12208              :                                 if (close_handler_)
   12209              :                                     close_handler_(*this, fragment_.substr(message_start), status_code);
   12210              :                                 is_close_handler_called_ = true;
   12211              :                             }
   12212              :                             adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
   12213              :                             adaptor_.close();
   12214              : 
   12215              :                             // Close handler must have been called at this point so code does not matter
   12216              :                             check_destroy();
   12217              :                             return false;
   12218              :                         }
   12219              :                     }
   12220              :                     break;
   12221              :                     case 0x9: // Ping
   12222              :                     {
   12223              :                         send_pong(fragment_);
   12224              :                     }
   12225              :                     break;
   12226              :                     case 0xA: // Pong
   12227              :                     {
   12228              :                         pong_received_ = true;
   12229              :                     }
   12230              :                     break;
   12231              :                 }
   12232              : 
   12233              :                 fragment_.clear();
   12234              :                 return true;
   12235              :             }
   12236              : 
   12237              :             /// Send the buffers' data through the socket.
   12238              : 
   12239              :             ///
   12240              :             /// Also destroys the object if the Close flag is set.
   12241              :             void do_write()
   12242              :             {
   12243              :                 if (write_buffers_.empty()) return;
   12244              : 
   12245              :                 sending_buffers_.swap(write_buffers_);
   12246              :                 std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers;
   12247              :                 buffers.reserve(sending_buffers_.size());
   12248              :                 for (auto& s : sending_buffers_)
   12249              :                 {
   12250              :                     buffers.emplace_back(asio::buffer(s));
   12251              :                 }
   12252              :                 auto watch = std::weak_ptr<void>{anchor_};
   12253              :                 asio::async_write(
   12254              :                     adaptor_.socket(), buffers,
   12255              :                     [shared_this = this->shared_from_this(), watch](const error_code& ec, std::size_t /*bytes_transferred*/) {
   12256              :                         auto anchor = watch.lock();
   12257              :                         if (anchor == nullptr)
   12258              :                             return;
   12259              : 
   12260              :                         if (!ec && !shared_this->close_connection_)
   12261              :                         {
   12262              :                             shared_this->sending_buffers_.clear();
   12263              :                             if (!shared_this->write_buffers_.empty())
   12264              :                                 shared_this->do_write();
   12265              :                             if (shared_this->has_sent_close_)
   12266              :                                 shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   12267              :                         }
   12268              :                         else
   12269              :                         {
   12270              :                             shared_this->sending_buffers_.clear();
   12271              :                             shared_this->close_connection_ = true;
   12272              :                             shared_this->check_destroy();
   12273              :                         }
   12274              :                     });
   12275              :             }
   12276              : 
   12277              :             /// Destroy the Connection.
   12278              :             void check_destroy(websocket::CloseStatusCode code = CloseStatusCode::ClosedAbnormally)
   12279              :             {
   12280              :                 // Note that if the close handler was not yet called at this point we did not receive a close packet (or send one)
   12281              :                 // and thus we use ClosedAbnormally unless instructed otherwise
   12282              :                 if (!is_close_handler_called_)
   12283              :                 {
   12284              :                     if (close_handler_)
   12285              :                     {
   12286              :                         close_handler_(*this, "uncleanly", code);
   12287              :                     }
   12288              :                 }
   12289              : 
   12290              :                 handler_->remove_websocket(this->shared_from_this());
   12291              :             }
   12292              : 
   12293              : 
   12294              :             struct SendMessageType
   12295              :             {
   12296              :                 std::string payload;
   12297              :                 Connection* self;
   12298              :                 int opcode;
   12299              : 
   12300              :                 void operator()()
   12301              :                 {
   12302              :                     self->send_data_impl(this);
   12303              :                 }
   12304              :             };
   12305              : 
   12306              :             void send_data_impl(SendMessageType* s)
   12307              :             {
   12308              :                 auto header = build_header(s->opcode, s->payload.size());
   12309              :                 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(header));
   12310              :                 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(s->payload));
   12311              :                 do_write();
   12312              :             }
   12313              : 
   12314              :             void send_data(int opcode, std::string&& msg)
   12315              :             {
   12316              :                 SendMessageType event_arg{
   12317              :                   std::move(msg),
   12318              :                   this,
   12319              :                   opcode};
   12320              : 
   12321              :                 post(std::move(event_arg));
   12322              :             }
   12323              : 
   12324              :         private:
   12325              :             Connection(Adaptor&& adaptor, Handler* handler, uint64_t max_payload,
   12326              :                        std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&)> open_handler,
   12327              :                        std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, bool)> message_handler,
   12328              :                        std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, uint16_t)> close_handler,
