   13631              :         friend class Router;
   13632              :     };
   13633              : 
   13634              :     /// Handles matching requests to existing rules and upgrade requests.
   13635              :     class Router {
   13636              :     public:
   13637              :         bool using_ssl;
   13638              : 
   13639              :         Router() : using_ssl(false)
   13640              :         {}
   13641              : 
   13642              :         DynamicRule& new_rule_dynamic(const std::string& rule)
   13643              :         {
   13644              :             auto ruleObject = new DynamicRule(rule);
   13645              :             all_rules_.emplace_back(ruleObject);
   13646              : 
   13647              :             return *ruleObject;
   13648              :         }
   13649              : 
   13650              :         template<uint64_t N>
   13651              :         typename black_magic::arguments<N>::type::template rebind<TaggedRule>& new_rule_tagged(const std::string& rule)
   13652              :         {
   13653              :             using RuleT = typename black_magic::arguments<N>::type::template rebind<TaggedRule>;
   13654              : 
   13655              :             auto ruleObject = new RuleT(rule);
   13656              :             all_rules_.emplace_back(ruleObject);
   13657              : 
   13658              :             return *ruleObject;
   13659              :         }
   13660              : 
   13661              :         CatchallRule& catchall_rule()
   13662              :         {
   13663              :             return catchall_rule_;
   13664              :         }
   13665              : 
   13666              :         void internal_add_rule_object(const std::string& rule, BaseRule* ruleObject)
   13667              :         {
   13668              :             internal_add_rule_object(rule, ruleObject, INVALID_BP_ID, blueprints_);
   13669              :         }
   13670              : 
   13671              :         void internal_add_rule_object(const std::string& rule, BaseRule* ruleObject, const uint16_t& BP_index, std::vector<Blueprint*>& blueprints)
   13672              :         {
   13673              :             bool has_trailing_slash = false;
   13674              :             std::string rule_without_trailing_slash;
   13675              :             if (rule.size() > 1 && rule.back() == '/')
   13676              :             {
   13677              :                 has_trailing_slash = true;
   13678              :                 rule_without_trailing_slash = rule;
   13679              :                 rule_without_trailing_slash.pop_back();
   13680              :             }
   13681              : 
   13682              :             ruleObject->mw_indices_.pack();
   13683              : 
   13684              :             ruleObject->foreach_method([&](int method) {
   13685              :                 per_methods_[method].rules.emplace_back(ruleObject);
   13686              :                 per_methods_[method].trie.add(rule, per_methods_[method].rules.size() - 1, BP_index != INVALID_BP_ID ? blueprints[BP_index]->prefix().length() : 0, BP_index);
   13687              : 
   13688              :                 // directory case:
   13689              :                 //   request to '/about' url matches '/about/' rule
   13690              :                 if (has_trailing_slash)
   13691              :                 {
   13692              :                     per_methods_[method].trie.add(rule_without_trailing_slash, RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH, BP_index != INVALID_BP_ID ? blueprints[BP_index]->prefix().length() : 0, BP_index);
   13693              :                 }
   13694              :             });
   13695              : 
   13696              :             ruleObject->set_added();
   13697              :         }
   13698              : 
   13699              :         void register_blueprint(Blueprint& blueprint)
   13700              :         {
   13701              :             if (std::find(blueprints_.begin(), blueprints_.end(), &blueprint) == blueprints_.end())
   13702              :             {
   13703              :                 blueprints_.emplace_back(&blueprint);
   13704              :             }
   13705              :             else
   13706              :                 throw std::runtime_error("blueprint \"" + blueprint.prefix_ + "\" already exists in router");
   13707              :         }
   13708              : 
   13709              :         void get_recursive_child_methods(Blueprint* blueprint, std::vector<HTTPMethod>& methods)
   13710              :         {
   13711              :             //we only need to deal with children if the blueprint has absolutely no methods (meaning its index won't be added to the trie)
   13712              :             if (blueprint->static_dir_.empty() && blueprint->all_rules_.empty())
   13713              :             {
   13714              :                 for (Blueprint* bp : blueprint->blueprints_)
   13715              :                 {
   13716              :                     get_recursive_child_methods(bp, methods);
   13717              :                 }
   13718              :             }
   13719              :             else if (!blueprint->static_dir_.empty())
   13720              :                 methods.emplace_back(HTTPMethod::Get);
   13721              :             for (auto& rule : blueprint->all_rules_)
   13722              :             {
   13723              :                 rule->foreach_method([&methods](unsigned method) {
   13724              :                     HTTPMethod method_final = static_cast<HTTPMethod>(method);
   13725              :                     if (std::find(methods.begin(), methods.end(), method_final) == methods.end())
   13726              :                         methods.emplace_back(method_final);
   13727              :                 });
   13728              :             }
   13729              :         }
   13730              : 
   13731              :         void validate_bp()
   13732              :         {
   13733              :             //Take all the routes from the registered blueprints and add them to `all_rules_` to be processed.
   13734              :             detail::middleware_indices blueprint_mw;
   13735              :             validate_bp(blueprints_, blueprint_mw);
   13736              :         }
   13737              : 
   13738              :         void validate_bp(std::vector<Blueprint*> blueprints, detail::middleware_indices& current_mw)
   13739              :         {
   13740              :             for (unsigned i = 0; i < blueprints.size(); i++)
   13741              :             {
   13742              :                 Blueprint* blueprint = blueprints[i];
   13743              : 
   13744              :                 if (blueprint->is_added()) continue;
   13745              : 
   13746              :                 if (blueprint->static_dir_ == "" && blueprint->all_rules_.empty())
   13747              :                 {
   13748              :                     std::vector<HTTPMethod> methods;
   13749              :                     get_recursive_child_methods(blueprint, methods);
   13750              :                     for (HTTPMethod x : methods)
   13751              :                     {
   13752              :                         int method_index = static_cast<int>(x);
   13753              :                         per_methods_[method_index].trie.add(blueprint->prefix(), 0, blueprint->prefix().length(), method_index);
   13754              :                     }
   13755              :                 }
   13756              : 
   13757              :                 current_mw.merge_back(blueprint->mw_indices_);
   13758              :                 for (auto& rule : blueprint->all_rules_)
   13759              :                 {
   13760              :                     if (rule && !rule->is_added())
   13761              :                     {
   13762              :                         auto upgraded = rule->upgrade();
   13763              :                         if (upgraded)
   13764              :                             rule = std::move(upgraded);
   13765              :                         rule->validate();
   13766              :                         rule->mw_indices_.merge_front(current_mw);
   13767              :                         internal_add_rule_object(rule->rule(), rule.get(), i, blueprints);
   13768              :                     }
   13769              :                 }
   13770              :                 validate_bp(blueprint->blueprints_, current_mw);
   13771              :                 current_mw.pop_back(blueprint->mw_indices_);
   13772              :                 blueprint->set_added();
   13773              :             }
   13774              :         }
   13775              : 
   13776              :         void validate()
   13777              :         {
   13778              :             for (auto& rule : all_rules_)
   13779              :             {
   13780              :                 if (rule && !rule->is_added())
   13781              :                 {
   13782              :                     auto upgraded = rule->upgrade();
   13783              :                     if (upgraded)
   13784              :                         rule = std::move(upgraded);
   13785              :                     rule->validate();
   13786              :                     internal_add_rule_object(rule->rule(), rule.get());
   13787              :                 }
   13788              :             }
   13789              :             for (auto& per_method : per_methods_)
   13790              :             {
   13791              :                 per_method.trie.validate();
   13792              :             }
   13793              :         }
   13794              : 
   13795              :         // TODO maybe add actual_method
   13796              :         template<typename Adaptor>
   13797              :         void handle_upgrade(const request& req, response& res, Adaptor&& adaptor)
   13798              :         {
   13799              :             if (req.method >= HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount)
   13800              :                 return;
   13801              : 
   13802              :             auto& per_method = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(req.method)];
   13803              :             auto& rules = per_method.rules;
   13804              :             unsigned rule_index = per_method.trie.find(req.url).rule_index;
   13805              : 
   13806              :             if (!rule_index)
   13807              :             {
   13808              :                 for (auto& method : per_methods_)
   13809              :                 {
   13810              :                     if (method.trie.find(req.url).rule_index)
   13811              :                     {
   13812              :                         CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match method " << req.url << " " << method_name(req.method);
   13813              :                         res = response(405);
   13814              :                         res.end();
   13815              :                         return;
   13816              :                     }
   13817              :                 }
   13818              : 
   13819              :                 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Cannot match rules " << req.url;
   13820              :                 res = response(404);
   13821              :                 res.end();
   13822              :                 return;
   13823              :             }
   13824              : 
   13825              :             if (rule_index >= rules.size())
   13826              :                 throw std::runtime_error("Trie internal structure corrupted!");
   13827              : 
   13828              :             if (rule_index == RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH)
   13829              :             {
   13830              :                 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Redirecting to a url with trailing slash: " << req.url;
   13831              :                 res = response(301);
   13832              :                 res.add_header("Location", req.url + "/");
   13833              :                 res.end();
   13834              :                 return;
   13835              :             }
   13836              : 
   13837              :             CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Matched rule (upgrade) '" << rules[rule_index]->rule_ << "' "
   13838              :                            << static_cast<uint32_t>(req.method) << " / "
   13839              :                            << rules[rule_index]->get_methods();
   13840              : 
   13841              :             try
   13842              :             {
   13843              :                 rules[rule_index]->handle_upgrade(req, res, std::move(adaptor));
   13844              :             }
   13845              :             catch (...)
   13846              :             {
   13847              :                 exception_handler_(res);
   13848              :                 res.end();
   13849              :                 return;
   13850              :             }
   13851              :         }
   13852              : 
   13853              :         void get_found_bp(const std::vector<uint16_t>& bp_i, const std::vector<Blueprint*>& blueprints, std::vector<Blueprint*>& found_bps, uint16_t index = 0)
   13854              :         {
   13855              :             // This statement makes 3 assertions:
   13856              :             // 1. The index is above 0.
   13857              :             // 2. The index does not lie outside the given blueprint list.
   13858              :             // 3. The next blueprint we're adding has a prefix that starts the same as the already added blueprint + a slash (the rest is irrelevant).
   13859              :             //
   13860              :             // This is done to prevent a blueprint that has a prefix of "bp_prefix2" to be assumed as a child of one that has "bp_prefix".
   13861              :             //
   13862              :             // If any of the assertions is untrue, we delete the last item added, and continue using the blueprint list of the blueprint found before, the topmost being the router's list
   13863              :             auto verify_prefix = [&bp_i, &index, &blueprints, &found_bps]() {
   13864              :                 return index > 0 &&
   13865              :                        bp_i[index] < blueprints.size() &&
   13866              :                        blueprints[bp_i[index]]->prefix().substr(0, found_bps[index - 1]->prefix().length() + 1).compare(std::string(found_bps[index - 1]->prefix() + '/')) == 0;
   13867              :             };
   13868              :             if (index < bp_i.size())
   13869              :             {
   13870              : 
   13871              :                 if (verify_prefix())
   13872              :                 {
   13873              :                     found_bps.push_back(blueprints[bp_i[index]]);
   13874              :                     get_found_bp(bp_i, found_bps.back()->blueprints_, found_bps, ++index);
   13875              :                 }
   13876              :                 else
   13877              :                 {
   13878              :                     if (found_bps.size() < 2)
   13879              :                     {
   13880              :                         found_bps.clear();
   13881              :                         found_bps.push_back(blueprints_[bp_i[index]]);
   13882              :                     }
   13883              :                     else
   13884              :                     {
   13885              :                         found_bps.pop_back();
   13886              :                         Blueprint* last_element = found_bps.back();
   13887              :                         found_bps.push_back(last_element->blueprints_[bp_i[index]]);
   13888              :                     }
   13889              :                     get_found_bp(bp_i, found_bps.back()->blueprints_, found_bps, ++index);
   13890              :                 }
   13891              :             }
   13892              :         }
   13893              : 
   13894              :         CatchallRule& get_catch_all(const routing_handle_result& found) {
   13895              :             std::vector<Blueprint*> bps_found;
   13896              :             get_found_bp(found.blueprint_indices, blueprints_, bps_found);
   13897              :             for (int i = bps_found.size() - 1; i > 0; i--)
   13898              :             {
   13899              :                 std::vector<uint16_t> bpi = found.blueprint_indices;
   13900              :                 if (bps_found[i]->catchall_rule().has_handler()) {
   13901              :                     return bps_found[i]->catchall_rule();
   13902              :                 }
   13903              :             }
   13904              :             return catchall_rule_;
   13905              :         }
   13906              : 
   13907              :         std::string get_error(const routing_handle_result& found)
   13908              :         {
   13909              :             const std::string EMPTY;
   13910              : 
   13911              :             std::vector<Blueprint*> bps_found;
   13912              :             get_found_bp(found.blueprint_indices, blueprints_, bps_found);
   13913              :             for (int i = bps_found.size() - 1; i > 0; i--)
   13914              :             {
   13915              :                 std::vector<uint16_t> bpi = found.blueprint_indices;
   13916              :                 if (bps_found[i]->catchall_rule().has_handler())
   13917              :                 {
   13918              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   13919              :                     return std::string("Redirected to Blueprint \"" + bps_found[i]->prefix() + "\" Catchall rule");
   13920              : #else
   13921              :                     return EMPTY;
   13922              : #endif
   13923              :                 }
   13924              :             }
   13925              :             if (catchall_rule_.has_handler())
   13926              :             {
   13927              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
   13928              :                 return std::string("Redirected to global Catchall rule");
   13929              : #else
   13930              :                 return EMPTY;
   13931              : #endif
   13932              :             }
   13933              :             return EMPTY;
   13934              :         }
   13935              : 
   13936              :         std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> handle_initial(request& req, response& res)
   13937              :         {
   13938              :             HTTPMethod method_actual = req.method;
   13939              : 
   13940              :             std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> found{
   13941              :               new routing_handle_result(
   13942              :                 0,
   13943              :                 std::vector<uint16_t>(),
   13944              :                 routing_params(),
   13945              :                 HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount)}; // This is always returned to avoid a null pointer dereference.
   13946              : 
   13947              :             // NOTE(EDev): This most likely will never run since the parser should handle this situation and close the connection before it gets here.
   13948              :             if (CROW_UNLIKELY(req.method >= HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount))
   13949              :                 return found;
   13950              :             else if (req.method == HTTPMethod::Head)
   13951              :             {
   13952              :                 *found = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].trie.find(req.url);
   13953              :                 // support HEAD requests using GET if not defined as method for the requested URL
   13954              :                 if (!found->rule_index)
   13955              :                 {
   13956              :                     method_actual = HTTPMethod::Get;
   13957              :                     *found = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].trie.find(req.url);
   13958              :                     if (!found->rule_index) // If a route is still not found, return a 404 without executing the rest of the HEAD specific code.
   13959              :                     {
   13960              :                         CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match rules " << req.url;
   13961              :                         res = response(404); //TODO(EDev): Should this redirect to catchall?
   13962              :                         res.end();
   13963              :                         return found;
   13964              :                     }
   13965              :                 }
   13966              : 
   13967              :                 res.skip_body = true;
   13968              :                 found->method = method_actual;
   13969              :                 return found;
   13970              :             }
   13971              :             else if (req.method == HTTPMethod::Options)
   13972              :             {
   13973              :                 std::string allow = "OPTIONS, HEAD";
   13974              : 
   13975              :                 if (req.url == "/*")
   13976              :                 {
   13977              :                     for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); i++)
   13978              :                     {
   13979              :                         if (static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::Head) == i)
   13980              :                             continue; // HEAD is always allowed
   13981              : 
   13982              :                         if (!per_methods_[i].trie.is_empty())
   13983              :                         {
   13984              :                             allow.append(", ");
   13985              :                             allow.append(method_name(static_cast<HTTPMethod>(i)));
   13986              :                         }
   13987              :                     }
   13988              : #ifdef CROW_RETURNS_OK_ON_HTTP_OPTIONS_REQUEST
   13989              :                     res = response(crow::status::OK);
   13990              : #else
   13991              :                     res = response(crow::status::NO_CONTENT);
   13992              : #endif
   13993              : 
   13994              :                     res.set_header("Allow", allow);
   13995              :                     res.end();
   13996              :                     found->method = method_actual;
   13997              :                     return found;
   13998              :                 }
   13999              :                 else
   14000              :                 {
   14001              :                     bool rules_matched = false;
   14002              :                     for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); i++)
   14003              :                     {
   14004              :                         if (per_methods_[i].trie.find(req.url).rule_index)
   14005              :                         {
   14006              :                             rules_matched = true;
   14007              : 
   14008              :                             if (static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::Head) == i)
   14009              :                                 continue; // HEAD is always allowed
   14010              : 
   14011              :                             allow.append(", ");
   14012              :                             allow.append(method_name(static_cast<HTTPMethod>(i)));
   14013              :                         }
   14014              :                     }
   14015              :                     if (rules_matched)
   14016              :                     {
   14017              : #ifdef CROW_RETURNS_OK_ON_HTTP_OPTIONS_REQUEST
   14018              :                         res = response(crow::status::OK);
   14019              : #else
   14020              :                         res = response(crow::status::NO_CONTENT);
   14021              : #endif
   14022              :                         res.set_header("Allow", allow);
   14023              :                         res.end();
   14024              :                         found->method = method_actual;
   14025              :                         return found;
   14026              :                     }
   14027              :                     else
   14028              :                     {
   14029              :                         CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match rules " << req.url;
   14030              :                         res = response(404); //TODO(EDev): Should this redirect to catchall?
   14031              :                         res.end();
   14032              :                         return found;
   14033              :                     }
   14034              :                 }
   14035              :             }
   14036              :             else // Every request that isn't a HEAD or OPTIONS request
   14037              :             {
   14038              :                 *found = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].trie.find(req.url);
   14039              :                 // TODO(EDev): maybe ending the else here would allow the requests coming from above (after removing the return statement) to be checked on whether they actually point to a route
   14040              :                 if (!found->rule_index)
   14041              :                 {
   14042              :                     for (auto& per_method : per_methods_)
   14043              :                     {
   14044              :                         if (per_method.trie.find(req.url).rule_index) //Route found, but in another method
   14045              :                         {
   14046              :                             res.code = 405;
   14047              :                             found->catch_all = true;
   14048              :                             CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match method " << req.url << " "
   14049              :                                            << method_name(method_actual) << ". " << get_error(*found);
   14050              :                             return found;
   14051              :                         }
   14052              :                     }
   14053              :                     //Route does not exist anywhere
   14054              : 
   14055              :                     res.code = 404;
   14056              :                     found->catch_all = true;
   14057              :                     CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match rules " << req.url << ". " << get_error(*found);
   14058              :                     return found;
   14059              :                 }
   14060              : 
   14061              :                 found->method = method_actual;
   14062              :                 return found;
   14063              :             }
   14064              :         }
   14065              : 
   14066              :         template<typename App>
   14067              :         void handle(request& req, response& res, routing_handle_result found)
   14068              :         {
   14069              :             if (found.catch_all) {
   14070              :                 auto catch_all = get_catch_all(found);
   14071              :                 if (catch_all.has_handler()) {
   14072              :                     try
   14073              :                     {
   14074              :                         catch_all.handler_(req, res);
   14075              :                     }
   14076              :                     catch (...)
   14077              :                     {
   14078              :                         exception_handler_(res);
   14079              :                     }
   14080              :                 }
   14081              :                 res.end();
   14082              :             } else {
   14083              :                 HTTPMethod method_actual = found.method;
   14084              :                 const auto& rules = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].rules;
   14085              :                 const unsigned rule_index = found.rule_index;
   14086              : 
   14087              :                 if (rule_index >= rules.size())
   14088              :                     throw std::runtime_error("Trie internal structure corrupted!");
   14089              :                 if (rule_index == RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH) {
   14090              :                     CROW_LOG_INFO << "Redirecting to a url with trailing slash: " << req.url;
   14091              :                     res = response(301);
   14092              :                     res.add_header("Location", req.url + "/");
   14093              :                     res.end();
   14094              :                 } else {
   14095              :                     CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Matched rule '" << rules[rule_index]->rule_ << "' " << static_cast<uint32_t>(req.
   14096              :                                       method) << " / " << rules[rule_index]->get_methods();
   14097              : 
   14098              :                     try {
   14099              :                         BaseRule &rule = *rules[rule_index];
   14100              :                         handle_rule<App>(rule, req, res, found.r_params);
   14101              :                     } catch (...) {
   14102              :                         exception_handler_(res);
   14103              :                         res.end();
   14104              :                     }
   14105              :                 }
   14106              :             }
   14107              :         }
   14108              : 
   14109              :         template<typename App>
   14110              :         typename std::enable_if<std::tuple_size<typename App::mw_container_t>::value != 0, void>::type
   14111              :           handle_rule(BaseRule& rule, crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const crow::routing_params& rp)
   14112              :         {
   14113              :             if (!rule.mw_indices_.empty())
   14114              :             {
   14115              :                 auto& ctx = *reinterpret_cast<typename App::context_t*>(req.middleware_context);
   14116              :                 auto& container = *reinterpret_cast<typename App::mw_container_t*>(req.middleware_container);
   14117              :                 detail::middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<false> crit_fwd(rule.mw_indices_.indices());
   14118              : 
   14119              :                 auto glob_completion_handler = std::move(res.complete_request_handler_);
   14120              :                 res.complete_request_handler_ = [] {};
   14121              : 
   14122              :                 detail::middleware_call_helper<decltype(crit_fwd),
   14123              :                                                0, typename App::context_t, typename App::mw_container_t>(crit_fwd, container, req, res, ctx);
   14124              : 
   14125              :                 if (res.completed_)
   14126              :                 {
   14127              :                     glob_completion_handler();
   14128              :                     return;
   14129              :                 }
   14130              : 
   14131              :                 res.complete_request_handler_ = [&rule, &ctx, &container, &req, &res, glob_completion_handler] {
   14132              :                     detail::middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<true> crit_bwd(rule.mw_indices_.indices());
   14133              : 
   14134              :                     detail::after_handlers_call_helper<
   14135              :                       decltype(crit_bwd),
   14136              :                       std::tuple_size<typename App::mw_container_t>::value - 1,
   14137              :                       typename App::context_t,
   14138              :                       typename App::mw_container_t>(crit_bwd, container, ctx, req, res);
   14139              :                     glob_completion_handler();
   14140              :                 };
   14141              :             }
   14142              :             rule.handle(req, res, rp);
   14143              :         }
   14144              : 
   14145              :         template<typename App>
   14146              :         typename std::enable_if<std::tuple_size<typename App::mw_container_t>::value == 0, void>::type
   14147              :           handle_rule(BaseRule& rule, crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const crow::routing_params& rp)
   14148              :         {
   14149              :             rule.handle(req, res, rp);
   14150              :         }
   14151              : 
   14152              :         void debug_print()
   14153              :         {
   14154              :             for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); i++)
   14155              :             {
   14156              :                 Trie& trie_ = per_methods_[i].trie;
   14157              :                 if (!trie_.is_empty())
   14158              :                 {
   14159              :                     CROW_LOG_DEBUG << method_name(static_cast<HTTPMethod>(i));
   14160              :                     trie_.debug_print();
   14161              :                 }
   14162              :             }
   14163              :         }
   14164              : 
   14165              :         std::vector<Blueprint*>& blueprints()
   14166              :         {
   14167              :             return blueprints_;
   14168              :         }
   14169              : 
   14170              :         std::function<void(crow::response&)>& exception_handler()
   14171              :         {
   14172              :             return exception_handler_;
   14173              :         }
   14174              : 
   14175              :         static void default_exception_handler(response& res)
   14176              :         {
   14177              :             // any uncaught exceptions become 500s
   14178              :             res = response(500);
   14179              : 
   14180              :             try
   14181              :             {
   14182              :                 throw;
   14183              :             }
   14184              :             catch (const bad_request& e)
   14185              :             {
   14186              :                 res = response (400);
   14187              :                 res.body = e.what();
   14188              :             }
   14189              :             catch (const std::exception& e)
   14190              :             {
   14191              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "An uncaught exception occurred: " << e.what();
   14192              :             }
   14193              :             catch (...)
   14194              :             {
   14195              :                 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "An uncaught exception occurred. The type was unknown so no information was available.";
   14196              :             }
   14197              :         }
   14198              : 
   14199              :     private:
   14200              :         CatchallRule catchall_rule_;
   14201              : 
   14202              :         struct PerMethod
   14203              :         {
   14204              :             std::vector<BaseRule*> rules;
   14205              :             Trie trie;
   14206              : 
   14207              :             // rule index 0, 1 has special meaning; preallocate it to avoid duplication.
   14208              :             PerMethod():
   14209              :               rules(2) {}
   14210              :         };
   14211              :         std::array<PerMethod, static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount)> per_methods_;
   14212              :         std::vector<std::unique_ptr<BaseRule>> all_rules_;
   14213              :         std::vector<Blueprint*> blueprints_;
   14214              :         std::function<void(crow::response&)> exception_handler_ = &default_exception_handler;
   14215              :     };
   14216              : } // namespace crow
   14217              : 
   14218              : 
   14219              : namespace crow
   14220              : {
   14221              :     struct CORSHandler;
   14222              : 
   14223              :     /// Used for tuning CORS policies
   14224              :     struct CORSRules
   14225              :     {
   14226              :         friend struct crow::CORSHandler;
   14227              : 
   14228              :         /// Set Access-Control-Allow-Origin. Default is "*"
   14229              :         CORSRules& origin(const std::string& origin)
   14230              :         {
   14231              :             origin_ = origin;
   14232              :             return *this;
   14233              :         }
   14234              : 
   14235              :         /// Set Access-Control-Allow-Methods. Default is "*"
   14236              :         CORSRules& methods(crow::HTTPMethod method)
   14237              :         {
   14238              :             add_list_item(methods_, crow::method_name(method));
   14239              :             return *this;
   14240              :         }
   14241              : 
   14242              :         /// Set Access-Control-Allow-Methods. Default is "*"
   14243              :         template<typename... Methods>
   14244              :         CORSRules& methods(crow::HTTPMethod method, Methods... method_list)
   14245              :         {
   14246              :             add_list_item(methods_, crow::method_name(method));
   14247              :             methods(method_list...);
   14248              :             return *this;
   14249              :         }
   14250              : 
   14251              :         /// Set Access-Control-Allow-Headers. Default is "*"
   14252              :         CORSRules& headers(const std::string& header)
   14253              :         {
   14254              :             add_list_item(headers_, header);
   14255              :             return *this;
   14256              :         }
   14257              : 
   14258              :         /// Set Access-Control-Allow-Headers. Default is "*"
   14259              :         template<typename... Headers>
   14260              :         CORSRules& headers(const std::string& header, Headers... header_list)
   14261              :         {
   14262              :             add_list_item(headers_, header);
   14263              :             headers(header_list...);
   14264              :             return *this;
   14265              :         }
   14266              : 
   14267              :         /// Set Access-Control-Expose-Headers. Default is none
   14268              :         CORSRules& expose(const std::string& header)
   14269              :         {
   14270              :             add_list_item(exposed_headers_, header);
   14271              :             return *this;
   14272              :         }
   14273              : 
   14274              :         /// Set Access-Control-Expose-Headers. Default is none
   14275              :         template<typename... Headers>
   14276              :         CORSRules& expose(const std::string& header, Headers... header_list)
   14277              :         {
   14278              :             add_list_item(exposed_headers_, header);
   14279              :             expose(header_list...);
   14280              :             return *this;
   14281              :         }
   14282              : 
   14283              :         /// Set Access-Control-Max-Age. Default is none
   14284              :         CORSRules& max_age(int max_age)
   14285              :         {
   14286              :             max_age_ = std::to_string(max_age);
   14287              :             return *this;
   14288              :         }
   14289              : 
   14290              :         /// Enable Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
   14291              :         CORSRules& allow_credentials()
   14292              :         {
   14293              :             allow_credentials_ = true;
   14294              :             return *this;
   14295              :         }
   14296              : 
   14297              :         /// Ignore CORS and don't send any headers
   14298              :         void ignore()
   14299              :         {
   14300              :             ignore_ = true;
   14301              :         }
   14302              : 
   14303              :         /// Handle CORS on specific prefix path
   14304              :         CORSRules& prefix(const std::string& prefix);
   14305              : 
   14306              :         /// Handle CORS for specific blueprint
   14307              :         CORSRules& blueprint(const Blueprint& bp);
   14308              : 
   14309              :         /// Global CORS policy
   14310              :         CORSRules& global();
   14311              : 
   14312              :     private:
   14313              :         CORSRules() = delete;
   14314              :         CORSRules(CORSHandler* handler):
   14315              :           handler_(handler) {}
   14316              : 
   14317              :         /// build comma separated list
   14318              :         void add_list_item(std::string& list, const std::string& val)
   14319              :         {
   14320              :             if (list == "*") list = "";
   14321              :             if (list.size() > 0) list += ", ";
   14322              :             list += val;
   14323              :         }
   14324              : 
   14325              :         /// Set header `key` to `value` if it is not set
   14326              :         void set_header_no_override(const std::string& key, const std::string& value, crow::response& res)
   14327              :         {
   14328              :             if (value.size() == 0) return;
   14329              :             if (!get_header_value(res.headers, key).empty()) return;
   14330              :             res.add_header(key, value);
   14331              :         }
   14332              : 
   14333              :         /// Set response headers
   14334              :         void apply(const request& req, response& res)
   14335              :         {
   14336              :             if (ignore_) return;
   14337              : 
   14338              :             set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Methods", methods_, res);
   14339              :             set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Headers", headers_, res);
   14340              :             set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Expose-Headers", exposed_headers_, res);
   14341              :             set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Max-Age", max_age_, res);
   14342              : 
   14343              :             bool origin_set = false;
   14344              : 
   14345              :             if (req.method != HTTPMethod::Options)
   14346              :             {
   14347              :                 if (allow_credentials_)
   14348              :                 {
   14349              :                     set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Credentials", "true", res);
   14350              :                     if (origin_ == "*")
   14351              :                     {
   14352              :                         set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", req.get_header_value("Origin"), res);
   14353              :                         origin_set = true;
   14354              :                     }
   14355              :                 }
   14356              :             }
   14357              : 
   14358              :             if( !origin_set){
   14359              :                 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", origin_, res);
   14360              :             }
   14361              :         }
   14362              : 
   14363              :         bool ignore_ = false;
   14364              :         // TODO: support multiple origins that are dynamically selected
   14365              :         std::string origin_ = "*";
   14366              :         std::string methods_ = "*";
   14367              :         std::string headers_ = "*";
   14368              :         std::string exposed_headers_;
   14369              :         std::string max_age_;
   14370              :         bool allow_credentials_ = false;
   14371              : 
   14372              :         CORSHandler* handler_;
   14373              :     };
   14374              : 
   14375              :     /// CORSHandler is a global middleware for setting CORS headers.
   14376              : 
   14377              :     ///
   14378              :     /// By default, it sets Access-Control-Allow-Origin/Methods/Headers to "*".
   14379              :     /// The default behaviour can be changed with the `global()` cors rule.
   14380              :     /// Additional rules for prexies can be added with `prefix()`.
   14381              :     struct CORSHandler
   14382              :     {
   14383              :         struct context
   14384              :         {};
   14385              : 
   14386              :         void before_handle(crow::request& /*req*/, crow::response& /*res*/, context& /*ctx*/)
   14387              :         {}
   14388              : 
   14389              :         void after_handle(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, context& /*ctx*/)
   14390              :         {
   14391              :             auto& rule = find_rule(req.url);
   14392              :             rule.apply(req, res);
   14393              :         }
   14394              : 
   14395              :         /// Handle CORS on a specific prefix path
   14396              :         CORSRules& prefix(const std::string& prefix)
   14397              :         {
   14398              :             rules.emplace_back(prefix, CORSRules(this));
   14399              :             return rules.back().second;
   14400              :         }
   14401              : 
   14402              :         /// Handle CORS for a specific blueprint
   14403              :         CORSRules& blueprint(const Blueprint& bp)
   14404              :         {
   14405              :             rules.emplace_back(bp.prefix(), CORSRules(this));
   14406              :             return rules.back().second;
   14407              :         }
   14408              : 
   14409              :         /// Get the global CORS policy
   14410              :         CORSRules& global()
   14411              :         {
   14412              :             return default_;
   14413              :         }
   14414              : 
   14415              :     private:
   14416              :         CORSRules& find_rule(const std::string& path)
   14417              :         {
   14418              :             // TODO: use a trie in case of many rules
   14419              :             for (auto& rule : rules)
   14420              :             {
   14421              :                 // Check if path starts with a rules prefix
   14422              :                 if (path.rfind(rule.first, 0) == 0)
   14423              :                 {
   14424              :                     return rule.second;
   14425              :                 }
   14426              :             }
   14427              :             return default_;
   14428              :         }
   14429              : 
   14430              :         std::vector<std::pair<std::string, CORSRules>> rules;
   14431              :         CORSRules default_ = CORSRules(this);
   14432              :     };
   14433              : 
   14434              :     inline CORSRules& CORSRules::prefix(const std::string& prefix)
   14435              :     {
   14436              :         return handler_->prefix(prefix);
   14437              :     }
   14438              : 
   14439              :     inline CORSRules& CORSRules::blueprint(const Blueprint& bp)
   14440              :     {
   14441              :         return handler_->blueprint(bp);
   14442              :     }
   14443              : 
   14444              :     inline CORSRules& CORSRules::global()
   14445              :     {
   14446              :         return handler_->global();
   14447              :     }
   14448              : 
   14449              : } // namespace crow
   14450              : 
   14451              : /**
   14452              :  * \file crow/app.h
   14453              :  * \brief This file includes the definition of the crow::Crow class,
   14454              :  * the crow::App and crow::SimpleApp aliases, and some macros.
   14455              :  *
   14456              :  * In this file are defined:
   14457              :  * - crow::Crow
   14458              :  * - crow::App
   14459              :  * - crow::SimpleApp
   14460              :  * - \ref CROW_ROUTE
   14461              :  * - \ref CROW_BP_ROUTE
   14462              :  * - \ref CROW_WEBSOCKET_ROUTE
   14463              :  * - \ref CROW_MIDDLEWARES
   14464              :  * - \ref CROW_CATCHALL_ROUTE
   14465              :  * - \ref CROW_BP_CATCHALL_ROUTE
   14466              :  */
   14467              : 
   14468              : 
   14469              : #include <chrono>
   14470              : #include <string>
   14471              : #include <functional>
   14472              : #include <memory>
   14473              : #include <future>
   14474              : #include <cstdint>
   14475              : #include <type_traits>
   14476              : #include <thread>
   14477              : #include <condition_variable>
   14478              : 
   14479              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
   14480              : #endif // #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
   14481              : 
   14482              : 
   14483              : #ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
   14484              : 
   14485              : #define CROW_ROUTE(app, url) app.route_dynamic(url) // See the documentation in the comment below.
   14486              : #define CROW_BP_ROUTE(blueprint, url) blueprint.new_rule_dynamic(url) // See the documentation in the comment below.
   14487              : 
   14488              : #else // #ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
   14489              : 
   14490              : /**
   14491              :  * \def CROW_ROUTE(app, url)
   14492              :  * \brief Creates a route for app using a rule.
   14493              :  *
   14494              :  * It use crow::Crow::route_dynamic or crow::Crow::route to define
   14495              :  * a rule for your application. It's usage is like this:
   14496              :  *
   14497              :  * ```cpp
   14498              :  * auto app = crow::SimpleApp(); // or crow::App()
   14499              :  * CROW_ROUTE(app, "/")
   14500              :  * ([](){
   14501              :  *     return "<h1>Hello, world!</h1>";
   14502              :  * });
   14503              :  * ```
   14504              :  *
   14505              :  * This is the recommended way to define routes in a crow application.
   14506              :  * \see [Page of guide "Routes"](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/routes/).
   14507              :  */
   14508              : #define CROW_ROUTE(app, url) app.template route<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(url)>(url)
   14509              : 
   14510              : /**
   14511              :  * \def CROW_BP_ROUTE(blueprint, url)
   14512              :  * \brief Creates a route for a blueprint using a rule.
   14513              :  *
   14514              :  * It may use crow::Blueprint::new_rule_dynamic or
   14515              :  * crow::Blueprint::new_rule_tagged to define a new rule for
   14516              :  * an given blueprint. It's usage is similar
   14517              :  * to CROW_ROUTE macro:
   14518              :  *
   14519              :  * ```cpp
   14520              :  * crow::Blueprint my_bp();
   14521              :  * CROW_BP_ROUTE(my_bp, "/")
   14522              :  * ([](){
   14523              :  *     return "<h1>Hello, world!</h1>";
   14524              :  * });
   14525              :  * ```
   14526              :  *
   14527              :  * This is the recommended way to define routes in a crow blueprint
   14528              :  * because of its compile-time capabilities.
   14529              :  *
   14530              :  * \see [Page of the guide "Blueprints"](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/blueprints/).
   14531              :  */
   14532              : #define CROW_BP_ROUTE(blueprint, url) blueprint.new_rule_tagged<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(url)>(url)
   14533              : 
   14534              : /**
   14535              :  * \def CROW_WEBSOCKET_ROUTE(app, url)
   14536              :  * \brief Defines WebSocket route for app.
   14537              :  *
   14538              :  * It binds a WebSocket route to app. Easy solution to implement
   14539              :  * WebSockets in your app. The usage syntax of this macro is
   14540              :  * like this:
   14541              :  *
   14542              :  * ```cpp
   14543              :  * auto app = crow::SimpleApp(); // or crow::App()
   14544              :  * CROW_WEBSOCKET_ROUTE(app, "/ws")
   14545              :  *     .onopen([&](crow::websocket::connection& conn){
   14546              :  *                do_something();
   14547              :  *            })
   14548              :  *     .onclose([&](crow::websocket::connection& conn, const std::string& reason, uint16_t){
   14549              :  *                 do_something();
   14550              :  *             })
   14551              :  *     .onmessage([&](crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string& data, bool is_binary){
   14552              :  *                   if (is_binary)
   14553              :  *                       do_something(data);
   14554              :  *                   else
   14555              :  *                       do_something_else(data);
   14556              :  *               });
   14557              :  * ```
   14558              :  *
   14559              :  * \see [Page of the guide "WebSockets"](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/websockets/).
   14560              :  */
   14561              : #define CROW_WEBSOCKET_ROUTE(app, url) app.route<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(url)>(url).websocket<std::remove_reference<decltype(app)>::type>(&app)
   14562              : 
   14563              : /**
   14564              :  * \def CROW_MIDDLEWARES(app, ...)
   14565              :  * \brief Enable a Middleware for an specific route in app
   14566              :  * or blueprint.
   14567              :  *
   14568              :  * It defines the usage of a Middleware in one route. And it
   14569              :  * can be used in both crow::SimpleApp (and crow::App) instances and
   14570              :  * crow::Blueprint. Its usage syntax is like this:
   14571              :  *
   14572              :  * ```cpp
   14573              :  * auto app = crow::SimpleApp(); // or crow::App()
   14574              :  * CROW_ROUTE(app, "/with_middleware")
   14575              :  * .CROW_MIDDLEWARES(app, LocalMiddleware) // Can be used more than one
   14576              :  * ([]() {                                 // middleware.
   14577              :  *     return "Hello world!";
   14578              :  * });
   14579              :  * ```
   14580              :  *
   14581              :  * \see [Page of the guide "Middlewares"](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/middleware/).
   14582              :  */
   14583              : #define CROW_MIDDLEWARES(app, ...) template middlewares<typename std::remove_reference<decltype(app)>::type, __VA_ARGS__>()
   14584              : 
   14585              : #endif // #ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
   14586              : 
   14587              : /**
   14588              :  * \def CROW_CATCHALL_ROUTE(app)
   14589              :  * \brief Defines a custom catchall route for app using a
   14590              :  * custom rule.
   14591              :  *
   14592              :  * It defines a handler when the client make a request for an
   14593              :  * undefined route. Instead of just reply with a `404` status
   14594              :  * code (default behavior), you can define a custom handler
   14595              :  * using this macro.
   14596              :  *
   14597              :  * \see [Page of the guide "Routes" (Catchall routes)](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/routes/#catchall-routes).
   14598              :  */
   14599              : #define CROW_CATCHALL_ROUTE(app) app.catchall_route()
   14600              : 
   14601              : /**
   14602              :  * \def CROW_BP_CATCHALL_ROUTE(blueprint)
   14603              :  * \brief Defines a custom catchall route for blueprint
   14604              :  * using a custom rule.
   14605              :  *
   14606              :  * It defines a handler when the client make a request for an
   14607              :  * undefined route in the blueprint.
   14608              :  *
   14609              :  * \see [Page of the guide "Blueprint" (Define a custom Catchall route)](https://crowcpp.org/master/guides/blueprints/#define-a-custom-catchall-route).
   14610              :  */
   14611              : #define CROW_BP_CATCHALL_ROUTE(blueprint) blueprint.catchall_rule()
   14612              : 
   14613              : 
   14614              : /**
   14615              :  * \namespace crow
   14616              :  * \brief The main namespace of the library. In this namespace
   14617              :  * is defined the most important classes and functions of the
   14618              :  * library.
   14619              :  *
   14620              :  * Within this namespace, the Crow class, Router class, Connection
   14621              :  * class, and other are defined.
   14622              :  */
   14623              : namespace crow
   14624              : {
   14625              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   14626              :     using ssl_context_t = asio::ssl::context;
   14627              : #endif
   14628              :     /**
   14629              :      * \class Crow
   14630              :      * \brief The main server application class.
   14631              :      *
   14632              :      * Use crow::SimpleApp or crow::App<Middleware1, Middleware2, etc...> instead of
   14633              :      * directly instantiate this class.
   14634              :      */
   14635              :     template<typename... Middlewares>
   14636              :     class Crow
   14637              :     {
   14638              :     public:
   14639              :         /// \brief This is the crow application
   14640              :         using self_t = Crow;
   14641              : 
   14642              :         /// \brief The HTTP server
   14643              :         using server_t = Server<Crow, TCPAcceptor, SocketAdaptor, Middlewares...>;
   14644              :         /// \brief An HTTP server that runs on unix domain socket
   14645              :         using unix_server_t = Server<Crow, UnixSocketAcceptor, UnixSocketAdaptor, Middlewares...>;
   14646              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   14647              :         /// \brief An HTTP server that runs on SSL with an SSLAdaptor
   14648              :         using ssl_server_t = Server<Crow, TCPAcceptor, SSLAdaptor, Middlewares...>;
   14649              : #endif
   14650              :         Crow()
   14651              :         {}
   14652              : 
   14653              :         /// \brief Construct Crow with a subset of middleware
   14654              :         template<typename... Ts>
   14655              :         Crow(Ts&&... ts):
   14656              :           middlewares_(make_middleware_tuple(std::forward<Ts>(ts)...))
   14657              :         {}
   14658              : 
   14659              :         /// \brief Process an Upgrade request
   14660              :         ///
   14661              :         /// Currently used to upgrade an HTTP connection to a WebSocket connection
   14662              :         template<typename Adaptor>
   14663              :         void handle_upgrade(const request& req, response& res, Adaptor&& adaptor)
   14664              :         {
   14665              :             router_.handle_upgrade(req, res, adaptor);
   14666              :         }
   14667              : 
   14668              :         /// \brief Process only the method and URL of a request and provide a route (or an error response)
   14669              :         std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> handle_initial(request& req, response& res)
   14670              :         {
   14671              :             return router_.handle_initial(req, res);
   14672              :         }
   14673              : 
   14674              :         /// \brief Process the fully parsed request and generate a response for it
   14675              :         void handle(request& req, response& res, std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result>& found)
   14676              :         {
   14677              :             router_.handle<self_t>(req, res, *found);
   14678              :         }
   14679              : 
   14680              :         /// \brief Process a fully parsed request from start to finish (primarily used for debugging)
   14681              :         void handle_full(request& req, response& res)
   14682              :         {
   14683              :             auto found = handle_initial(req, res);
   14684              :             if (found->rule_index || found->catch_all)
   14685              :                 handle(req, res, found);
   14686              :         }
   14687              : 
   14688              :         /// \brief Create a dynamic route using a rule (**Use CROW_ROUTE instead**)
   14689              :         DynamicRule& route_dynamic(const std::string& rule)
   14690              :         {
   14691              :             return router_.new_rule_dynamic(rule);
   14692              :         }
   14693              : 
   14694              :         /// \brief Create a route using a rule (**Use CROW_ROUTE instead**)
   14695              :         template<uint64_t Tag>
   14696              :         auto route(const std::string& rule)
   14697              :           -> typename std::invoke_result<decltype(&Router::new_rule_tagged<Tag>), Router, const std::string&>::type
   14698              :         {
   14699              :             return router_.new_rule_tagged<Tag>(rule);
   14700              :         }
   14701              : 
   14702              :         /// \brief Create a route for any requests without a proper route (**Use CROW_CATCHALL_ROUTE instead**)
   14703              :         CatchallRule& catchall_route()
   14704              :         {
   14705              :             return router_.catchall_rule();
   14706              :         }
   14707              : 
   14708              :         /// \brief Set the default max payload size for websockets
   14709              :         self_t& websocket_max_payload(uint64_t max_payload)
   14710              :         {
   14711              :             max_payload_ = max_payload;
   14712              :             return *this;
   14713              :         }
   14714              : 
   14715              :         /// \brief Get the default max payload size for websockets
   14716              :         uint64_t websocket_max_payload()
   14717              :         {
   14718              :             return max_payload_;
   14719              :         }
   14720              : 
   14721              :         self_t& signal_clear()
   14722              :         {
   14723              :             signals_.clear();
   14724              :             return *this;
   14725              :         }
   14726              : 
   14727              :         self_t& signal_add(int signal_number)
   14728              :         {
   14729              :             signals_.push_back(signal_number);
   14730              :             return *this;
   14731              :         }
   14732              : 
   14733              :         std::vector<int> signals()
   14734              :         {
   14735              :             return signals_;
   14736              :         }
   14737              : 
   14738              :         /// \brief Set the port that Crow will handle requests on
   14739              :         self_t& port(std::uint16_t port)
   14740              :         {
   14741              :             port_ = port;
   14742              :             return *this;
   14743              :         }
   14744              : 
   14745              :         /// \brief Get the port that Crow will handle requests on
   14746              :         std::uint16_t port() const
   14747              :         {
   14748              :             if (!server_started_)
   14749              :             {
   14750              :                 return port_;
   14751              :             }
   14752              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   14753              :             if (ssl_used_)
   14754              :             {
   14755              :                 return ssl_server_->port();
   14756              :             }
   14757              :             else
   14758              : #endif
   14759              :             {
   14760              :                 return server_->port();
   14761              :             }
   14762              :         }
   14763              : 
   14764              :         /// \brief Set status variable to note that the address that Crow will handle requests on is bound
   14765              :         void address_is_bound() {
   14766              :            is_bound_ = true;
   14767              :         }
   14768              : 
   14769              :         /// \brief Get whether address that Crow will handle requests on is bound
   14770              :         bool is_bound() const {
   14771              :            return is_bound_;
   14772              :         }
   14773              : 
   14774              :         /// \brief Set the connection timeout in seconds (default is 5)
   14775              :         self_t& timeout(std::uint8_t timeout)
   14776              :         {
   14777              :             timeout_ = timeout;
   14778              :             return *this;
   14779              :         }
   14780              : 
   14781              :         /// \brief Set the server name included in the 'Server' HTTP response header. If set to an empty string, the header will be omitted by default.
   14782              :         self_t& server_name(std::string server_name)
   14783              :         {
   14784              :             server_name_ = server_name;
   14785              :             return *this;
   14786              :         }
   14787              : 
   14788              :         /// \brief The IP address that Crow will handle requests on (default is 0.0.0.0)
   14789              :         self_t& bindaddr(std::string bindaddr)
   14790              :         {
   14791              :             bindaddr_ = bindaddr;
   14792              :             return *this;
   14793              :         }
   14794              : 
   14795              :         /// \brief Get the address that Crow will handle requests on
   14796              :         std::string bindaddr()
   14797              :         {
   14798              :             return bindaddr_;
   14799              :         }
   14800              : 
   14801              :         /// \brief Disable tcp/ip and use unix domain socket instead
   14802              :         self_t& local_socket_path(std::string path)
   14803              :         {
   14804              :             bindaddr_ = path;
   14805              :             use_unix_ = true;
   14806              :             return *this;
   14807              :         }
   14808              : 
   14809              :         /// \brief Get the unix domain socket path
   14810              :         std::string local_socket_path()
   14811              :         {
   14812              :             return bindaddr_;
   14813              :         }
   14814              : 
   14815              :         /// \brief Run the server on multiple threads using all available threads
   14816              :         self_t& multithreaded()
   14817              :         {
   14818              :             return concurrency(std::thread::hardware_concurrency());
   14819              :         }
   14820              : 
   14821              :         /// \brief Run the server on multiple threads using a specific number
   14822              :         self_t& concurrency(unsigned int concurrency)
   14823              :         {
   14824              :             if (concurrency < 2) // Crow can have a minimum of 2 threads running
   14825              :                 concurrency = 2;
   14826              :             concurrency_ = concurrency;
   14827              :             return *this;
   14828              :         }
   14829              : 
   14830              :         /// \brief Get the number of threads that server is using
   14831              :         std::uint16_t concurrency() const
   14832              :         {
   14833              :             return concurrency_;
   14834              :         }
   14835              : 
   14836              :         /// \brief Set the server's log level
   14837              :         ///
   14838              :         /// Possible values are:
   14839              :         /// - crow::LogLevel::Debug       (0)
   14840              :         /// - crow::LogLevel::Info        (1)
   14841              :         /// - crow::LogLevel::Warning     (2)
   14842              :         /// - crow::LogLevel::Error       (3)
   14843              :         /// - crow::LogLevel::Critical    (4)
   14844              :         self_t& loglevel(LogLevel level)
   14845              :         {
   14846              :             crow::logger::setLogLevel(level);
   14847              :             return *this;
   14848              :         }
   14849              : 
   14850              :         /// \brief Set the response body size (in bytes) beyond which Crow automatically streams responses (Default is 1MiB)
   14851              :         ///
   14852              :         /// Any streamed response is unaffected by Crow's timer, and therefore won't timeout before a response is fully sent.
   14853              :         self_t& stream_threshold(size_t threshold)
   14854              :         {
   14855              :             res_stream_threshold_ = threshold;
   14856              :             return *this;
   14857              :         }
   14858              : 
   14859              :         /// \brief Get the response body size (in bytes) beyond which Crow automatically streams responses
   14860              :         size_t& stream_threshold()
   14861              :         {
   14862              :             return res_stream_threshold_;
   14863              :         }
   14864              : 
   14865              : 
   14866              :         self_t& register_blueprint(Blueprint& blueprint)
   14867              :         {
   14868              :             router_.register_blueprint(blueprint);
   14869              :             return *this;
   14870              :         }
   14871              : 
   14872              :         /// \brief Set the function to call to handle uncaught exceptions generated in routes (Default generates error 500).
   14873              :         ///
   14874              :         /// The function must have the following signature: void(crow::response&).
   14875              :         /// It must set the response passed in argument to the function, which will be sent back to the client.
   14876              :         /// See Router::default_exception_handler() for the default implementation.
   14877              :         template<typename Func>
   14878              :         self_t& exception_handler(Func&& f)
   14879              :         {
   14880              :             router_.exception_handler() = std::forward<Func>(f);
   14881              :             return *this;
   14882              :         }
   14883              : 
   14884              :         std::function<void(crow::response&)>& exception_handler()
   14885              :         {
   14886              :             return router_.exception_handler();
   14887              :         }
   14888              : 
   14889              :         /// \brief Set a custom duration and function to run on every tick
   14890              :         template<typename Duration, typename Func>
   14891              :         self_t& tick(Duration d, Func f)
   14892              :         {
   14893              :             tick_interval_ = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(d);
   14894              :             tick_function_ = f;
   14895              :             return *this;
   14896              :         }
   14897              : 
   14898              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION

   14900              :         self_t& use_compression(compression::algorithm algorithm)
   14901              :         {
   14902              :             comp_algorithm_ = algorithm;
   14903              :             compression_used_ = true;
   14904              :             return *this;
   14905              :         }

   14918              :         /// \brief Apply blueprints
   14919              :         void add_blueprint()
   14920              :         {
   14921              : #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__MACH__)
   14922              :             if (router_.blueprints().empty()) return;
   14923              : #endif
   14924              : 
   14925              :             for (Blueprint* bp : router_.blueprints())
   14926              :             {
   14927              :                 if (bp->static_dir().empty()) {
   14928              :                     CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Blueprint " << bp->prefix() << " and its sub-blueprints ignored due to empty static directory.";
   14929              :                     continue;
   14930              :                 }
   14931              :                 auto static_dir_ = crow::utility::normalize_path(bp->static_dir());
   14932              : 
   14933              :                 bp->new_rule_tagged<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)>(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)([static_dir_](crow::response& res, std::string file_path_partial) {

   14935              :                     res.set_static_file_info_unsafe(static_dir_ + file_path_partial);
   14936              :                     res.end();
   14937              :                 });
   14938              :             }
   14939              : 
   14940              :             router_.validate_bp();
   14941              :         }
   14942              : 
   14943              :         /// \brief Go through the rules, upgrade them if possible, and add them to the list of rules
   14944              :         void add_static_dir()
   14945              :         {
   14946              :             if (are_static_routes_added()) return;
   14947              :             auto static_dir_ = crow::utility::normalize_path(CROW_STATIC_DIRECTORY);
   14948              : 
   14949              :             route<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)>(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)([static_dir_](crow::response& res, std::string file_path_partial) {
   14950              :                 utility::sanitize_filename(file_path_partial);
   14951              :                 res.set_static_file_info_unsafe(static_dir_ + file_path_partial);
   14952              :                 res.end();
   14953              :             });
   14954              :             set_static_routes_added();
