   14956              : 
   14957              :         /// \brief A wrapper for `validate()` in the router
   14958              :         void validate()
   14959              :         {
   14960              :             router_.validate();
   14961              :         }
   14962              : 
   14963              :         /// \brief Run the server
   14964              :         void run()
   14965              :         {
   14966              : #ifndef CROW_DISABLE_STATIC_DIR
   14967              :             add_blueprint();
   14968              :             add_static_dir();
   14969              : #endif
   14970              :             validate();
   14971              : 
   14972              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   14973              :             if (ssl_used_)
   14974              :             {
   14975              : 
   14976              :                 error_code ec;
   14977              :                 asio::ip::address addr = asio::ip::make_address(bindaddr_,ec);
   14978              :                 if (ec){
   14979              :                     CROW_LOG_ERROR << ec.message() << " - Can not create valid ip address from string: \"" << bindaddr_ << "\"";
   14980              :                     return;
   14981              :                 }
   14982              :                 tcp::endpoint endpoint(addr, port_);
   14983              :                 router_.using_ssl = true;
   14984              :                 ssl_server_ = std::move(std::unique_ptr<ssl_server_t>(new ssl_server_t(this, endpoint, server_name_, &middlewares_, concurrency_, timeout_, &ssl_context_)));
   14985              :                 ssl_server_->set_tick_function(tick_interval_, tick_function_);
   14986              :                 ssl_server_->signal_clear();
   14987              :                 for (auto snum : signals_)
   14988              :                 {
   14989              :                     ssl_server_->signal_add(snum);
   14990              :                 }
   14991              :                 notify_server_start();
   14992              :                 ssl_server_->run();
   14993              :             }
   14994              :             else
   14995              : #endif
   14996              :             {
   14997              :                 if (use_unix_)
   14998              :                 {
   14999              :                     UnixSocketAcceptor::endpoint endpoint(bindaddr_);

   15003              :                     {
   15004              :                         unix_server_->signal_add(snum);
   15005              :                     }
   15006              :                     notify_server_start();
   15007              :                     unix_server_->run();
   15008              :                 }
   15009              :                 else
   15010              :                 {
   15011              :                     error_code ec;
   15012              :                     asio::ip::address addr = asio::ip::make_address(bindaddr_,ec);
   15013              :                     if (ec){
   15014              :                         CROW_LOG_ERROR << ec.message() << " - Can not create valid ip address from string: \"" << bindaddr_ << "\"";
   15015              :                         return;
   15016              :                     }
   15017              :                     TCPAcceptor::endpoint endpoint(addr, port_);

   15019              :                     server_->set_tick_function(tick_interval_, tick_function_);

   15021              :                     {
   15022              :                         server_->signal_add(snum);
   15023              :                     }
   15024              :                     notify_server_start();

   15026              :                 }
   15027              :             }
   15028              :         }
   15029              : 
   15030              :         /// \brief Non-blocking version of \ref run()
   15031              :         ///
   15032              :         /// The output from this method needs to be saved into a variable!
   15033              :         /// Otherwise the call will be made on the same thread.
   15034              :         std::future<void> run_async()
   15035              :         {
   15036              :             return std::async(std::launch::async, [&] {
   15037              :                 this->run();
   15038              :             });
   15039              :         }
   15040              : 
   15041              :         /// \brief Stop the server
   15042              :         void stop()
   15043              :         {
   15044              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   15045              :             if (ssl_used_)
   15046              :             {
   15047              :                 if (ssl_server_) { ssl_server_->stop(); }
   15048              :             }
   15049              :             else
   15050              : #endif
   15051              :             {
   15052              :                 close_websockets();
   15053              :                 if (server_) { server_->stop(); }
   15054              :                 if (unix_server_) { unix_server_->stop(); }
   15055              :             }
   15056              :         }
   15057              : 
   15058              :         void close_websockets()
   15059              :         {
   15060              :             for (auto websocket : websockets_)
   15061              :             {
   15062              :                 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Quitting Websocket: " << websocket;
   15063              :                 websocket->close("Websocket Closed");
   15064              :             }
   15065              :         }
   15066              : 
   15067              : 
   15068              :         void add_websocket(std::shared_ptr<websocket::connection> conn)
   15069              :         {
   15070              :             websockets_.push_back(conn);
   15071              :         }
   15072              : 
   15073              :         void remove_websocket(std::shared_ptr<websocket::connection> conn)
   15074              :         {
   15075              :             websockets_.erase(std::remove(websockets_.begin(), websockets_.end(), conn), websockets_.end());
   15076              :         }
   15077              : 
   15078              :         /// \brief Print the routing paths defined for each HTTP method

   15085              : 
   15086              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   15087              : 
   15088              :         /// \brief Use certificate and key files for SSL
   15089              :         self_t& ssl_file(const std::string& crt_filename, const std::string& key_filename)
   15090              :         {
   15091              :             ssl_used_ = true;
   15092              :             ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_peer);
   15093              :             ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_client_once);
   15094              :             ssl_context_.use_certificate_file(crt_filename, ssl_context_t::pem);
   15095              :             ssl_context_.use_private_key_file(key_filename, ssl_context_t::pem);
   15096              :             ssl_context_.set_options(
   15097              :               asio::ssl::context::default_workarounds | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv2 | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv3);
   15098              :             return *this;
   15099              :         }
   15100              : 
   15101              :         /// \brief Use `.pem` file for SSL
   15102              :         self_t& ssl_file(const std::string& pem_filename)
   15103              :         {
   15104              :             ssl_used_ = true;
   15105              :             ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_peer);
   15106              :             ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_client_once);
   15107              :             ssl_context_.load_verify_file(pem_filename);
   15108              :             ssl_context_.set_options(
   15109              :               asio::ssl::context::default_workarounds | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv2 | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv3);
   15110              :             return *this;
   15111              :         }
   15112              : 
   15113              :         /// \brief Use certificate chain and key files for SSL
   15114              :         self_t& ssl_chainfile(const std::string& crt_filename, const std::string& key_filename)
   15115              :         {
   15116              :             ssl_used_ = true;
   15117              :             ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_peer);
   15118              :             ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_client_once);
   15119              :             ssl_context_.use_certificate_chain_file(crt_filename);
   15120              :             ssl_context_.use_private_key_file(key_filename, ssl_context_t::pem);
   15121              :             ssl_context_.set_options(
   15122              :               asio::ssl::context::default_workarounds | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv2 | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv3);
   15123              :             return *this;
   15124              :         }
   15125              : 
   15126              :         self_t& ssl(asio::ssl::context&& ctx)
   15127              :         {
   15128              :             ssl_used_ = true;
   15129              :             ssl_context_ = std::move(ctx);
   15130              :             return *this;
   15131              :         }
   15132              : 
   15133              :         bool ssl_used() const
   15134              :         {

   15138              : 
   15139              :         template<typename T, typename... Remain>
   15140              :         self_t& ssl_file(T&&, Remain&&...)
   15141              :         {
   15142              :             // We can't call .ssl() member function unless CROW_ENABLE_SSL is defined.
   15143              :             static_assert(
   15144              :               // make static_assert dependent to T; always false
   15145              :               std::is_base_of<T, void>::value,
   15146              :               "Define CROW_ENABLE_SSL to enable ssl support.");
   15147              :             return *this;
   15148              :         }
   15149              : 
   15150              :         template<typename T, typename... Remain>
   15151              :         self_t& ssl_chainfile(T&&, Remain&&...)
   15152              :         {
   15153              :             // We can't call .ssl() member function unless CROW_ENABLE_SSL is defined.
   15154              :             static_assert(
   15155              :               // make static_assert dependent to T; always false
   15156              :               std::is_base_of<T, void>::value,
   15157              :               "Define CROW_ENABLE_SSL to enable ssl support.");
   15158              :             return *this;
   15159              :         }
   15160              : 
   15161              :         template<typename T>
   15162              :         self_t& ssl(T&&)
   15163              :         {
   15164              :             // We can't call .ssl() member function unless CROW_ENABLE_SSL is defined.
   15165              :             static_assert(
   15166              :               // make static_assert dependent to T; always false
   15167              :               std::is_base_of<T, void>::value,
   15168              :               "Define CROW_ENABLE_SSL to enable ssl support.");
   15169              :             return *this;
   15170              :         }
   15171              : 
   15172              :         bool ssl_used() const
   15173              :         {
   15174              :             return false;
   15175              :         }

   15177              : 
   15178              :         // middleware
   15179              :         using context_t = detail::context<Middlewares...>;
   15180              :         using mw_container_t = std::tuple<Middlewares...>;
   15181              :         template<typename T>
   15182              :         typename T::context& get_context(const request& req)
   15183              :         {
   15184              :             static_assert(black_magic::contains<T, Middlewares...>::value, "App doesn't have the specified middleware type.");
   15185              :             auto& ctx = *reinterpret_cast<context_t*>(req.middleware_context);
   15186              :             return ctx.template get<T>();
   15187              :         }
   15188              : 
   15189              :         template<typename T>
   15190              :         T& get_middleware()
   15191              :         {
   15192              :             return utility::get_element_by_type<T, Middlewares...>(middlewares_);
   15193              :         }
   15194              : 
   15195              :         /// \brief Wait until the server has properly started
   15196              :         std::cv_status wait_for_server_start(std::chrono::milliseconds wait_timeout = std::chrono::milliseconds(3000))
   15197              :         {
   15198              :             std::cv_status status = std::cv_status::no_timeout;
   15199              :             auto wait_until = std::chrono::steady_clock::now() + wait_timeout;
   15200              :             {
   15201              :                 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
   15202              :                 while (!server_started_ && (status == std::cv_status::no_timeout))
   15203              :                 {
   15204              :                     status = cv_started_.wait_until(lock, wait_until);
   15205              :                 }
   15206              :             }
   15207              :             if (status == std::cv_status::no_timeout)
   15208              :             {
   15209              :                 if (server_) {
   15210              :                     status = server_->wait_for_start(wait_until);
   15211              :                 } else if (unix_server_) {
   15212              :                     status = unix_server_->wait_for_start(wait_until);
   15213              :                 }
   15214              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   15215              :                 else if (ssl_server_)
   15216              :                 {
   15217              :                     status = ssl_server_->wait_for_start(wait_until);
   15218              :                 }
   15219              : #endif
   15220              :             }
   15221              :             return status;
   15222              :         }
   15223              : 
   15224              :     private:
   15225              :         template<typename... Ts>
   15226              :         std::tuple<Middlewares...> make_middleware_tuple(Ts&&... ts)
   15227              :         {
   15228              :             auto fwd = std::forward_as_tuple((ts)...);
   15229              :             return std::make_tuple(
   15230              :               std::forward<Middlewares>(
   15231              :                 black_magic::tuple_extract<Middlewares, decltype(fwd)>(fwd))...);
   15232              :         }
   15233              : 
   15234              :         /// \brief Notify anything using \ref wait_for_server_start() to proceed
   15235              :         void notify_server_start()
   15236              :         {
   15237              :             std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
   15238              :             server_started_ = true;
   15239              :             cv_started_.notify_all();
   15240              :         }
   15241              : 
   15242              :         void set_static_routes_added() {
   15243              :             static_routes_added_ = true;
   15244              :         }
   15245              : 
   15246              :         bool are_static_routes_added() {
   15247              :             return static_routes_added_;
   15248              :         }
   15249              : 
   15250              :     private:
   15251              :         std::uint8_t timeout_{5};
   15252              :         uint16_t port_ = 80;
   15253              :         unsigned int concurrency_ = 2;
   15254              :         std::atomic_bool is_bound_ = false;
   15255              :         uint64_t max_payload_{UINT64_MAX};
   15256              :         std::string server_name_ = std::string("Crow/") + VERSION;
   15257              :         std::string bindaddr_ = "0.0.0.0";
   15258              :         bool use_unix_ = false;
   15259              :         size_t res_stream_threshold_ = 1048576;
   15260              :         Router router_;
   15261              :         bool static_routes_added_{false};
   15262              : 
   15263              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
   15264              :         compression::algorithm comp_algorithm_;
   15265              :         bool compression_used_{false};
   15266              : #endif
   15267              : 
   15268              :         std::chrono::milliseconds tick_interval_;
   15269              :         std::function<void()> tick_function_;
   15270              : 
   15271              :         std::tuple<Middlewares...> middlewares_;
   15272              : 
   15273              : #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
   15274              :         std::unique_ptr<ssl_server_t> ssl_server_;
   15275              :         bool ssl_used_{false};
   15276              :         ssl_context_t ssl_context_{asio::ssl::context::sslv23};
   15277              : #endif
   15278              : 
   15279              :         std::unique_ptr<server_t> server_;
   15280              :         std::unique_ptr<unix_server_t> unix_server_;
   15281              : 
   15282              :         std::vector<int> signals_{SIGINT, SIGTERM};
   15283              : 
   15284              :         bool server_started_{false};
   15285              :         std::condition_variable cv_started_;
   15286              :         std::mutex start_mutex_;
   15287              :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<websocket::connection>> websockets_;
   15288              :     };
   15289              : 
   15290              :     /// \brief Alias of Crow<Middlewares...>. Useful if you want
   15291              :     /// a instance of an Crow application that require Middlewares
   15292              :     template<typename... Middlewares>
   15293              :     using App = Crow<Middlewares...>;
   15294              : 
   15295              :     /// \brief Alias of Crow<>. Useful if you want a instance of
   15296              :     /// an Crow application that doesn't require of Middlewares
   15297              :     using SimpleApp = Crow<>;
   15298              : } // namespace crow
